Reviews.Title: “Truly spendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our Med cruise. After much research I chose this hotel due to affiliation with SLH (usually a good sign for a hotel), the location, style and price. It was absolutely perfect. The staff were fantastic, as other reviewers have said, far exceeded my expectations, they were so helpful and ready to assist with everything. Made my mother and I feel really comfortable and welcome. The decor is very lovely and the location opposite the Borghese gardens is just delightful. Fantastic spot for a pre-dinner cocktail on the Mirabelle terrace overlooking the city of Rome and the Vatican...just stunning. Location is good for access around the city and compared to other hotels, it was worth the money. One tiny irritation was the fact there was just one single electrical socket in the room, which I had to crawl under a desk to reach to plug my various eletrical items in and out. But the rest of the hotel and stay more than compensated for this. There is no doubt I would return to this hotel on my next Rome trip and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant accomodations & perfect service in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: traveldonna
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting and the service at this hotel is outstanding. The staff goes above and beyond to ensure you are happy and comfortable. Especially nice is the location to walk to so many sights and shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice for an alternative to larger hotels”
Reviews.Author: Stephenf1
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Splendide Royal are delightful, the service is excellent, and the location is perfect for the traveler in town for business or pleasure. The hotel restaurant combines outstanding food, with a Michelin star, and a breathtaking view of the city. It is our repeated address in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toni H
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, arrived early from a long flight from Australia and they let me check in early, staff very accommodating , room is wonderful, I love the ornate style , it's to my taste when in Rome, very happy with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tcronin82
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a more accommodating and gracious staff. Our whole experience at the Hotel Splendide Royal was beyond our expectations. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone that is looking for the most relaxing and pleasurable vacation in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto!”
Reviews.Author: xbandita25x
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendide Royal for 3 nights on 23rd February 2012 to celebrate my 40th Birthday. The check in went smoothly and we were shown to our room straight away by the receptionist, Anastasia who was very pleasant and polite. She showed us round the suite and then left us to enjoy the complimentary bottle of shiraz and nibbles that had been left to welcome us. We had chosen the junior suite with a terrace and were not disappointed. The bedroom and lounge area were a good size, very grand with traditional Italian style decor and heavy drapes, which were perfect for a good night's sleep! The bed was comfortable with quality bed linen which was turned down every evening. We had 2 bathrooms to choose from with the main having a jacuzzi bath, power shower and jack and jill sinks. Robes and (very comfy) slippers were also provided along with the usual array of toiletries. Every room along the length of the suite had french windows leading onto the terrace and it was nice to lie in bed in the morning with the windows open letting the gentle breezy sunshine in! The room was kept spotlessly clean and tended to in the morning and during the evening turn down and we looked forward to returning to the suite every evening after a busy day of sightseeing, eating and drinking gorgeous food and wine. There was lots of choice for breakfast including, eggs (scrambled and boiled), bacon, Italian sausage, cheese, ham, fruit, bread, jam, tea and coffee. The service was professional but polite. The breakfast room has a fantastic view of Rome and we could see the dome of St Peters in the distance which was spectacular when the sun was shining. We didn't try the Mirabelle restaurant but that's simply because we like the traditional little Italian restaurants but we did have a look and it was beautiful with a good a la carte menu. On our last day, we returned to the room late afternoon for a power nap before getting ready to head back out for an evening meal and a stroll. When we woke, we went into the lounge area to find a bottle of Martini Asti Spumante on ice with some bowls of nibbles along with a card wishing me a happy Birthday which was a lovely surprise (luckily, we had forgotten to put the 'do not disturb' sign on). I guess they either knew it was my birthday from the passport or perhaps the housekeeping staff that tended to our room that day saw my birthday cards. Either way, it was a nice touch! The hotel is well placed for walking to all of the attractions. It's a short walk from the Spanish Steps and within walking distance to all of the main sights. Another reviewer mentioned they had to get taxis everywhere but I think that's either personal preference or down to one's own general health and fitness. We do like to walk because seeing the beauty of the city on foot is what it's all about for us and we walked our socks off every day and loved it! We normally go for contemporary style hotels (we stayed at the St George last time but had a silver Hot Diamonds bangle go missing along with one of my tops which was a disappointing end to an otherwise fantastic break) but decided we would try something completely different this time and we are glad we did. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Splendide Royal. It IS expensive however, we did not feel ripped off at all and would highly recommend to anybody wanting a bit of elegance, splendor and a professional, unobtrusive service. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A good place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Travaller777
Reviews.Content: Close to Spanishe Steps. Well trained stuff. Expensive breakfast (compare to other 5* in a location) Old building. WiFi 7€ per 24h

Reviews.Title: “True Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Aaunel
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Splendide Royal over 5 nights for a romantic getaway in Rome. The experience overall was absolutely perfect. The hotel offers an effective balance between traditional Italian hospitality and world-class luxury standards. Arranging our stay here within only a month of travel was very easy and organized. We booked transfers from the Fiumicino airport, an evening at their Mirabelle restaurant (see my other review), breakfasts and a Junior Suite effortlessly, during an otherwise busy period. As if this would suggest their fantastic service, upon arrival at the hotel, the reception assisted with every arrangement and double-checked reservations. Since they were available, I was even shown around the hotel suites upon request, which are truly phenomenal. After settling into our room, the concierge offered a knowledgable service on attractions and dining in Rome, booking us a table at a few restaurants during our spend including Ad Hoc (see my other review). The view from our room (situated next to the Presidential Suite) was exceptional, looking over the entirety of Rome across the Villa Borghese and Vatican City in the distance. We had a small veranda to sit and relax whilst basking in the Italian heat wave at this time, yet the air conditioning in the room was superb keeping our nights' sleep at a more comfortable temperature. Another wonderful surprise was that Hotel Splendide Royal is connected with the top-end Parco dei Principi in Rome, where we had access to their 7* Prince Spa. We've never experienced anything quite like it; the spa was an incredible relief from the hot weather at the end of an eventful day. It's difficult to sum-up just how fantastic our visit to Rome and stay at the Hotel Splendide Royal was. Everything seemed to fit together harmoniously, so much so that we in fact extended our initial 3 nights' stay to 5. Needless to say, the hotel reception even rearranged flights and transfers to suit. The overall atmosphere in this hotel is not pretentious, and truly satisfies your desire for a luxurious Roman experience.

Reviews.Title: “Splendide service, not so splendide hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYJanet
Reviews.Content: I'll start out with the good: The staff was excellent. My husband had been in contact with the concierge prior to our arrival and they arranged several lunch and dinner reservations for us. When we arrived at 8 the morning after an overnight flight our room was ready for us. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating and really went out of their way to help us. I give the service 5 stars and a huge thank you for being so fantastic. Room Size: I was pretty impressed. Everyone always talks about how small the hotel rooms are in Italy, but I thought our room was average. And now for the not so good... Decor: As far as the hotel itself it was extremely ornate and old; definitely not my style but I thought maybe it would be charming to stay in a hotel like that in Rome. Not so much. The decor was weird; claw footed mustard sofas and think burgundy curtains, over the top chandeliers. The walls looked like they could use a fresh coat of paint. Maybe some people like that, but the decor was lost on me. Pillows: HORRIBLE. I always roll my eyes at the reviews where people discuss the linens or things like that, but I have to say these pillows were the worst. Location: It certainly didn't seem as convenient as everyone else is saying in their reviews. My husband and I took a cab pretty much everywhere. And we're New Yorkers who are used to walking a lot. I think this hotel is way overpriced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katerina P
Reviews.Content: I and my husband went to Rome for weeding anniversary for 4 days. We are lucky because of the snow! Everything was perfect! The stuff was very king and very helpful! The room was perfect with outstanding view (5th floor). When we arrived the hotel offer us a bottle of champagne to celebrate! The breakfast has not the quantity for 35 euros p\p but it has the best quality for much more! The access was great to most popular points in Rome (2’ via Veneto, 5’ Spanish steps, 15’ Fontana di trevi, and 10’ metro station, on foot) We will stay again for sure! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and very welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: BHobday
Reviews.Content: Booked for a weekend break in Rome. Staff were excellent and very welcoming, always charming without being intrusive. The room was delightful, far better than expected, a real treat. The bed was super super king size. I requested a room overlooking the Villa Borghese and the request was honoured. I agree with other reviews the restaurant is good but very expensive, however you don't have to eat there, although the views over Rome are amazing. There are plenty of other excellent restaurants in Rome and the concierge is only too happy to get you a cab quickly. The spa at the sister hotel 5 mins away is fantastic. Beautiful surroundings, excellent range of treatments and massages for 'her and him'. There is no hotel bar, but then we didn't need one, plenty of bars around. We would definitely go back to the Splendid Royal (despite its naff name!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tessi189458
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful and the staff is just excellent!!!!! Congrats you guys!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately its reviewing their restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Scott F
Reviews.Content: expensive to get very serious food poisoning, Bruno the manager called me "a problem" and in a sort of way asked me politely to go away. I have come home to UK, private DR who has confirmed serious food poisoning from your "Scallop" Bruno....thanks for your ignorance and arrogance. What a shame as the hotel looked lovely !!!!!!! 500euros to use your toilet for 45min - hour we even left our 160euro bottle champagne on the table. Disgusting service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Fantastic Staff Easy Location”
Reviews.Author: Lee R
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the Hotel with my fiance December 26th, 2011 and stayed through the New Years. Didn't know exactly what to expect as this was not only the first time staying at this hotel but also our first time in Rome. I searched and searched all possible web sites for choices of hotels with their reviews for weeks before choosing Splendide. Going through the many reviews and photos of all that was available in the 5 Star Range as well as the minimum feedback by a customer being 4.25 or 4.5 out of 5. I was torn by going with a hotel that I have used before in other travels, like the St Regis, but I'm very much happy with my choosing of this boutique hotel, Hotel Splendide Royal. The Staff are amazing. As soon as we arrived, we were greeted by a fantastic young lady, Anastasia at the front desk. She greeted us with great warmth and quickness to get us into our room. She also gave us great detailed information on how to approach our sightseeing and entertainment with a full map, circling areas of interest, and travel time by foot or taxi. As soon as we walked into the room, we were greeted by the cheerful bellhop who brought our luggage in and placed them carefully spread through the room as we had a few heavy suitcases with us. He too was attempting to be quite informative with anything that we needed or would need to make our stay more enjoyable and impactful. As soon as we started to unpack, a bottle of champagne was sent to our room by the front desk just because they became aware of my fiance and I's recent engagement when we checked in. The rest of the staff, many that we came across during our stay, were too all as gracious and hospitable making sure everything was perfect for us. The front desk staff are all very informative and willing to help. One gentleman, forget his name, behind the front desk, walked away from his duties to quickly help take pictures of us in front of the hotel and in the lobby without us even asking him to. The room was nice, nothing to say "oh my god", but we stayed in the biggest superior room. Clearly our intentions for being in Rome wasn't to spend all of our money and time in a luxury suite since we knew that the most time in the room will be spent while we were sleeping at night. But if funds is not an issue, then you should definitely get a suite just to have more room and a better view. Our room had no view, but was extremely quite and private. Room size was fit for a king bed, plenty of room to walk around by two people with suitcases all over, a great sized bathroom with tub, and a walk in closet with a safe. The bed, pillows, and sheets were comfortable. And the maids did their best to keep the room clean every time you went in and out or as you wished. The breakfast on the 6th floor, TERRACE LA LIMONAIA, is a must. Make sure you get it included with you room. It was such a treat to start the day with amazing eggs, assorted cheeses, the ricotta is unbelievable, fresh fruits and juices, and caffe with a spectacular view including the Vatican. This is the best way to start off a long day of walking and sightseeing. The restaurant on the 7th floor, MIRABELLE, is too a great restaurant with fantastic views. A quiet romantic restaurant. But if you are looking for a crowd and scene, its not that kind of a place. The terrace at Mirabelle for drinks and Cigars is perfect for the view before going to dinner someplace else if you want a livelier scene. We had breakfast every morning at the hotel, but had lunch and dinner at other places in Rome. The Location of the hotel was great for us. Close to the Spanish steps, about a 10 minute casual walk. We actually walked everywhere from the hotel as that is what being in Rome is all about. So be prepared according to season and comfort. To the Colosseum took about a 30 minute walk, but you see so much along your walks that the time doesn't matter.The only time we took taxis is at night when we went out to formal dinners dressed accordingly, or when it rained, as the streets get quite slippery to walk on. We had a car service/ driver to and from the airport which I recommend. I highly recommend Hotel Splendide Royal as I will stay there again when im next back in Rome. Its is not a lower "cheaper" rate hotel, but for the rate that you spend at this hotel, it is the best in comparioson. Rome is not cheap by any means, so be prepared to spend money. And for the tours, we used a personal guide and not a group guide. Again, not cheap but the ideal way to see Rome and its attractions as you learn and know what Rome was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Suse R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights in January 2012. We had a wonderful time. The staff were incredibly attentive from organizing a private transfer, unpacking our bags when we arrived and giving us excellent information and advice on things to visit to welcoming us back kindly every time we returned. The hotel is in a fantastic location close to the Spanish steps and you can walk everywhere from here. Some said the Vatican and Colloseum were too far to walk but we thought it was fine and there’s plenty to see and do on the way. Our room was small but lovely and the turndown service made us feel very cosy at night. Bathroom was big and had everything you’d expect from a 5 star hotel. The robes were lovely. We had dinner in the Michelin starred restaurant on the seventh floor one night and although expensive the food was absolutely delicious with impeccable service. Even if you do not eat here, I would recommend having a drink on the terrace of the restaurant in order to enjoy the beautiful view over the whole city. Breathtaking. We never had breakfast as it seemed quite expensive and we preferred to eat out nearby but if it was as good as our evening meal, I’m sure it was delicious. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL, COMFORTABLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MDKELLOGG
Reviews.Content: We loved the old-world, family-owned nature of the Splendide Royal. Our suite was very comfortable, private and silent with a large terrace. The front desk and housekeeping staffs are outstanding, very responsive. The food and service from Room Service were so delicious and prompt it was almost as though they were standing outside our door. We had dinner twice at Mirabelle -- it is elegant, dressy and sparkling. The food is superb and the view of St. Peter's and the City at night is like a fairy tale. Until the Four Seasons opens a hotel in Rome, we will call the Splendide Royal home.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JosephineNetherlands
Reviews.Content: When going to Rome you need a comfortable place to stay. The Splendide is an old fashioned hotel just a few steps away from the Spanish steps.The room was okay, only the bathroom was a little outdated and small. The breakfast room was nothing special but the food was allright. Very friendly and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, older cultural hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgnhols
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located slightly away from the action but I didn't mind as I stayed there during a busy touristy period and am happy to be away from the crowd at the end of the day. Everywhere is within walking distance though; about 10-15 minutes from most places. Rome is a walking city anyway. Room size is fine for a city. I travelled with 4 luggages and didn't feel squeezy at all. Toilet was new, spacious and clean despite the older room interior so that was nice. Staff helped with what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gwillis
Reviews.Content: How can I forget the Royal Splendid in Rome, once I was there there was the earthquake in L'Aquila, I remember we woke up , thinking we were sleeping in a water massage bed....... We stayed there twice. Sometimes you can find affordable prices for the quality and standard offered, it is at the top of Via Veneto, near the park of Villa Borghese, it is a ten minute walk from the tube.. it is not in via Veneto , so it is quieter especially at night because it is in the back. The furniture are very accurate, although rooms are not always so spacious unless you upgrade to a superior or better a suite or junior suite.. The staff is very kind and professional, our waitress was really taking care of our needs and we also remarked this when we left our final comments on the hotel... I would surely recommend this hotel for the quality/price offered, you can find good prices... but often breakfast is not included and is quite expensive... The location is central , close to Via Veneto and the wonderful park of Villa Borghese, we visited some very intesting exhibits there... Of course if you want to stay more central, you can opt for similar hotels near Piazza di Spagna or (my favourite) Hotel Raphael which is near Navona... which in my opinion are in the heart of Rome... Splendid Royal is not a very big hotel, it is smaller than other 5 stars hotel in Via Veneto but has a very nice atmosphere...

Reviews.Title: “Great location ....Great staff...”
Reviews.Author: Dilo-Jake
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Splendide Royal. We travel through Rome 5-6 times a year and always change locations for variety within Rome and the new restaurants you find in the area. Rooms are ample in size and decorated nicely. The staff must be commended as they cannot help you enough. Great suggestions for local restuarants were a big help and all suggestions were top notch. Parioli (the neigbourhood) is a perfect location as it takes you away from the pressure of the crowds but is easily accessible to all the central tourist attactions. It is at the very top of the Via Veneto an elegant location in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “They tried to rip us off and in a way they did!”
Reviews.Author: Bilge K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with my husband for 5 nights in November 2011. I do not know where to begin to write about the horribleness of this hotel. First, they did not allow us to cancel our reservation (we had to cancel due to family and health issues, the time we cancelled was two months prior to the time of stay-TWO MONTHS), therefore we had a compulsory stay to use up the amount, which I think is unacceptable for a LUXURY status hotel. Second, the senior staff of the concierge is clueless! Simply clueless, they have no idea about the attractions in the city. Third, during the check out, one of the senior staff of the concierge(the one with a mustache) tried to charge us more than the price we had agreed!!! Still trying to rip us off, when we showed him the e-mail that showed the price, he did not even apologize!! There were problems with the room too; The wireless was extremely weak, the closet in the room had cobwebs, and there was this terrible noise coming from upstairs -the restaurant floor, which the staff claimed to be empty. Lastly, the so-called michelin star restaurant of the hotel had a weak service, every time I ordered bread and butter, either the bread, or the butter, or both of them were missing! The risotto I had was the saltiest I had ever tasted. My advice; Watch when you make reservations to this hotel, they surely will never cancel it and they might even try to overcharge you!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elia C
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly recommend this hotel for the perfect romantic getaway. The location is perfect and the service and quality was absolutely top drawer! We loved Rome and plan to go back with the Splendide Royal likely to be our place of choice once more.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gibber
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in late September and loved it. It is a small boutique hotel near the Villa Borghese in the Via Veneto area. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was beautifully appointed and had all amenities you would need. Our stay included breakfast which was plentiful and served in a beautiful rooftop restaurant. We were not far from the Spanish steps and although the Coliseum area was a bit of a distance we enjoyed the walk. There is nothing not to like!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Simonjep
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay even though they had no room for us on our 1st night. Their mistake. The staff were very apologetic and looked after us paying for the cabs to and from their sister hotel a few miles away. They even popped a bottle of complimentary champers in our room when we finally did get to stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “I would do it all over again!”
Reviews.Author: danale984
Reviews.Content: Superb service, luxurious facilities, absolutely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Claire S
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Splendide Royal through Small Luxury Hotels of the World (with whom I enjoy a membership) and specified their honeymoon package as we had decided to have only a short "minimoon" after our October wedding. On arrival we were greeted at the airport by our chauffeur with no trouble and after an unscheduled guided tour of Rome by our driver arrived at the hotel which is located at the northern end of town. This is an excellent location for exploring and the hotel makes the most of its outlook over the Villa Borghese. The hotel is decadent (in a very traditional Italian way) in its decor and the reception and greeting rooms are impressive. We were placed on the 6th floor in a room with a beautiful bathroom (huge bath!) and a lovely balcony overlooking the Villa Borghese and the Vatican. Even before our bags were dropped off the champagne on ice had arrived and we enjoyed it watching the sun set over St Peter's Basilica with some chocolates (also complimentary) and the 24 red roses which I had always thought would be a complete waste of time, but as this was our honeymoon and they looked so spectacular I was actually delighted to have. The room was again, traditionally decorated, but I loved this as it was totally in keeping with the rest of the hotel and suited the fact you are in Rome. Also included in our package was breakfast (a must because otherwise it would have cost EUR35 each - something that caught out many other guests we noticed) and a meal in the Mirabelle restaurant which we booked for our last night. This was the most wonderful experience. I have eaten at quite a few Michelin star places before, but this was right up there and the most surprising thing was the portion sizes - they were huge!! The food itself is expensive if you haven't got the meal included in a package (we calculated that our total meal including wine would have cost us EUR400+) and the hotel could make this a bit clearer to its guests. While we were seated, a couple of Americans sat down clearly expecting it to be a simple hotel restaurant and couldn't understand why there were being asked to pay EUR50 for a starter. They left without ordering. The menu is displayed in the reception however so we felt a little like this was their own fault as well. On checkout were were charged extra for the airport transfer which was included in our package, but this was quickly rectified with little hassle and no complaint and we left after 4 nights feeling that this was one of the best places we have stayed in Europe. A wonderful time - just what you want from your honeymoon - and the hotel was a big part of that.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - great experience”
Reviews.Author: BC96
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Splendide Royal during the last week of August. The Hotel is very nice, has a great feel to it. Very helpful staff, fantastic location (5 mins to Trevvi Fountain, 8 mins to Spanish Steps), lovely rooms with comfortable beds (not too soft) and well equipped bathrooms. The breakfast is in a lovely location, the 6th floor, overseeing much of the city, including the dome of the St. Pieters Basilica. It's located opposite the Borghese Garndes, where you can have a lovel;y walk. And just around the corner is the famous Via Vittorio Veneto with nice restaurants and a great bottleshop ! It's not cheap to stay in this hotel, and dinner is the Michelin-star rated restaurant is extremely pricey I think, but other then that: a place well worth trying or coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: VittorioRullo
Reviews.Content: A very beautiful and refined hotel with a pleasant staff. Room did not had a view but it was huge (I got an upgrade) The only con is get back to the Hotel from the Piazza di Spagna...it's 10 minute walk in a steep way

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: mhedleyrob
Reviews.Content: I want to give 4 1/2 stars but can't as this site won't let me. This is a lovely boutique type hotel in the old world style and where you stay if you're not just looking for on tap food, easy access bar, etc. Whenever I phoned reception the service was immediate - must be the quickest anywhere I have experienced. But the price is high - breakfast, restaurant, bar - all very expensive which can't quite be justified. Even so, we felt very welcome - do ask reception for the soft pillows though as the originals are like those the flintstones would sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: griswalds59
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research on Trip Advisor I chose the Splendide Royal in Rome and was glad I did. From the welcoming staff on the front desk to the Concierge and Restaurant staff our stay was made very enjoyable. The Hotel is in a handy location about 5-10 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and in fact you can walk to just about any of Rome's major sights from the Hotel if you are feeling energetic. The accommodation was clean, the breakfast was good with a good selection to choose from and the staff friendly. If you're looking for a place to stay in Rome - the Splendide Royal is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique experience makes Rome trip personal”
Reviews.Author: riki t
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this gorgeous hotel in Rome. Everything about our experience was splendid and underlined the name of this property. We are experienced travelers and spoiled in that we always try to stay at first class hotels. Our package included a dinner at the one star Michelin restaurant and the food was creative and delicious, and as everywhere in the hotel the service exemplary. Our room with terrace was luxurious with sheets that were crisp and a terrific bathroom with double sinks and whirlpool tub. I think what made our visit so special though was the attitude of the staff..great suggestions for dinner, a wonderful private tour guide and no request was refused. This hotel is also in a wonderful location near the Borghese gardens and above the Spanish Steps so it was possible to walk everywhere. I also took advantage of the free use of their sister hotel's new Prince Spa which was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly, personal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scorpioprincess
Reviews.Content: After the long flight from Australia, we were happy to arrive at the Splendide Royale, and felt welcome immediately. The full blockout drapes and quiet room were just what we needed to sleep well and get over jet lag quickly, so we could enjoy our holiday sooner. Great location, great staff, our room (601) was perfect and beautiful. The restaurant on the top floor, the Mirabelle, offers magnificent views over Rome, and, while expensive, was truly memorable and probably had the very best food that we had during our 4 weeks tour around Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mhalter51
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful Hotel-- very close to the Spanish Step and with a woonderful view-- the service was great and the rooms were delightful--

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Paige87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Splendide Royal in August with my 5 month old baby and my mother. The staff could not do enough for us, they were very helpful and attentive, which was lovely especially traveling with a baby. They even put a travel cot in the room for us and made it all up with their sheets which was very thoughtful. The location is just a small walk from the spanish steps, which was perfect. The restaurant was a little on the expensive side but had beautiful views over rome. We were very happy with our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: CandLSC
Reviews.Content: Went here for a special occasion. Had a stunning room with large comfortable bed and lots of period furniture and features. Balcony with fantastic views towards the Vatican 5 star quality but without the stuffiness of some larger hotels in this category. Service exemplary and friendly. Recetion recommend a small traditinal restaurant which served the best pasta I have tasted - al tartufo - height of the truffle season when we went. Mirabelle restaurant great experience but ridiculously expensive - see separate review

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service / beautiful, elegant room”
Reviews.Author: BKB217
Reviews.Content: We, too, spent our 25th wedding anniversary at the Splendide Royal. The service was excellent and our room was beautifully designed, elegant, comfortable and a real haven after a busy day touring Rome. Wonderful amenities included bed turn-down each night, with slippers placed on linen mats bedside. It was just a wonderful and most memorable stay. We are thrilled to have discovered Splendide Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jude J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay somewhere extra special for our 25th wedding anniversary - and the Splendide Royal did not disappoint us. We spent 5 nights at the hotel. The staff were most attentive - nothing was too much trouble for them and they went out of their way to make our stay memorable. The hotel is in an excellent location - in a central part of Rome, but off of the main busy street. Next time we go to Rome we would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Lucky13AP
Reviews.Content: me and my fiance went to rome for a romantic birthday trip. the staff at the splendide royal are the nicest hotel staff we have ever dealt with. they were helpful, polite, friendly and they went out of their way to please you. we had a problem with payment for our stay but they dealt with it in a pleasant manner and didn't change their attitude towards us. we had a problem with the jacuzzi in our room, within less than half an hour it was fixed. room service is out of this world, their food was luxurious. the rooms are faultless decorated beautifully and tastefully. the hotel itself is spectacular and on a great location. definately recommend it to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “Good Room and Excellent Dining”
Reviews.Author: tomoyuki-i
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on transit from Venice to Tokyo as we did not wish to leave Venice so early to go back straight. In so doing I chose this hotel having read many favourable reviews on Tripadvisor and also because, having been disappointed with our stay at Hassler last summer, we wanted to explore a better hotel. We booked a junior suite with a Borgehse Park view but without balcony. The room allocated to us was quite spacious and furnished well having a large balcony with a couple of reclining chairs. They sort of leveled up to a better room very kindly without mentioning it. The lounges are gorgeously decorated and furnished in a Baroque style. Lifts and corridors are rather small and narrow but sufficient for a small number of guests they accommodate. Staff at reception were efficient and kind appearing to be always sincerely ready to help guests. As my wife’s suitcase had been missed at the airport a concierge kindly searched for it earnestly through Alitalia’s lost property desk which had appeared to us very inefficient and untrustworthy ( we got it back two days after we returned home ) We had booked a table at Mirabelle, a Michelin starred restaurant in this hotel for dinner for which she thought she had no appropriate dress and shoes. The concierge talked to Restaurant Manager describing what she wore and persuaded him to accept her as she appeared. However she felt so sad and miserable that we even thought of cancelling the dinner. Good gracious me, when I opened my suitcase I found a shopping bag in which a new dress she bought at Villa D’Este was contained and further found her pair of dress shoes, too! So we could have cheerfully a good dinner. Mirabelle was a very good restaurant beautifully decorated looking out nicely to the city and Borgehse Park. Hassler had a similar or even better location ( Michelin starred also ) but Mirabelle provided much better ambience and cuisine. First a manager like man greeted us and asked which table we would like inside or outside. My wife asked for an inside table and then he said, “We would give you a table very close to the balcony still with a good view”. Quite a few waiters served us very smartly creating good atmosphere for us. The dishes were, like Japanese summer style, all made of decorated glasses. As one of them was so beautifully designed that its surface was uneven and dressing flowed over the plate and then the table on to my trousers. Several waiters came and offered to change the plate but, as it could spoil the food, I asked a folded napkin to insert between the corner of the plate and the table. A lot of applaud came from them, saying how clever I was. It did not damage our cheerful mind at all but back home I discovered that my trousers had uselessly carried a couple of big stains even after cleaning. However overall it was a good stay and dining for the last stop before going back home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, BUT....”
Reviews.Author: Paris_Junkie
Reviews.Content: We booked the "Orange Blossom package" online that included private transfer to/from the airport, fresh flowers,bottle of champagne, breakfast daily, and dinner for 2 at Mirabelle. We arrived at the hotel via private transfer (Mercedes E class with a driver that had HORRIBLE B.O.) at noon and our suite was not ready. While waiting we consulted the front desk re: tours and booked for that afternoon and the next morning followed by lunch at the hotel restaurant. Soup, Caprese salad, and two desserts with begrudgingly good service $160. After lunch we returned to the looby and were told that our suite would be ready in 15-20 more minutes. I waited the 20 minutes and was told it would be another 20 minutes. After informing the desk attendant that we had a tour in 30 minutes she was kind enough to let us leave our bags and change in another room that was ready and move our luggage to our suite when it was availabe . Very NICE! We returned to find a very spacious suite (lare terrace as well) with a bouquet of long stemmed roses and a good bottle of champagne (Mumm). The next morning the tour company was to pick us up at the hotel at 07.45 and we decided to have room service since the restaurant does not open untill 7ish. You may also have the included breakfast in your room(guest pays serve fees... 30 Euro). Our final night dinner was to be at Mirabelle (terrace reservations suggested + first seating 19.30 ish) at 20.00. We were greeted and seated promptly and over the coarse of two hours we were served only two of the four coarses we ordered. By 22.00 we queried our server about the remainder of dinner and said he woud check...20 minuted later he returned to tell us it is on the way...10 more minutes no entree. It is now 22.30 and we had a very early flight the next day so we informed the staff that we could wait no more and left for bed. No credit was offered but our first round of cocktails was comped and profuse and sincere apologies offered and were accepted. The next morning came all too quickly and the drvier was there at the appointed time and the check-out process was smooth. Overall the staff offered good service and the suite was large and well kept by any measure. Would I reccomend or stay at this hotel again? Probably not. There are other hotels in the same price range in the same area (Marriott, Westin, ETC...) that I would try.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly positive...”
Reviews.Author: member63
Reviews.Content: We were very warmly welcomed to the Splendide Royal by the bellman/doorman, and the warm reception continued upon check-in at the front desk with Jonathan - very nice first impression! The hotel is very elegant, and our room was luxurious. One thing that I loved about the marble bathroom - a large section of the mirror never got foggy from shower steam! Overall, we were pleased with our choice of hotel in Rome, especially the staff and the service. However, one afternoon around 5 we went up to Mirabelle for a glass of prosecco. We were enjoying the view and the drink, but almost fell over when we got the bill for 35 euros! We mentioned it to the front desk because we thought that it was an error, but were told it was correct. We are used to cocktails being more expensive at hotels and resorts, but for prosecco, it seemed extreme. The only other negative was the fee for wi-fi - unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Autowoman
Reviews.Content: I had done a lot of research on-line before choosing the Splendide and was very excited to find out upon check-in that my second choice hotel was part of the same chain and granted access to the pool and Spa of the the Principe property on the other side of the Borghese gardens! After a long day of sightseeing, it was amazing to take a dip in their outdoor pool surrounded by Borghese! Even the ultra-luxe spa was open for Splendide guests and while I did not partake on the indoor spa, it was extremely impressive to view. I almost cried when I saw my room, it was so elegant! Beautiful marble bathroom, Etro bath and shower products, and they even give a hand-written card as part of their turndown service that advised as to the next day's weather! The desk crew was amazing! Anything I asked for was met with a "No problem, senora" I even called at 2:00 AM and they managed to book me into an all day tour for the same morning! I also had them book the Borghese and restaurant reservations, as well as other tours for me, all of which were executed perfectly. I was so happy with the service in this hotel, that I actually changed my travel plans and booked a second week in a suite, and proceeded to take day trips in all directions, landing back at this wonderful hotel to unwind. It was an amazing experience to arrive home (it really felt like home!) after a long, long day of traveling, take a bath in the Jacuzzi and take the 3 floor elevator ride to their elegant Mirabelle restaurant with the best view in all of Rome, I suspect! Unbelievable service and food, which I will review separately in the restaurant section. Anyone who says that the hotel you pick does not matter is kidding themselves! This stay is going to change the way I travel from now on...you get what you pay for, is what it boils down to, though many of the other 5 star hotels in Rome had conflicting reports of the service received, and that was a big part of why I picked this hotel. I will definitely stay there again, and would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to others. One last note...my second week suite was only available until the second to last night of my stay, but I had thought that I may stay near the airport as I had a 5:00 AM flight .When the time came to decide that, there was no way I was going to leave this hotel for some ugly airport hotel, and I had an all day tour starting at 6:30 am - 8:00 PM, so I knew I would need some downtime after that. I had the staff move my luggage into a basic room for that last night while I was on a day trip to Assisi. Imagine my surprise when they put me into a suite again, for what I had booked a basic room for?! I was really touched by that.

Reviews.Title: “You have to see it to believe it”
Reviews.Author: gumshoe_writer
Reviews.Content: Bottom line? We loved this hotel. Yes, it charges extra for wi-fi and yes it is expensive overall BUT the room, service, and view were all outstanding. We booked this hotel based solely on TripAdvisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. What did we all do before TripAdvisor anyway?! The room was perfect: the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was incredible (including double sinks, shower, bathtub, and bidet). We didn't have a veranda but we had french windows that opened to an amazing view. We had drinks on the veranda at the Mirabelle the first couple of nights. The restaurant manager was a bit standoffish at first (as another reviewer mentioned) but the front desk had sent us up there, so he was a little more friendly after hearing that. And on the second night, he remembered the drinks we had ordered the first night. We had dinner there the last night. Again, it was expensive, but the food looked and tasted incredible, and the service was some of the best we have encountered. We ate indoors and, although we didn't ask, they set another table for us on the balcony for dessert and coffee after dinner. A perfect ending for our trip to Rome. We booked drivers through the hotel to pick us up at the airport when we arrived, and to take us to the cruise ship port at Civitavecchia -- both drivers were on time and very courteous, and we were very glad we spent the extra money and avoided the headache of airport/cruise ship shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “2010 and you have to pay for Wi-fi...hmmmm, naughty.”
Reviews.Author: newman8or
Reviews.Content: For a five star hotel to charge you €9 per day for wi-fi access when you are paying five star prices for the rest of the hotel is to be blunt ....offensive. I could not believe that a hotel at this level would charge you for this when you are a hotel resident! My other negative point was the restaurant on the top floor. This has to be seen as it must be one of the best views you will get of Rome and had we had time we would have dined up there as it was a fabulous setting. We went to the restaurant to have a drink one evening before we ventured out so we asked whether we could have a quick drink on the (completely empty) veranda overlooking the city. We were informed by the VERY abrasive manager that we could not as this was reserved for dinner guests who would be arriving at 7.30 onwards but that we could drink at the bar inside. The time was 6.00! Eventually he conceded that we could sit outside for one drink, it was obvious he simply could not be bothered to clear the table and re set it again - he was very rude. On a more positive note the room was spacious, almost sound proof with blackout drapes so you have a wonderful sleep, the bathroom very nice and the staff behind reception very welcoming, informative and friendly. My only other negative was that the hotel was on quite steep hill, just a tad too far way from the main strip in comparison to soem other hotels in the area. All in all this hotel is a 3/5, just - it has its positives but really....$9 per day for wi-fi. Come on Hotel Spendide, thats just naughty.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Leeskid1953
Reviews.Content: We selected the Splendide Royal as the starting point for our 2 week trip to Italy. What a perfect choice! The hotel is simply stunning...from the reception area to the lobby...breathtaking! The staff is charming, welcoming, and completely top notch, across the board. We stayed 3 nights at the beginning of our trip and we spent our last night here, and both of our rooms were beautiful, comfortable and offered a lovely view of the Borghese Gardens (it was fun peeking over the walls from our 3rd floor room and then our 5th floor room). While we did not dine in the Mirabelle Restaurant, we did have our nightcaps out on the balcony with a STUNNING and ROMANTIC view of the Roman skyline. The staff at the Mirabelle is amazing. Friendly and just lovely. I can't say enough about this hotel! Regarding location, we found it to be perfect for us. Easy walk to Via Veneto...very close to the US Embassy, Spanish Steps, etc.

Reviews.Title: “we definately will return”
Reviews.Author: nhutchy5
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this holiday the weather was superb. we did a a two day bus tour which included a boat trip for 31 euros each we found this the cheapest way to get around to the attractions then once at our destanation we paid to do the tour this worked out cheaper than pre booking tours. Be warned that drinks and water are very expensive to sit and drink, at one cafe my husband paid 8euros for less than a pint of lager. The ice cream is to die for.Our hotel was definately 5star the room was fantastic , the staff from cleaner to porter were so helpful and breakfast was lovely, the hotel restaurant is on the roof top and has outstanding views across Rome, We will definately return

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service, kind of off the beaten track.”
Reviews.Author: Scohhh
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, kind of expensive, but it was very nice. Rooms were nice, as was the service. It's in an out of the way spot, and walking to civilization makes you go down an empty street. I had a group of beggars shake me down on that walk, so I'm not a fan of the location. But speaking of shakedowns, they ask you if you would like a glass of champagne when you check in. Sounds free, but it's quite the opposite, over 20 euros a tiny glass. But really, thats the only place where the service was anything but exemplary. So-nice place, not a fan of the location

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: Laura1565
Reviews.Content: We went to Italy for our honeymoon and the first stop was florence and I was not pleased with the hotel we stayed in so I was a little nervous about our next hotel in Rome. I could not have been more pleased with Splendide Ryal! It was such a wonderful hotel and the service was perfect! The staff was super friendly and very helpful. We were able to check-in a little early and they even called our cell phone when the room was ready. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a beautiful hotel in a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a wonderful staff. Best buy in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Morris C
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The food outstanding. Terrific location, close to bus line, metro, and the Spanish Steps. It was very difficult to leave this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful enchanting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anil S
Reviews.Content: We decided to hold a family evening reception at the Mirebelle Restaurant in the Hotel Splendide Royal. This beautiful enchanting hotel is located in central Rome and what makes the restaurant so beautiful is it over looks many of the most beautiful ancient buildings of Rome. As the sun sets you can marvel at St Peter's Cathedral and The Spanish Steps in the distance. The quality of the food, wine and atmosphere is second to none, and far exceeds any 5 star Michelin Star restaurant I have been to in London, or that being said, anywhere else in the world. Our reception evening was a great success. We would like to recommend this to anyone who is interesting in a superior dining and evening experience. A very heart felt thank you to Luca Costanzi, Restaurant Manager for making the evening run so smoothly and to Sara at the front desk. We will not forget you and all the help and kindness you offered.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: Milordino
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this beautiful hotel for 5 days at the end of August where we held a dinner party for friends and family. The service from the hotel staff and the restaurant was simply outstanding! The staff is highly trained and extremely professional and the food at the Mirabelle is just one of a kind, unique and sophisticated. The restaurant manager is a brilliant metre assisting us with all our demanding requests. All our guests were highly impressed with everything they have experienced. We strongly recommend this fantastic hotel and restaurant if you are after a unique experience of Rome including breathtaking views over the city, impossible to find anywhere else. We also recommend to make use - free of charge - of the super modern spa at twin hotel Parco dei Principi The Splendid Royal is a gem not to be missed and we will definitively go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Angeline C
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful from beginning to end. We arrived early on an overnight flight from Singapore and our room was not yet ready so we were directed to the breakfast restaurant where we were meet by smiling faces, delicious coffee and the most amazing view of Rome over the tree tops of the Borghese Gardens (our only gripe is that, although we booked directly with the hotel, we were not offered to have breakfast included in our room rate which did niggle us!). We had a spacious and extremely quiet and comfortable room and were very impressed with the level of service and care which we found in all the staff we met. Special mention MUST go to Ivan and Jonathon for their fabulous restaurant recommendations and assistance in arranging, guides, a day trip to the Tivoli Gardens and lunch at Sybylla (a great thing to do on Sunday when most of Rome is closed). We are mad foodies and wanted to avoid tourist restaurants and they were spot on in where they directed us to go. Yes you can walk everywhere you want to in Rome from the hotel and we did. Having the gardens across the road is a treat too. We could not recommend this hotel more highly!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique gem steps from the Borghese Gardens”
Reviews.Author: Carol-on-the-Go
Reviews.Content: If you only get to Rome once in your life and you don't mind investing in a lovely boutique hotel, this is the place. Intimate, beautifully appointed, great service, lovely view, and near everything without being bombarded by tourists and crowds. We walked all over Rome from the hotel even back from the Vatican. Breakfasts were included and offered a wonderful selection of fresh fruit, pastries, and breads. The view of Rome from the terrace was spellbinding only bested by the view from the expensive, but well-worth-it Mirabelle Restaurant. Enjoy the splurge for one evening. One caveat: don't rely on the concierge for restaurant recommendations or you will end up in a crowded, mediocre tourist trap. Heaven on earth otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Roland G
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our vacations in Italy which last stop was in the eternal city. We have spent three days at the beginning of August, in the most charming and enchanting Hotel in Italy, the Splendide Royal was "Splendide" all the way, since the time we arrived the Hotel Staff was extremely helpful and we suddenly felt as being at Home. We had problem with our lost bags, but the Concierge with great smile infomed us that he would have took care of them and it it was true, as per a magic touch they arrived the day after and my wife was actually very happy for that. They suggested us a great restaurant in the city center where we had a great dinner. Do not miss the Mirabelle on the 7th Floor with its great view and excellent service and food. The Hotel is very centrally located and it so easy to reach the most important sights by walking. At the end of all er had an incredible experience in Rome thanks to the Hotel Splendide and to all its Staff. We will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: ArtFrog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night here after spending vacation time in the country. The hotel was very clean, our room and bathroom were super spacious. The staff were extremely helpful and polite. I had corresponded by email numerous times arranging a business dinner in their Mirabelle Restaurant and airport transfer and they were patient and knowledgeable. I recommend Mirabelle highly for the, food, service, and the amazing view! In 3-4 hours, I walked to the Borghese Museum, the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and had time for a gelato. Also, Our airport driver, the hotel arranged, was fantastic and gave us a great tour on the way for all the major things we missed. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “feel almost at home!”
Reviews.Author: iesmail
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at Splendid Royal and we just love it! There are some areas of the hotel that require a bit of refurbishment - for instance the entrance door... - but over all you will feel almost at home. The staff will do their upmost to make you feel confortable and happy during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: visitorLeics
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a ten day stay in Italy, a week in Tuscania and three days at the charming Hotel Splendide Royal. The hotel is in a fantastic location just minutes from the top of the Spanish steps and across the road from the beautiful Borghese park. Check in was efficient and friendly with immediate suggestions as to which attractions to visit (we arrived on a bank holiday and some were shut), and a map provided. We had two interconneting deluxe rooms on the fifth floor with park view. The rooms are air conditioned and the decor sumptuous. Internet connection is available however my husband was constantly frustrated with regard to lack of speed and the loss of connection which was always rectified swiftly. We ate in Mirabelle (very pricey and we have eaten at a number of similar restaurants!) the views are worth the cost. We sat on the terrace and watched the sunset over Rome - magical. I had a hot foie gras with peaches to begin which was beautifully cooked however the two textures were too similar. Next I had the seabass which was seasoned and cooked to perfection. We all felt that for a Michelin starred restaurant the food was good, however lacked the surprises and depth of flavours we have experienced before. We also ate at Pierluigi a great seafood restaurant (but again potentially expensive £100 for a sea bream between three!). The pasta with lobster was beautiful as was the tartare of tuna to begin. We also ate at Ad Hoc our favourite of our dining experiences providing a number of options including a handful of degustation menus. We chose the truffle degustation with wine included for two at 110 euros and 80 without for our daughter. You need to pace yourself! After a lovely egg plant amuse bouche we had "tasters" of eggs with black truffle, beef carpaccio with black truffle, a stuffed pumpkin flower, and endive all delicious but fair size portions. Next the pasta tasters of ravioli with a ragout of rabbit with truffle of course and pasta carbonara both gorgeous. Next a fillet of tuscany beef cooked medium rare with truffle sauce and mashed potatoes. Desserts were tiramasu, creme brulee and apple strudel. Petit fours followed. All the courses were served with divine wines which were perfect matches. It was hot though and the restaurant has no air conditioning. Staff were fantastic we rolled into our taxi to take us back to our hotel! On the subject of the hotel again, check out the spa at its sister hotel it is fantastic! We spent our last afternoon there as we had seen all we wanted to. Only criticism of the Splendide is the buffet breakfast which I feel is inadequate in choice for a hotel of its calibre. Some mornings items were running out and the selection available is very limited I feel a little more thought needs to go into this area. However, saying this I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kitbed Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: At first glance, I though we had made a mistake. The location wasn't quite Where I had imagined. Although still a very good location. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was very comfortable. We stayed there one night before our cruise and one night afterwards. They upgraded us on the the final night from a superior room to the next best one. The second room was again what I would have expected. Another plus for us was that his hotel offered a gluten free breakfast as I am a coeliac. Liked the hotel but not sure if I liked it enough to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid weekend”
Reviews.Author: Chloe G
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a long weekend in this beautiful city and could not choose a better hotel to enjoy it! We took a Superior room, in fact they are not very large (but I realized that in the historic center of Rome you can't expect very large rooms) and have internal view. However, the space of the room is more than enough to feel comfortable, the bathroom is spacious, and the room and the bathroom are both very comfortable and clean. Beds are comfortable and linens are fresh and pleasant. Unfortunately there is not enough light from the windows in the room (perhaps the other categories are brighter), but the view from the room was not a priority for us because, thanks to the location, the most beautiful part of Rome is just around the corner! The hotel is beautiful, with tapestry on the walls of the room (I had never seen it before, probably for the soundproofing as well as for the decoration), but I guess not everyone could appreciate it because it is an old-fashioned hotel and red and yellow coloured. We liked it a lot because it is just like the "style" of that area of Rome. But, above all, the real difference was made by the staff! In particular, the Reception has given us so much support to enjoy the city in the best ways (do not miss the Galleria Borghese, just next to them) and every time we approached the reception desk and ask for something there was always a nice greeting smile ready to answer. The restaurants they recommended were very good and the advices on how to organize our journey were perfect. It's nice to meet people so happy to talk about their city and the beauties which are to be discovered. The breakfast would be ok: it's rich and of quality, but the prices are too high and most of the choices are "a la carte", not included in the Buffet. The breakfast room is extremely nice with a spectacular view, but perhaps a little too hot ... well, far too hot. We also had a look at the restaurant: a wonderful place! (But we did not eat there, so "no comment" on the quality). Don't miss the SPA and the swimming pool area. After 2 days of tourism we definitely needed a little relax ... They are re not inside the hotel but in another hotel close enough to the Splendid. We went on foot (less than 20 minutes through the park of Villa Borghese, I highly recommend this kind of walk) and went back by taxi (10 Euros) but we were told that there was also the possibility of a lift arranged from the hotel (I think), using their shuttle. However as we arrived at the SPA we found it much more beautiful than we thought: new and beautiful. Well, breakfast apart (lower prices and comfortable temperature would be highly appreciated!), since you can find it much cheaper in the many bars just round the corner, we are absolutely satisfied and we went back home happy. Back to Rome Splendid Royal will be our hotel! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from Rome...will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: ScottinKansasCity
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, I will list both the positives and negatives of our recent stay at this establishment. We stayed four nights in early August as part of our wedding anniversary. We'd just traveled from Florence where we stayed at another property defined as 5 star. Positives: - The room itself, which was a Jr. Suite with Terrace was a nice size. - The shower was great. - The concierge named Jonathan was helpful - The location was decent Negatives - The "terrace" on the Jr. Suite with Terrace was probably 6' x 4'. After I returned today, I did read the fine print where it indicates that one of these suites has a much smaller "terrace". Wish I'd been given an option, as I was looking forward to this part of the room. - The A/C was not functioning properly to begin with (not because windows or doors were open, which is kind of a cool feature to their system). This was eventually corrected. - My wife, not unlike a previous reviewer, likes additional pillows. We requested additional pillows on our way out the first evening and were told they would be brought up prior to our return. They were not and we called again and eventually they were brought up. - Internet - it's a 50/50 proposition that it will work for you. More on that further below. - The toilet in the bath would inexplicably run for no reason off and on throughout the first night. We mentioned that on our way out the 2nd morning....was again told it would be corrected....and it never was. Fortunately, the bathroom was just far enough away that we could not hear it throughout the night. It was still doing it the day we checked out. - On the 3rd day I asked a concierge about the possibility of obtaining reservations for the Borghese Gallery. I told him 11am or 1pm would work the best. He wrote the information down and we never heard back from anyone. Instead, we simply walked the gardens. - The 2nd night we returned to our room to find a bottle of champagne and some crackers. We were pleasantly surprised to find this right up until we realized it was not intended for us, but for another guest based on the name it was addressed to. We called the front desk and they came and took it away. - The evening of the 3rd day, we received a knock on the door and we were asked for our dry cleaning. The only problem, we had not requested any clothing to be cleaned. Individually, none of the aforementioned items would ever cause me to write a negative review. After a while, however, it became comical. Needless to say, this is not what one would expect from a 5* hotel. After a while, it was as if the concierge staff would listen to your request, act as though they cared, and simply forgot you the moment you hung up or walked out. If that's not enough, consider the following: euro 35 for breakfast buffet euro 9 / day for Internet euro .30/minute and euro .30/page to use and print from the internet downstairs - not that unusual at a Ramada Inn....but in a "5*" hotel after you've paid that amount....really? There are simply too many nice hotels to pay this much and receive this kind of service in return.

Reviews.Title: “Are there two spendide Royals in Rome?”
Reviews.Author: cormarToronto
Reviews.Content: We just checked in and checked right out 3 hours later. We have travelled this past few weeks in real 5 star luxury resorts, San pietro savoy in Florence etc. We found splendid royal on italytraveller.com and did our due diligence on checking this place out. There must be two splendid royals in Rome. The one we experienced is not the one we have read about. Which makes me believe that the reviews are false and put on by the hotel or the past guests are wearing rose colored glasses or have no clue what a 5 star luxury in Italy is? We were greeted nicely, bags taken from the car, brought to the lobby reception. Warmly received and then the clerk proceeded to answer the phone have a long chat then came back to us. Told us we were in their best suite which we knew. And then did all his paperwork and had a colleague take us up to the suite. The room was unusually warm. It had two ac systems. The temperature in the room was to the tune of 25 degrees celsius at 830 pm in the evening. The terrace while lovely had no view but was massive and nicely furnished with dedon furniture etc. We phoned down to reception to ask them to adjust their system to lower the temperature in the bedroom and living room in the hopes it would get cooler. An hour later no change. So we called down to reception again. In the meantime there was only a welcome letter and Internet instructions in the room. No welcome amenities that all the other reviewers mention etc. The maid came in for evening turn down was sweet and then huffed when we asked for more pillows. She came back a while later acting like she had climbed mount everest to come back to our room. In the meantime reception sent up the bellman to look at the ac. He seemed frustrated that he could not help us he apologised profusely. He was very nice. 30 minutes later we finally said this is enough. For the $$$ charged this was not acceptable and we told the manager enrico this and he sent the bellman back up. He went up into the ceiling with a ladder screaming at Pasquale on a cell phone. And was in the ceiling of the bathroom for a while. All we heard was yelling in italian. It was like a Seinfeld episode in italian. He then assured us he had turned off the hot water from the toilet in the ceiling and it was all fixed and it would be cold in 10 minutes to 30 minutes. We knew there was a language barrier and he was being so nice to help and seemed very frustrated that we were not happy and the room was hot. He was embaressed as he seems to be very dedicated to his job. We waited ten minutes and watched the thermostat rise to 25 degrees. So we called Enrico, after some debate and being persistent we stood our ground and told him we were not moving to another room awaiting this to be fixed in the am. He was polite didn't argue and we checked out We are experienced travellers who stay all over the world and there is no excuse for a 5 star property not ensuring there best room or one of their best suites is not in perfect condition. This hotel needs a lot of attention refurbishment and updating to be a true 5 star luxury as rated. It is a 3 star at best. The staff are friendly nice hospitable which is a shame. This could be a great property in Rome but it needs more than TLC. Their website photographer is a genius or a true master at illusion We learnt a big lesson this evening. Never never trust websites and reviews that are all too perfect well written and extremely descriptive. As I am now reviewing the trip advisor reviews sitting in our new cold hotel room they are most likely not all true reviewers but probably a good PR job to drive revenue to the property. Very very disappointing. Cant believe we bought into the PR job.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid was truly splendid!”
Reviews.Author: RichelleAnne
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day early after having car issues frustrated and tired and were welcomed with grace and humility. Knowing that it was our honeymoon we were upgraded and given a wonderful welcome basket with champagne. Splendid is what boutique hotels should always be. Small but with a huge heart. The rooms were large for europe and the location was perfect being right beside the park we were able to walk everywhere. Drinks on the restaurant balcony are a must. Thank you for our wonderful hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in a real 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Brubaker9
Reviews.Content: We are still enjoying a long trip in Europe and have recently experienced a stay at the Splendide Royal and it was perfect in all aspects! From the arrival greetings from a tall doormen smiling through a very smooth check-in made by a young lady, with the courtesy of a nice expresso upon arrival served in the lobby, which is very nice after a long haul flight, to the surprise of the upgrade of our room, we have initially booked a deluxe with view, to a fantastic junior suite with a huge terrace overlooking the gardens with long chairs to relax after a day of visiting the city! During our stay we have also appreciate the relaxing breakfast on the 6th floor with nice fresh food, by the way I disagree with some previous negative comments about the breakfast. But the pearl of our stay was our last night dinner at the Mirabelle, Mourizio the maitre’d was just great and the food delicious as well as the candlelight atmosphere with the panoramic view of the city and St Peters, it was a dream.! I truly recommend the Splendide Royal especially for its romantic atmosphere and also for the smiling staff af the reception especially the two ladies there!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel and service!”
Reviews.Author: Martinj911
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 10 days in Rome and rented the the Villa Borghese Suite. The suite was outstanding! It was truly two separate rooms (bedroom and living room) and a beautiful, large bath with a jacuzzi tub and double sinks. There are 5 double French doors that open up onto a beautiful terrace overlooking the Borghese Gardens. The terrace is very large, completely private and covered with flowering vines and beautiful potted plants. The staff were all excellent, but Ivan the concierge was absolutely outstanding! He catered to our every request and made sure everything was perfect for our stay. The breakfast was very good and included with our room. If you can afford to stay here, I would highly recommend this hotel and the Villa Borghese suite! The only change I would recommend is they expand their room service menu. The food was excellent, but somewhat limited.

Reviews.Title: “Potentially very nice hotel, but we had very bad luck”
Reviews.Author: expataecl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel couple of nights on our stop-over from Amalfi. The location of the hotel is very nice in a quiet street, next to the parks of Villa Borghese, but only two blocks away from the crowds of spanish steps. The hotel is quite small and nicely decorated with old italian flair, just what we were looking for. But for our bad luck, we got the two rooms at the corner of the first floor. Plus that the rooms were next to each other with a private corridor, and the decorations were beautiful with calm tones, minus that they had the smallest windows, no view, and no natural light. Additionally, the lighting in the rooms was so dim, that I had hard time to pack and unpack even at the daytime. The both bathrooms were ok, actually the second room having quite a big and nice one. The strange thing was that despite of all the space, the shower has been tucked into the toilet room. Our other problem with the room was that being at the first floor, we seemed to have the complete sewage system of the hotel going through the corner of our room. It is not very nice to spend a romantic evening hearing the toilets flushed or upper floor neighbours taking showers! One night our teens decided that they would like to skip the dinner (after two weeks they finally had the internet...), so we made arrangements that the parents will enjoy the dinner at the hotel restaurant Mirabelle, and the boys order something from the roomservice and watch the movie. We ended up having a wonderful dinner at the top of the hotel, with wonderful view and excellent food, but at the same time our children were having miserable salmon sandwiches (not even with proper bread!) and non- working videosystem! Our wonderful night was destroyed at slash by looking the disappointed faces of our children. First, I think that a hotel that has a Michelin starred restaurant, should not have such a pathetic roomservice food. Second, we had two minors in the room where some tecnician came to try to fix the video system, with no luck, and we parents were never informed what was going on! We stay at Rome time to time and are still looking "THAT" hotel we feel comfortable with. This hotel has lot of the attributes we like, but this stay ended up somewhat poor. The hotel did try to apologize for inconveniences with bottle of champagne and discounting the parking fees from our bill, but naturally those gestures cannot compensate for harm done. I might give this hotel another chance (and definitively ask for another room!), but this time the price/ quality was not met. P.S Down the road, on left hand side, was a small tea house (can´t remember the name...) that had a very good lunch!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: brewins
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated only a short walk away from the Spanish Steps and the shopping area beyond. Hop-on hop-off buses also stop just up the road, so very conveniently located. The hotel is classy and beautifully furnished and the staff were all very friendly and attentive. The room was excellent, though complimentary wifi access would be a nice bonus. Breakfast, in an upstairs room with lovely views, was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But Attitude Behind The Desk and Expensive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: usc1992
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room with a balcony that provided us with a wonderful view. The room was a nice size and was kept clean. However, we had several encouners with two different men working behind the desk who had a bit of an attitude. One even laughed in my face, then apologized, because I mis-pronounced something in Italian. They both have the wrong personalities for a conceirge or front desk clerk. That said, we did receive a wonderful restaurant recommendation from a very nice lady working behind the desk and the bellman were very nice. We also had breakfast in the hotel one morning and paid almost $60 USD for toast with butter and jelly, 1 cup of coffee and water... crazy! The toast was actually really good, but come on. The next morning we walked down the street and had almost the same thing (we also added a donut) for less than $10 USD.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel within easy walking distance of the sights.”
Reviews.Author: SJH1958
Reviews.Content: a fantastic stay in a great hotel with very helpful friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: DallasTraveler1977
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Spendide Royal. The staff was very helpful and gave us great dinner recommendations. We also enjoyed dinner at Mirabelle. The location is great right next to the gardens. It is easy to get around from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: gerland
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in an excellent area of Rome. Near the Spanish Steps and the Via Venuto area of Rome. We stayed in a Junior Suite with Terrace and had spectacular views of the Gardens of Villa Borghese. Staff was very attentive to requests. Very large room with all top level amenities. Very nice whirlpool tub in the bathroom, which also had a stand up shower. We would definetely recommend the Hotel Splendide Royal. On the pricey side, but well worth the experience. Excellent restaurant, Mirabella, also. Very expensive, but wonderful service and food. Great for a special occassion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jaj_jen
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here and Rome and very much enjoyed our stay here. The hotel is very ornately decorated on the inside, but do not let the decor intimidate you. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was not only quiet but also perfectly located, close to the Bourgeise gardens and easy walking distance to the Spanish steps.
