Our room was quite large and comfortable, and we appreciated the little things like air conditioning, the non-fogging mirrors in the bathroom and the towel warmer. We got two excellent dinner recommendations from the front desk staff, however did not dine in the restaurant. We would absolutely stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it for your stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Below par.”
Reviews.Author: tommymb
Reviews.Content: It may be cheaper than many of the other illustrious 5 star establishments in Rome, but it fails to quite live up to 5 star expectations. Good location, comfortable rooms, but lacks that little something which sets really class hotels apart. Our bathroom had a very unpleasant smell which they tried to mask but were only partially successful, and when we complained about the shower pressure we were told it would be looked at while we were out. On our return we were told it had been fixed, but it was exactly as we has left it. After telephoning reception a maintenance engineer appeared and fixed the problem within seconds, but obviously nobody had looked at it in our absence. The management did send us a complimentary bottle of wine by way of apology, though, which was good, but overall I wouldn't hurry back here. And exhorbitiant charges for wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “An overlooked gem”
Reviews.Author: eyeguy333
Reviews.Content: When vacationing, I prefer smaller, luxury boutique hotels as service tends to be a hallmark and a terrific resource when in an unfamiliar city. This property excelled in this area, while providing a quiet location near the villa Borghese (a beautiful park which contains the must see gallery Borghese, a world class art museum - reserve tickets in advance!). Their breakfast dining room was bright and cheerful, with an elevated view. The hotel is also known for their highly rated restaurant, Mirabelle, which was superb (and very expensive). There is a continous arrival of well healed dinner guests in the evenings. The nighttime view while dining was gorgeous. Their bedrooms are typical old world style european decor, with upgraded bathrooms. I highly recommend this location if you want a quaint, quiet atmosphere coupled with excellent service. Family friendly as well for those with well behaved children (no pool or other distractions available).

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be faulted”
Reviews.Author: torchyPyrford
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and I have to say that we were delighted with our choice. Our room was very large and extremely comfortable, we were in room 419.The bathroom was huge and well appointed. The staff were very polite and friendly at all times, they helped to make our stay even more enjoyable. Breakfast was great and with a large choice and wonderful views over towards The Vatican. The hotel is in an excellent part of Rome with most sights within reasonable walking distance. We will most certainly stay here again should we ever go back to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and wished we had stayed here our entire stay in Rome. Very reasonably priced for a 5 star, particularly when you compare it to the other 5 star hotels on the same street that were nearly double during the days we stayed. Definitely recommend paying the difference to stay here vs a 3 star if you are "on the fence". The location was perfect, just a short walk down the hill to Spagna, and the Villa Borgese gardens literally across the street. Our room was a standard double, and was large even by USA standards. The bed was very clean and comfortable, great pillows. The shower was possibly the best part of the room, two shower heads in our shower, steam free mirror, very roomy bathroom as well. Nice bath salts that my wife really enjoyed. The front desk service was excellent, very friendly and professional. Never once had to ask for help with bags, attendants were always ready and waiting to help us. Come to think of it, I don't think we ever had to open the front door ourselves either. Great job by the room attendants as well, friendly turn down service nightly, but not pushy if you want privacy. We didn't get to try the restaurant, but the view is breathtaking from the terrace. Definitely go up for a drink even if you can't eat there. Friendly staff as well up there, we walked up while they were closed, and enjoyed the Italian hip hop the waitstaff was playing. They were all very helpful and welcoming. The only downside was the wi-fi, kind of expensive at 17 euro for a 24 hr period. It looks like the hotel outsources this to a third party, I'd think they could provide this service cheaper. If you need internet plan on spending an additional 17e per day. Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel we greatly enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IrelandVoyager
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to stay here for 3 nights, it has a wonderful location beside the Borgese Gardens and a short downhill walk to the Spanish Steps. Terrific, helpful, friendly staff and a lovely breakfast with an excellent cappuccino it was a perfect start to the day. We didn't get a chance to enjoy Mirabelle but the room looked gorgeous and the views stunning, something to return for.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent hotel with excellent staff. I will definetely go back again!!”
Reviews.Author: lindaRethymnon
Reviews.Content: a luxury hotel in a great location! silent area, very clean rooms, extremely polite staff, very good breakfast everything was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful way to start a trip!”
Reviews.Author: trailrider45
Reviews.Content: Rome and the Hotel Splendide was the first stop on a riding tour of Italy and it was an incredible experience! Everything was just perfect from the location(right by the Borghese Gardens) to my elegant room. I had a small balcony and could have my morning coffee and look over the rooftops of Rome. The Hotel is elegant yet warm and friendly with a staff that was always helpful. The breakfast was on the rooftop which made starting the day an experience, again coffee looking over the views of Rome. I got to use the spa at the "sister"hotel and it was a delightful way to spend my last afternoon. It was only a quick taxi away but well worth the visit! Molto Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheKiwiWanderers
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Rome was made most enjoyable by the excellent service, the location and the comfort of the hotel. From front desk, to house keeping, to the restaurant, the staff was welcoming and attentive. The hotel is within minutes of the Spanish Steps and some of the best shopping in Rome. It is within comfortable walking distance to a number of attractions and very close to the Metro. It is the comfort of the hotel that made it really special for us. The beds, along with the pillow menu made it a wonderful haven to return to after a long day of sight seeing. Our terrace was an ideal place from which to enjoy the beautiful view of the gardens, sip a glass of wine or just fall asleep in the comfortable outdoor furniture. The Splendide Royal is a hotel to enjoy and remember.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel near Villa Borghese”
Reviews.Author: bookwormamp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days at the Spledide Royal before launching off on an Insight tour of Italy. (No, the Spledide Royal was not one of the Insight hotels; we wanted to stay in a 5 star hotel before we joined the tour. BUT the hotels that Insight used were very nice). The staff at the Splendide were very friendly and helpful. The room was beuatifual and the included breakfast was the best of all the breakfasts we had during out 2+ week stay in Italy. When we return to Rome, we will surely stay at the Splendide Royal again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RintintinPraha
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have spent weekend in this hotel. The hotel is very romantic but I believe it needs some renovation and also for the price it could have provided a bit better services. The gym is small and there is no swimming pool. Our bathroom was a bit smelly and jacuzzi did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely One Of The Best”
Reviews.Author: atdepth
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Rome and we stayed at the Hotel for our wedding anniversary. We had a Jr. Suite with a terrace and the room was just fantastic. The hotel is lovely with just an edge of age, in fact doesn't a little crack above a baseboard add just a bit of romantic charm! The staff is extremely professional and at the ready to assist - whatever the need. The dinner at Mirabelle was truly an exceptional experience; the staff attentive but unobtrusive, the food exceptionally prepared and presented, Rome is cast before you in ever-changing hues as the sun sets... This is a must stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well locatred, well managed and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: prichett
Reviews.Content: We will return, the front desk was attentive and helpful, the food excellent, and the rooms comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place with fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: fcocco
Reviews.Content: I have discovered the Splendide on the internet and I can confirm that all the reviews that have explained that the service is one of the best surprise are trully a reality! The Hotel itself is beautiful, with the atmosphere of a great Roman Palace but it is small and warmly welcomed. I like the decoration typical italian with beautiful marble floor at the entrance. The rooms are large for italian standard I have booked with internet a deluxe room with a non refundable and affordable rate which was good value and with the plus of a larger room overlooking the Gardens and a nice bathroom with day light together with a walking closet. In the morning the breakfast is just amazing with view of St Peters fresh food and smiling welcome from Alessandra, nice to start like that your journey. The Mirabelle rooftop terrace is unique, panoramic views, candelight atmosphere at night good food and service, it is expensive but you get a unique and romantic venue for one night it is a must! I will return definitively to the Splendide Royal if I come back in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: happypappy41996
Reviews.Content: Splendor in the perfect location: a small, elegant and quiet hotel next to one of the world's greatest parks. 10 minute walk from The Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via Veneto, Galleria Borghese, Barberini Piazza is a classy, spacious small luxury hotel that may be Rome's best kept secret. The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable, suggesting excellent choices in restaurants and most helpful in every way. the restaurant on the top floor (7th) offers one of the best views of Rome. the ultimate hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: odr15
Reviews.Content: Very well appointed, with excellent service (we reported a minor inconvenience in our room: it was rectified immediately and the concierge arranged something for our trouble). Close to the centre (15 minute stroll), but up on a hill, which could be tiring for some at the end of a day's sightseeing. Not cheap, but you get what you pay for. Would definitely consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a Michillin star restaurant”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugX50
Reviews.Content: We spent the last two nights at this hotel on our two weeks vacation in Italy in April.On arrival by car,the attendance was very helpful in helping with the parking and our luggages.The hotel was a little below our expectation in grandure for a full 5 star and price charged,we know 5 star hotels are quite expensive in Rome especially in central location.Lobby area is limited and not really used by guests. We asked for information on shopping location at front desk and was given wrong information by a young service staff,but luckily it was overheard by a more senior attendant who told us the place we were looking for was close for renovation and suggest alternative places. We were informed their rooftop restaurant,which we saw in the hotel website picture looked elegant with good view of Rome landscape, has recently been awarded a one michillin star . So on our last night we booked a table and enjoyed the good view ,excellent service and great food.Although very crowded. I would dine again at the restaurant but for the hotel, I would like to explore other options.

Reviews.Title: “Royally Splendid”
Reviews.Author: mcjc444
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this 5-star hotel April 8-12 and again April 16-20. Hotel was like its name Splendid. Rooms are richly decorated and well cared for. Location was very good and close to the Spanish steps. The hotel is solidly built and rooms were very quiet. The staff were excellent, especially the ever resourceful Ivan at the front desk. Breakfast was excellent and plentiful – cakes were especially good.

Reviews.Title: “Great great service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jchen038
Reviews.Content: I stay only one night in this Hotel that I never heard about before, I was coming from another disappointed place! I found this property from the internet were I found great reviews so I tried it. Well I can tell that the very young staff at the front desk smiling and welcoming (they all seems to be happy to do their jobs) is the first surprise, in Rome particularly! The room assigned was upgraded to a deluxe room with view of the gardens, the style and furnishing is very italian (not contemporary at all) but well done, excellent quality, room is clean with some plus like the Etro products in the bathroom with Occitane bath salt, excellent bed, I sleep very well. In the top floor you have the breakfast room with good food smiling welcome and views of the Vatican and the gardens, I did not have time to try the restaurant, it's a rooftop terrace, it's seems expensive however I just walked in to see how it was and the view from there is incredible, I can imagine for a romantic occasion. Again Splendide well done and what a surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mashkie
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Splendide Royal couldn't do enough for us. They were helpful when it came to restaurant suggestions, reservations, arranging for taxis and shopping suggestions. They were wonderful in securing my bag which did not make it to Rome from our connection in Milan. They made all phone calls necessary. The breakfast was in a lovely room and the furnishings of the room were elegant. The bed was comfortable and the closet space was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay in a first-rate hotel”
Reviews.Author: WmJones
Reviews.Content: We reserved a deluxe room with view and were able to look through the trees toward the old city wall and the Borghese Gardens, and we spent a lot of time doing just that. The room was completely quiet for sleeping and has the best blackout curtains of any hotel we've ever stayed at. The bathroom is spacious and offered both tub, shower, and two sinks. The staff is unfailingly friendly and helpful. The breakfast is bountiful, and I would recommend a plan where it is included in the fee. The Mirabelle Restaurant provides a superb dining experience. We reserved a car through the hotel to meet us at the airport and were happy to have a driver very knowledgable about the city. Rome has excellent public transportation, and we made frequent use of the 116 bus (just steps from the hotel) that takes one to many key locations. Staff will also call for taxis, and they arrive promptly. Walk to Via Veneto in minutes, but walk to top of the Spanish Steps is a bit farther and requires a moderate degree of fitness.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss - Superb service and very close to the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: gogirl38
Reviews.Content: Just back from a four day weekend with friends in Rome, all staying at Hotel Spledide Royal, about four minutes walk to the Spanish Steps. Our twin room was beautiful, very spacious. I have rarely been so impressed with concierge/reception staff - awaiting my friends one morning I was wowed by the courtesy and care they took of each guest - a particularly busy half hour with guests from all over the world each with a very different request, concern etc - all solved with superpower solutions and grace! Breakfast hit the button and we enjoyed the fabulous views of Rome from the terrace. The glamorous Mirabelle restaurant is highly regarded in Rome and lovely for a drink. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We'll all be back.........

Reviews.Title: “Great attention to details and service”
Reviews.Author: hello23025
Reviews.Content: This property is amazing in Rome, I have enjoyed a recent stay there and the Concierge on Duty Ivan run out is way to assist us for everything, restaurant reservations, museum advises, tour guide, transfers and other information we require to rent a car. Also Jonathan and a young lady her name is difficult to remember I think she is from russia were both very smiling and accomodated. Rooms was very well appointed and with very comfortable bed for the european standard and the marble bathroom seemed immaculate. They have a very nice restaurant on the rooftop terrace upstairs but it is quite expensive we just had a drink with panoramic view and a snack one day, however breakfast served on the 6th floor is just relaxing with excellent fresh food every day. I will certainly recommend this new Hotel it is a true 5 stars property!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and accommodating place!”
Reviews.Author: neversummer00
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Splendide Royal for 7 nights. It's a very sophisticated and luxury place. We found the environment exquisite, extremely comfortable, and the staff were perfection. Whatever we needed - it was never a problem and was efficiently attended to. So do not hesitate to ask the staff to recommend restaurants and make reservations on your behalf. lWe found the location to be perfect - a short walk to a bus stop which is fun and gets you around easily - to every area you would wish. We also very much enjoyed the superb food and drink in the restaurant. A Hotel of true charm!

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: krivenkova
Reviews.Content: very elegant hotel , perfect staff, excellent breakfast , excellent restaurant for dinner with the amazing panoramic view of the city , peaceful and quite. Located in a 5-10 minute walk from the Spanish Steps. The staff was the favorite part of our stay. So willing to communicate, warm and accommodating. Loved the little details such as mailing our postcards as well as the spa items in the luxurious bath. Our garden view was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “SPLENDID”
Reviews.Author: bernardCork
Reviews.Content: Could not have picked a better hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful, always available for information and assistance. Lovely suprise putting champagne, birthday cake and flowers in our room for wifes birthday. Had magnificient dinner in Mirabelle restaurant and again staff sang happy birthday.Stayed four nights. A most wonderful and SPLENDID(E) occasion, one to be treasured. Thank you to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Splandide stay”
Reviews.Author: adventureMoscow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in January, what should i say we enjoyed this hotel very much. We arrived early in the morning and was expected to wait for our room for minimum 2 hours, however the reception staff gave us a room just in 20 minutes from the arrival and has offered to us also a very good, really italian espresso. The room that we had was very nice and as a size was a bit bigger respect of the room in which we stayed last year in another hotel in Rome. The housekeeping was excellent and cleaned our room in any time we was need it. I should not tell anything about the restaurant as no word could explain the breathtaking view from it's terrace. So in few wards, thank you very much Splendide for this beautiful holidays in rome for me and my husband . P.S. Anastasia and Jonathan thank you again a lot for all your assistance during our stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: rdunphy
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome to visit our son who was there for a semester abroad. This was a very special family vacation so I wanted our hotel to be extraordinary. Hotel Splendide Royal exceeded my expectations in every way. The service was impeccable. Everyone at the hotel was professional, friendly, helpful and they made you feel that you were at home in a foreign country. We had a junior suite that was outstanding. I am an interior designer and am not easily pleased with hotel decor. This suite was tasteful, beautiful, spacious with luxurious linens, a fabulous terrace and lovely views of the Borghese Gardens. The lobby and public rooms were gorgeous as well. Even the elevators were stunning! The location was superb. Lovely neighborhood shops. Close to Via Veneto and Spanish Steps. We did not eat at the restaurant but it looked absolutely gorgeous. I loved every single thing about this hotel but my favorite thing about Hotel Splendide was the splendide people who work at the front desk. I was very sad to say goodbye to them. I hope I get another opportunity to return to Rome and the Hotel Splendide. Thanks to them, our family had the vacation of a lifetime. Perfecto!

Reviews.Title: “Lux, quiet, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lux-Hki
Reviews.Content: Defintaly got my money's worth on a 5-day stay in Splendide Royal. I was very surprised of how quiet the room was, slept extremely well. The hotel was 5-star quality. The staff made an excellent impression by being helpful, polite but relaxed (in the good sense of the work). The restaurant is worth visiting, if only for a bottle of spumante!

Reviews.Title: “almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: spaflorida
Reviews.Content: small room with a great bathroom, excellent breakfast, good staff the location is not to good is better in via veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: WMuirhead-100
Reviews.Content: One expects certain levels of service at a 5 star hotel but the Hotel Splendide Royal exceeded all our expectations and hopes. The hotel itself was beautiful, and the Christmas decorations were wonderful. But the service from the hotel staff and particularly the Concierge was personal, professional and caring. For example, when my wife needed dental care, the concierge personally escorted my wife and I to a wonderful dentist. All the hotel staff were professional and courteousness and helpful. Restaurant recommendations and reservations were also made and confirmed with a printed map and directions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to experience service at its best and little found in most hotels today.

Reviews.Title: “Quality in every respect”
Reviews.Author: 2traveler123
Reviews.Content: We found the service at this hotel to be above and beyond! Excellent restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “You could not make a better choice for a client meeting!”
Reviews.Author: pjimperial
Reviews.Content: We found the Splendide Royale through the recommendation of a colleague. We were seeking a venue that was accessible, luxurious yet suitable for a business meeting of about 15 people. All of our expectations were surpassed. The food was amazing and teh service can not be beat. Sure, stuff came up but they attended to it immediately. Also, its location right near the Spanish Steps and is readily accessible to the many key sites to see in Rome. While the entire staff was excellent, there is a young woman named Fabiola that really held it all togther to make it an excellent experience. We would definitely use this facility again.

Reviews.Title: “a nice surprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: likelake
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a central location, well connected to public transports and shopping areas. Interesting lobby, kind and professional personnel, quiet room and the fact that we got an upgrade was "a nice surprise"!!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want an overpriced stay and horrible service”
Reviews.Author: bonzaismom
Reviews.Content: We went on a cruise and ended our trip with 3 nights in Rome. We anticipated a lot, as the hotel had good reviews and we were told by many people that it was a lovely hotel. The hotel itself was in a good area, near the Spanish Steps. When we arrived were pleased as the hotel's decor was upscale and elegant. Check in went smoothly and we were brought to our room right away. This is where the good ends. Although the room was spacious, the window faced a very noisy road. We called to find out if we could switch to another room. We had booked this hotel several months in advance and had requested a high floor that was quiet. We went to eat at the overpriced and uninspired restaurant. I can't remember what we had- it was very ordinary. Lunch, coffee, and tea set us back about $100 euro. After that we were ready to go on a tour. We stopped by the desk and they told us they would have another room ready upon our return. Again, we emphasized that what was most important to us was quiet. When we returned, we moved to a higher floor. That evening we found out it was right above the kitchen. We heard pots and pans clanging all through the night. We complained and were told that they could move us back to our original room, but that if we would be patient the kitchen closed at midnight! We asked when it reopened and we were told 5am! We opted to move to our original room. We were settled back into our room right after midnight. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone. It's overpriced. Fro $500 US a night, I would expect much better service. We felt that the hotel purposefully moved us to the noisiest room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Professor44
Reviews.Content: Rome is our favorite city, and this hotel is located in the upscale hotel section of Rome. Quite walkable to most places. We got a suite and paid north of $700 per night (off season)). The bedroom was small, the sitting area was tiny, the bathroom was decent sized but had a tub that made it hard to take a shower, and the closets and drawer space were not that great. The bathroom was quite a distance from the bedroom. We had an interior facing room/suite so it was quiet, except for hearing the door banging from the hallway. The hotel is nicely decorated--the lobby more than the rooms. Service was not what one would expect from a hotel in this price and quality range. The in-hotel restaurant defines "pretense"--$33 Euros for two drinks (and dinners would be $200 a person). All in all, I didn't see the value for the money, even given that Rome is expensive (and crowded, even in November).

Reviews.Title: “Be royalty for a special occasion”
Reviews.Author: mtemaximo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel cellebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. Its staff allowed us to feel special in this happy occasion and enjoy five days of royal leisure. We've been to many hotels in Italy, mostly small luxury hotels ( I feel it takes a special hotel for a special country) but this one was simply unique.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive.”
Reviews.Author: cassandraBerkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. The Hotel restaurant has a Michelin star and is very expensive. Surprisingly, considering their Michelin star, we were a little disappointed with the food. We only ate in the restaurant once and after that went to other local restaurants which were generally very good. The restaurant is at the top of the hotel and has a wonderful view of the Rome skyline. Also the breakfast room is equally well sited and has good views. About a ten minute walk to the Spanish Steps and five minutes from Via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised with 5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: stevielatphoto
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a 4 night trip booked for my wife's 40th, we were hoping for some special treatment (having mentioned the special occasion on the booking form). We arrived, were greeted by friendly, front of house staff, and we were given our room ( our porter told us, it was a really nice room, on the way there ). Well the view was of the wall around the Borghese gardens, the room was clean, but its overall appearance was of fake antique finish, average size, and with little or no extras to distinguish it from a great 3* or an average 4*. Front of house staff, said they had left a bottle of complimentary champagne, in our room, This never materialised over the 4 days ( we bought our own ). While these all might seem like petty jibes, I have to say that I paid a fortune for this "memorable trip" and I said nothing to my wife, but on the last night, she made the same observations to me. The Hotel is not far away from the Via Veneto, and my advice if you are spending a lot of money, check out the Majestic, the Westin Excelsior, or one of the other 5* on the Via Veneto. And finally, the disappointment of the hotel didn't take away from our fantastic trip to Rome,

Reviews.Title: “Feel Like Royalty in the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: queenuvdaroad
Reviews.Content: The "Wow" factor is high here; This beautiful and immaculately clean hotel, which is situated in the absolute best location in Rome, near the Spanish Steps, was perfect in every way. The rooms are luxurious, with the most comfortable beds; and quiet, considering Rome is a busy city. We loved the staff, which were so friendly and helpful. The view at the top of hotel, where the restaurants and bar are, are spectacular; you can see the Vatican! We can't wait to stay at the Hotel Splendide Royal again!

Reviews.Title: “Splendide indeed”
Reviews.Author: andystassa
Reviews.Content: The smiles, attentiveness, and friendliness of the staff from the front door, the front desk(Ciao Malik), houskeeping, the breakfast room "Limonaia"(Ciao Alessandra) and behind the scenes(Ciao Pasquale), and management (Ciao Silvio) is what made our stay magnifico! The views from the sixth floor balconies, Limonaia and the Mirabella are spectacular! The jacuzzi in room 606 is worth it after a day on your feet sightseeing, although the view as pictured on the web sight is not exactly what you really see. Close enough to the Spanish steps and Galleria Bourghese for walkers and there are a number of good restuarants in and around the Via Veneto just a few blocks from the hotel. Taxi fares to and from the hotel to the major attractions were reasonable and varied depending on time of day and night (5-10 euro). Thank you for making our first trip to Rome an unforgettable experience. AM/USA

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: FiverIreland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our stay in Rome to celebrate our tenth wedding anniversary. I had spent hours researching hotels and facilities as I wanted a balcony and luxury for our extra special stay. Therefore I chose this hotel based on the reviews and paid a lot extra for a five star experience and a better room than the standard. I was sorely disappointed. The room was old and tired. The carpeted floor looked almost thread bare. We had no balcony and our window looked onto a narrow street. When I enquired at reception as to why we did not have a balcony, it initially looked as if we were going to be moved until the receptionist checked my booking and frowned saying, you booked through Expedia, which means you get a lower floor and no terrace! To top the experience off our bed was big but hard and the pillows were uncomfortably solid. Save your money and stay somewhere cheaper. Rome is amazing and quite small, you spend very little time in your hotel any way. I didn't let this experience ruin my stay in Rome but this hotel definitely didn't add anything to what was a very special holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice”
Reviews.Author: EMK129
Reviews.Content: Splendide Royal is the perfect place to stay in Rome. It's a short walk to the Spanish Steps and several excellent restaurants. The hotel itself is beautiful. Our room was comparatively spacious (for a European hotel), with a beautiful and luxurious bathroom. On the drive in from the airport, our taxi driver told us that our hotel has the most beautiful rooftop bar in Rome. It has an incredible view of the Borghese gardens and the Vatican off in the distance. The only flaw was that the bed (like every bed we slept on in Italy) was incredibly hard, and the pillows were on the skinny side.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lives up to its name”
Reviews.Author: JoeFormaggio
Reviews.Content: Palatial room with lovely view of Borghese gardens. Double sinks in bathroom. Shower a bit snug, but okay. Nice breakfast buffet served in 6th floor dining room with lovely view of Rome. Excellent, attentive service. Rooftop ristorante "Mirabelle" has excellent food and service, and a beautiful view, but be aware, it is extremely expensive. Overall a lovely, friendly hotel close to Via Veneto, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Borghese Gallery. Advise you use a travel agent to get a discount on the room. Our room listed for 1100 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “COULDN'T HAVE MADE A BETTER CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: AdrianandLoretta
Reviews.Content: Wed have just returned from a 4 night break in Rome & I was little worried as recently there have been a few "mixed reviews" about this hotel. Well, really if you are thinking of staying here there is nothing to worry about - and if you are coming from the UK, the hotels back home could learn a lot from these guys. First of all, the doormen, reception staf, porters etc are all friendly & helpful. I can only guess that the few people who have found them "rude or unhelpful" forget that English is not their 1st language & translation can be mis-understood. ( A little basic knowledge of Italian goes a long way & the odd "grazie" is much appreciated. ). Our room was very large & comfortable, traffic noise level good. Warning though, check the price before taking anything from the mini-bar, or you will be in for a shock!!. The Hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps - turn left out of the hotel, right at the bottom of the road & they are about 200 yards on the left hand side - and about 20 minutes from the other main attractions. Turn right out of the Hotel & you quickly hit Villa Borghese Park & Via Veneto with its cafes & shops. There is a VERY small fitness room - it's looks massive, until you realise that all of the walls are mirrored & it's only about 6 foot x 6 foot!!!! We stayed on a "Room only" basis, so can't comment on breakfast or restaurant quality - did have a peek in there though & it looked gorgeous, prices were a bit too steep for us. ( € 42 each for main course ) Thoroughly enjoyed every minute here, and Rome is truly amazing. If we are ever lucky enough to return we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Grazie Hotel Splendide. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Great, unexpected surprise!”
Reviews.Author: KevandEl
Reviews.Content: We were really, really happy with this hotel. Read some mixed reviews before we left about the staff but I think that writer must have been drinking too much vino and stayed at another hotel. Everyone was fabulous from the moment we got dropped off until we left. Stayed three nights and had a great breakfast every morning before we stated our day in the City. Food, quality and selection was much better than your average European meal. We would recommend this hotel to all of our friends. PS, our room was very quiet and larger than most.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, nice people, but very pricey food and services”
Reviews.Author: SueandDouglas
Reviews.Content: The Splendide is in a nice position, although a good walk from many of the historic sites. It is beautiful and our room was very good. The reception staff are helpful and knowledgeable. One of the open top buses stops just outside the hotel - but don't expect any bus to turn up before about 10.45! The terrace restaurant has a fantastic view across the city, but we found the service very fussy (some may be positive and say they were attentive) and the food and wine was incredibly expensive. We did enjoy the food, but would recommend other places to eat once you've been up there to see the view!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Expattraveller40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in August. Initially the staff were friendly but for some reason after that the older man on reception glared at us when we smiled at him every day. I really would not know why this was - maybe we didn't tip enough or something! The only really friendly person we came across was the bellman who we made sure got a big tip at the end of our stay. Because the hotel seemed so unfriendly I actually had a slight dread going back to it after each day out because of the unfriendliness - I have never had this happen at any hotel I've ever stayed in before. On the room - Positives - we had a huge suite with a big terrace and comfy chairs to lounge in after long days walking round Rome. The hotel is in a great location very near to the Spanish Steps. Negatives - the pillows are like rocks (I woke up every day with a sore ear) and the sheets are rough. The bed is quite hard as well. Not very 5 Star. Due to the unfriendly and snooty attitude in the hotel we decided not to book the restaurant there and for that reason again I wouldn't revisit.

Reviews.Title: “This is truly a splendid hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GOMIZZOUTIGERS
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I spent 4 nights at this wonderful hotel in early August. I can't say enough about it. Our suite was gorgeous and I've never seen such a huge terrace in my life! Also the location of the hotel is perfect. It's in a quiet location yet only a few minutes walk to the Spanish Steps. But what really made our stay special was the service we received, especially from Ivan. We had a few requests regarding our room and Ivan was very responsive to our needs. If you are looking for a memorable hotel experience in Rome, Spledide Royal is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service, but dull breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BidaLokka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located between the Spanish Steps and the Via Veneto, along the Villa Borghese gardens. The hotel decoration is very nice and the rooms are big for a European hotel and comfortable. The bed linen was of high quality and were changed every day. Pure luxury! We also got a free newspaper everyday delivered in the room. There was not much storage space in the bathroom. All the staff had great customer services skills. The breakfast room is overlooking the gardens, which is great. My only real disapointement was the breakfast itself which is quite boring. It offers not a great choice of food, not in great quantity, and not of the best quality. A 3 star breakfast, not a 5 star breakfast . Last year we stayed at the Grand hotel Parco Dei Principi, which is close to this hotel and belongs to the same hotel chain, and the breakfast was much better, even if the buffet was not replenished on a regular basis either. This latter hotel has a swimming pool , and this swimming pool is also open to the clients of the Splendide Royale for a small entrance fee, I believe. I would recommend this hotel if you do not really care about breakfast on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - considering in Rome - Very good”
Reviews.Author: amadeu1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rome in May 2010 and i booked this hotel due to recommendations of tripadvisor. I must say its a very nice hotel - considering you are in Rome and Italy. You must know the Italians know a lot about food and fashion but very little about hotels. The location is good and walking distance to the historic center with its boutiques and the the Piazza di Spagna. However when you have problems walking then this location is not so great as the hotel is on a hill that you always have to climb when you come "home". The rooms are big and elegant. Just look at the webpage of the hotel and the photos are not misleading All in all a very nice hotel that i can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Neither Splendid nor Royal!”
Reviews.Author: j0yful58
Reviews.Content: We had just come off a 17 mediterranean cruise and were looking forward to our "5 star" hotel accomodations at the Splendide Royal. The photos looked so lovely! At best we would rate this place a 3.5! Royal? Splendide? Now that's a joke! As we arrived early, our room was not ready and the young lady (the only nice person in the place aside from the bellmen) said that there was one room on the first floor which was ready but she suggested we wait until the one on the 5th becomes available. So we wandered through Rome until we returned at 3:30 - where we found ourselves faced with two miserable men at the front desk. Although we had an email with us confirming a king size bed from the manager herself, we were taken up to a room with a double/queen. I would prefer to have called it a jail cel as the bed area did not even have a window! When I called downstairs they tried to convince me that this was a king bed. They then said that they were fully booked and the only other room they had was the one on the first floor. At least this had a window although it had two single beds pushed together. We were not in the room 5 minutes when my husband said "shh, listen to this". It sounded as though there was a flood of water gushing through the walls. We opened the window thinking that perhaps some one was cleaning the windows but were wrong. Again we called downstairs. Were they shocked to hear of the water noise? I think not! One of the men who claimed to have been in the business for thirty five years said to me that "you get what you pay for" and that we should have paid for a more expensive room. I was enraged! What kind of a 5 star hotel says something like this to a client. in fact WHAT hotel manager would say that to any client no matter what star classification. Meanwhile, I meet this couple at the front desk who are visibly upset as well. The woman waves a finger at me and says "hotel no est bueno". Her husband was ripping up his credit slip - they had gone to see their room which was a junior suite and they were not staying. Unfortunately we learned the hard way never to pre pay for a non refundable room otherwise we would have been out the door as well. My husband managed to "find" another room although we had been told that it was sold out and "alas!" it had a real king size bed. The room itself looked fine but again you could hear running water when someone flushed, used a sink or shower. At least this time the sounds came down into the bathroom walls and not the bedroom. You were able to hear all the movement from people above us (at 3:30 am moving suitcases we think) . In short the walls are like paper. The bed was terribly hard. They had to bring in a pillow top the 2nd night but that hardly made any difference for neither myself nor my husband. It was a further joke when they had this paper next to the bed boasting about their Doulce vita sheets which were more like hospital sheets at best - a very strange material which honestly does not feel like cotton. Believe it or not our cruise ship had beautiful sheets and a most comfortable bed even after 17 nights although ship beds are used day in and day out 365 days a year. My back felt broken on the plane ride home because of this two terrible nights at the Unsplendided. I normally would never take the time to write a review but I really think people should be aware of the audacity that some hotels have in calling themselves 5 star. There are so many other truly beautfiul hotels in Rome - we heard from our limo driver that the Eden which was right around the corner was lovely and about the same price as well as the Hassler, but that one is top dollar. The one good thing I will say is the location was great. In short, we are well travelled and truly have never written a review before but we want people not to have to have the kind of experience we had on a holiday. And this one was listed in the Leading Hotels of the World!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nothing special for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ken09Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Found the location fine, close to spanish steps and hop on hop off bus goes from up the road. The reception staff some were unhelpful, asked one for help with a booking for a train and he was most unhelpful, he also smelled strongly of alcohol on wednsday 4th august the morning we checked out. The previous night the older man on the desk was very nice and helpful. We booked room through hotels.com hence the shoebox size room 402 which had zilch view...dark, dull with no wow factor... breakfast was fine, nothing to jump up and down about. The restaurant upstairs, well really you wouldnt feel welcome with the prices and the heavy presence at the door at night, not very inviting and always empty...go downtown for real dinning at realistic prices and a good italian vibe.. On checking in or out there was a very cold and clinical feel..HELLO some customer service PLEASE ? We had nearly 1000euro for this hotel....and not even "did you enjoy your stay?" There are better hotels in rome who will value your custom. also the last night we were awoken by cleaners hovering the room next door...at 2am!! Not really what ud expect from a so called 5 star hotel..... gym is a joke, i gogged in villa bourgese across the road as you wouldnt swing a cat in the so called gym in the hotel.... this hotel is rated highly on tripadvisor, if you are expecting wow factor i can assure you that you will NOT get this at splendide hotel.... Intercontinental hotel and eden looked much more inviting and nicer... PS Rome is a fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay, well appointed, great staff, excellent location, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: moffer
Reviews.Content: While on a 20th anniversary cruise, we stayed in Rome for two nights before and two nights after our cruise. We were extremely pleased with all aspects of the service provided from the moment we got out of the car from the airport to the moment we left for our return home. Just some examples of the service provided.... We arrived in Rome and found the hottest and most humid weather we'd ever experienced. When we arrived at the hotel in the morning, tired and sweaty, earlier than our check in time we were informed that our room was not yet ready but we were given two options. One was to switch to another room or two, they could put us in a temporary room to freshen. Whle we were perfectly happy to use the bathroom and leave our bags with the doorman we were very happy to have these options. We took the temporary room as our original room was larger than the alternative that was ready at that moment. Thankfully we did this because it allowed us to relax and rest for an hour or so as we freshened up and took only what we needed for our walk around the city. We left our bags in the room and the front desk called us later that afternoon on our cell to inform us that our room was ready. The staff took care of moving our bags into our other room so that when we arrived back that evening we found our bags waiting for us. We'd like to thank some individuals who made our arrival and stay so wonderful. Ivano at the front desk who made arrangments for the temporary room and Stefano and Luciano who took care of our bags for us. The rooms on both the pre and post cruise stay were spectacular. The first room had an interior courtyard view which while not too picturesque was fine as we were busy enjoying the interior. The room we had at the end of our cruise was overlooking the Villa Borghese and you could see the dome of St. Peter's from the window. Despite the different views we would describe both rooms (both on the fourth floor) as spacious, lots of closet/drawers for hanging and storing clothes, very well appointed and comfortable with wonderfully luxurious bathrooms. The hotel is located right across the street from the Villa Borghese and is a 5 minute walk to the Spanish steps and Via Condotti, close to all the important sights and shopping while being a bit removed from all the crowds of that area. We walked everywhere as we've been to Rome several times and know our way around fairly well. The breakfasts were wonderful at Terrace Limonaia and we even had dinner at the hotel restaurant, Mirabelle, which was magical. Both restaurants overlook the Villa Borghese so the views are wonderful in the morning and spectacular in the evening. In conclusion, everyone at the hotel was friendly and greeted you with a smile and took the time to answer all your questions and even just to talk. They were helpful with restaurant suggestions and any needs we had were met to our complete satisfaction. We would highly recommend the Hotel Splendide Royale for anyone who is planning a stay in Rome. Arrivederci Roma!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, nice location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: S472
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite beautiful. The decor makes you feel like royalty!! The staff was very helpful and polite at all times. My husband and I stayed in a suite that was huge. It was more than enough room and very romantic...just what we were looking for. Another couple we traveled with had a smaller room, but a FANTASTIC view from their huge balcony on the 6th floor. This was a wonderful hotel and I recommend it to couples looking for a romantic getaway. Btw the hotel is only 5 minutes from the Spanish steps which turned out to be a great location. Definitely worth the splurge!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful caring staff, beauiful rooms great food”
Reviews.Author: trutorc
Reviews.Content: Staff is extremely helpful and offers great suggestions as to local color and events, and is extremely careing. Rooms are luxurious and comfortable offering the finest amenities. Food at Mirable is wonderful. I will be returning here when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, helpful staff, very friendly. beutiful rooms and perfect location. will definitely visit again.”
Reviews.Author: rajarania
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel. Very helpful staff. Did my ironing even at half hour notice.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS A WONDERFUL HOTEL AND RESTAURANT”
Reviews.Author: clipperMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last weekend and we had a fantastic time, the staff are the most friendly & helpful we arrived after a very early flight from heathrow we had pre-booked a private transfer with the hotel and let me tell you it is well worth the money the driver met us in arrivals took us to the car very nice mercedes and he had bottles of cold water for us which was great as it was very hot, arrived at the hotel expecting to wait around for a few hours as checkin is 2pm only to find the front desk staff (Anastasia) had not only upgraded our room to a suite but the room was ready for us as soon as we got checked in which was fantastic. Now what can I say about the restaurant mirabelle it is truely fantastic the food is to die for and the service is totally first class yes it is expensive but I believe it is value for money we had dinner on the Friday night and we were so taken with the place that we tried to book for the sat. night but unfortunately it was fully booked we did have lunch on Sunday before we left for the airport and again it was wonderful. If you go to this hotel you will not be disappointed it really is a gem, can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel wonderful views wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: cryptopera
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this hotel with my teenage son for four nights. Fantastic rooms and fantastic service. A room with a terrace overlooking Borghese gardens is a real treat and views over Rome at night are magnificent.Concierge very helpful indeed. Reception staff always pleasant and welcoming. Restaurant was excellent but as you would expect expensive. The hotel is close to Spanish Steps and other sights. Hotel has a quiet and intimate feel and I would definitely choose this hotel again when I return to Rome which I hope will be very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious gem in great location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyB06
Reviews.Content: My family of six ( four children ages 15-24) enjoyed a wonderful stay at this beautiful hotel in June. We booked three "interior" rooms online, and were pleasantly surprised by the size, comfort and view. We have had the pleasure of staying in some of the finest hotels in the US and Europe, but nowhere have we had more courteous and capable service than at Splendide Royal in Rome. Even before our arrival, the staff helped with planning and preparation of our stay, and saw to our every need once we arrived. The hotel is beautiful, luxurious, well appointed, and well maintained. The location is a bonus for touring, but we would stay at HSR regardless of location. The team at reception was exceptional. They were all polite, friendly, knowledgeable, efficient and welcoming. Language was never a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars without feeling stuffy”
Reviews.Author: TravelswithkidsNY
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed with our two kids (6 &9) two nights in a spacious two-bedroom suite that was beautiful & comfortable for a whole family. The staff was gracious and welcoming, even though we were the only ones in sight with children. The breakfast was absolutely the best we had in all our European travels and the restaurant was excellent with an excellent view. The jacuzzi bathtubs are a nice touch after long days walking in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Lookoutescapes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Splendide Royal during our trip to Rome on our 30th Anniversary. It was quite beautiful and we had an incredible room. The bathroom was spacious and we entered into a nice dressing area. Our actual room was a bit small but quite comfortable. The staff was quite helpful and always accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent decor and every luxury in a small quiet hotel overlooking the Borghese Gardens”
Reviews.Author: Fussyrater
Reviews.Content: At first one might be overwhelmed by the ornate decor of the apty named Splendide,but you are quickly won over by the elegance, style and intimate scale of the public rooms and the friendly staff. The desk decided that the room reserved for us would be rather small, so assigned a different one, which was very spacious. (Pre-pay for a significantly better rate ). Bedroom separated from entry foyer with built in wardrobe and the bathroom by a heavy door. Everything very solidly built and splendid fabrics and furnishings chosen with care and no expense spared. Two outstanding features of the room: the linen sheets are to die for--the very sight of that prisitine white linen makes one want to fall into bed at once--and the housekeeping service on the floor is absolutely perfect and frequent throughout the day and evening. Our room faced the street, which was busy during the day but not so at night and with heavy glazed windows we never heard a sound. Top floor restaurant of the hotel is gorgeous--Michelin starred- but forbiddingly expensive.Room service also very expensive. Upper floore breakfast room so so and breakfast too, extremely expensive. A delightful experience is to go up for a drink on the stylish terrace late at night. Order one of the many grappas, sit back in the comfortable chairs, inhale the honesuckle that cascades down the columns, and take in the fabulous view of Rome beyond the Borghese Gardens. If it's moonlit summer night you will think you are in heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Superb but expensive”
Reviews.Author: MartinDe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel for a 3-night splurge in Rome. The staff were very friendly and could not have been more helpful and our suite was a dream with a beautiful private terrace. The jewel in the crown is the Mirabelle restaurant, located on the roof with what is probably the best view of Rome anywhere and food to die for. Only downside is the price, but if money is no object, then this is an ideal romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unprofessional hotel policy! Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KarinaMilovidova
Reviews.Content: Luckily I never stayed at the hotel, and will never do! My disappointment started from the moment of booking. I was looking for the 5 star hotel for the upcoming weekend with the room with terrace and sunbeds. It occured that the hotel has such kind of rooms. I made the booking for three nights with the total amount of about 2500 euros for the whole stay. According to the web site the booking must be guaranteed by the valid credit card (which is usual when you provide the hotel with the number of your card in case that you do not show and they will have the opportunity to withdrow one night amount as a compensation). Well, this policy is really common at any respectful hotel of 5 stars. But what a surprise! In 30 minutes after the booking I received the sms from my bank showing the blocking of the amount of 835 euros done by the hotel....... I called the hotel and was redirected to the "lady" (general manager's personal assistant). This "lady" was unbelivably rude, she cried at me, interrupted all the time and insisted that I'm a real fool, that does not have any idea what real 5 star hotel is and what policy is apropriate there. I tried to explain the situation from my side. But she never listened, just cried all the time. If the hotel books any amount from the account of the quest 5 days prior to the arrival date, not asking permition for that, it means that the hotel is unpolite and can not be trusted. Of course if the cancelation policy was one week before deposit guaranteed, than no problem! But in the booking confirmation it was written that the booking can be canceled free of charge 24 prior the arrival date. The "lady" cried that this is legal and approved, that such policy is common, and such bookings are done only to proove that the card is valid.....sorryyyyyyy? I asked to unblock the amount or I will cancel the booking. The "lady" said that it is impossible technically..... I asked to cancell the booking. The "lady" said it is impossible too........ She adviced to do all that myself online, despite the fact the at the booking it was clearly written that the booking can only be cancelled by contacting the hotel, by mail or by fax.... So, this "lady" is not even aware of the rules of the hotel where she's working. In any way thanks to this rude dame the hotel lost minimum 3000 euros of income, but maybe this amount is just nothing for such a 5 star hotel. I asked to forward my call to the general manager, as far I could not stand any more the unpolite and rude hysteria. But according to the "lady" the manager was not in the office of course... At last after offering the opportunity to solve the problem through communication of my lawyer with the legal department of the hotel, the "lady" became scared and followed my asks canceling the booking at once and unblocking the amount. Suddenly all the technical impossibilities were solved, suddenly it was confirmed that the hotel booked the amount (previously the "lady denied that fact and offered me to call my bank to find out why they block the amount with the name of the hotel...). Well, hope that the personal assistant to the general manager will become more professional with time and will improve her behaviour, as it spoils the impression of the whole hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel for a truly Roman experience”
Reviews.Author: billiverstravels
Reviews.Content: We chose a Junior Suite and we could not have been more pleased because it was exactly what we wanted in Rome - a hotel that was truly Roman/Italian in its flavor and furnishings. This hotel is beautifully maintained and the staff were very helpful at each stage of our stay of 3 days. The room was very quiet (at the end of the corridor on the 5th floor), well appointed, beautiful bathroom and even an extra half bath which was great for getting ready in the morning since we didn't have to wait for the other one to finish in the bathroom. The terrace was a treat with the sweet smell of the blossoming honeysuckle which carried into the rooms, each one with its own doors that opened onto the terrace. The beds were very comfortable. We did not mind the linen sheets (a nice weight - no blanket needed), but if you prefer, you can request cotton sheets. I'm a stickler about temperature control and the suite had very quickly responsive controls. The breakfast (included) was on one of the top floors in a nicely appointed room with sweeping views over the city, including St. Peters. The selection was fine and everything was fresh. Good coffee too. We had drinks at the Mirabelle (restaurant), but did not eat there, chosing instead to dine at La Pergola. If I were reading this review, I would be suspicious because it is so glowing, but I really can't think of anything negative to say about the hotel. We loved the "splendid royal" as it is pronounced by the locals, and we would stay here again in a Junior Suite without hesitation. I glanced in an interior room without a terrace and would not recommend it simply because it didn't have the same brightness and ambiance as the more pleasant suites with terraces.

Reviews.Title: “Inept and Unconcerned”
Reviews.Author: Alison52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in May and have very mixed views. On the positive side, as others have said, the location of the hotel is perfect - 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps, a 15 minute brisk walk to the Trevi Fountain - yet its position near the Borghese Gardens means it is relatively quiet. The decor is beautiful - Baroque opulence but the general effect achieved in a warm and welcoming style. Our deluxe room (206) on the second floor was beautifully decorated and well equipped. The marble bathroom was lovely with great toiletries, a deep (if narrow) bath and separate spacious shower cubicle. The maid service was extremely efficient, thorough and unobtrusive and the complimentary chocolates stylish and delicious. The 'view' however, consisted of a narrow street, a high brick wall and a few tree tops! Having been fortunate enough to stay in many five star hotels we were surprised to discover that at this one there is no room service available between 11p.m. and 7a.m. - not great if one arrives on a late flight (surely not an unusual occurrence in a capital city!) This is exacerbated by the fact that there are no tea or coffee making facilities available either. Staff on the front desk were polite and generally helpful if a little remote. We did however have a major issue which could have proved disasterous on our final day when the hotel car prebooked and prepaid for earlier in the day failed to materialise. There then followed some tense moments as the staff who initially appeared somewhat unconcerned grasped the seriousness of the situationm - eventually managing as a last resort to hail us a cab which shot us at breakneck speed through the streets, enabling us to catch our flight with minutes to spare - not an ideal end to what was supposed to be a relaxing break! I have delayed submitting this report to Trip Advisor in order to give the hotel a chance to apologise for the trauma and inconvenience caused and, more importantly, to refund the difference between the 70+ euros paid for the limo transfer and the 35 Approx euros for the taxi. To date however, (9 days after returning home) nothing has been forthcoming despite our sending three e mails! To say that my husband is furious is something of an understatement. Needless to say, whilst we shall definitely be returning to Rome, it is highly unlikely that we will be staying at the Splendide Royal again.

Reviews.Title: “Service not for 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: meranda777
Reviews.Content: Very RUDE(!) service in 7 floor restaurant but good food. There was good view from terrace, but they did not let me enjoy it, there were free tables not reserved, but waither did not let me sit there, and i can sit only in the corner :( i was realy upset. At the reception they are not rude, but also not very friendly eather. Cleaning was not for 5 star hotel, they have to take care about carpet more, and hoover it, there were garbage in the corner 4 day in my room, it was just interesting for me will they hoover or not there, they were not. But they change towels all the time. Room was too dark a bit depressing. They should provide possibility for extra light. bedsheet is too hard, after 4 day even painful to move) of irritatin skin changed very sensitive. The hair dryers has very weak cold air function, almost nothing, and when using usual, it getting extremly hot very quickly, so if u go to this hotel u have to take hair dryer with you if its important for u. Plus was on TV they have good choise of channels, i mean even few of russians) and TV was comfortable to use, if u still want to hear what going on while u r in bathroom, there sound seem to be better than in the room) Location plus was that its near spanish steps, but minus that there is a hill to get to hotel by foot. 1 point i didnt liked breakfast because, there were only scrambled eggs in a buffet, all other eggs were extra charge, but realy good choise of fruits) and amazing view while having it, nice service at breakfast. I like this style of furniture, so there were still a little enjoying thie hotel, but with that kind of service its some times hard. I think for 5 star hotel have to improve service, for service i would gove 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent @ Romantic tour”
Reviews.Author: Max120368
Reviews.Content: Something very special - spacious rooms, superb service, very authentic climat in barocco style. Want to be in the center of the historic romance - shoose Splendide Riyal hotel in Rome. A little bit costy but worth it.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: OFARRELL1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents as a present for their 40th wedding anniversary. They had a fantastic time and would highly recommend it. They were picked up from the airport in a Mercedes (very kindly and professionally organised by Ivan on the concierge desk, for an additional charge) and were told about Rome and all it's sights on a very pleasant trip. The room was very spacious and comfortable (but without a view). The bathroom was equally good. They didn't eat in the restaurant as it is very expensive, but that is to be expected for a Michelin starred restaurant - they did have a drink there though and the view was out of this world. A Guinness is EUR 12 up there, which breaks down as about EUR 4 for the drink and EUR 8 for the view - well worth it by all accounts - money well spent. They liked the hotel so much, that I will defineitly put it on my list of places to stay next time I'm in Rome - I hope that they have availability. All of my dealings with the hotel, in terms of paying for my parent's stay etc, were simple, prompt and extremely professional - Grazie mille Ivan !!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that has it all.”
Reviews.Author: EugeneMK
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel, you don't need to look any further, this hotel has it all. The location is PERFECT, only a couple of minutes to walk to the Spanish Steps. The view was PERFECT, the hotel overlooks the park, and the Spanish Steps, then the Vatican, it was PERFECT. The rooms very nicely decorated and clean, and quiet. What really separates this hotel from all the others (and I've stayed in many) was the staff, the doorman was extremely polite and helpful and enganging, but the secret to this hotel is the manager, Ivan. In all my years of travel I have never come across a hotel manager who was so helpful and understood our needs. I felt like he really wanted us to enjoy our time in Rome and that he was proud of his hotel, as he should be. Please, book this hotel and enjoy your time in a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Palatial luxury - at a price but worth it”
Reviews.Author: JODSomersetEngland
Reviews.Content: 5-star luxury in over-the-top, yet appropriate, baroque style. Staff could not have been more friendly or helpful, even researching on the internet an obscure route to a town outside Rome on our behalf. Room was spotless, elegant in this particular style, comfortable, and never have we had chambermaids arrange our personal effects so meticulously, even providing a vase, without being asked, for the rose stem given to me by my husband. (Well, it was our honeymoon!). The views from the breakfast terrace and the Mirabelle restaurant are to die for - we couldn't stop taking pictures at sunset in particular. Be prepared to dig deep in your pockets if you have a drink there or dine in the Michelin-starred restaurant which is frequented by film stars and politicians - but this is no flashing camera bulb atmosphere - it is classy in a discreet, genteel way. The service and food were impeccable. The location is stunning - yards away from the Villa Borghese park and only 5 minutes' walk from the Spanish steps and the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and quiet hotel in the direct neighbourhood if the old city”
Reviews.Author: krab10
Reviews.Content: this hotel was an oasis in the busy city of Roma, it's a magnificent start of the day by having our breakfast on the roof looking over the city of Rome, after that you can just walk towards all the beautiful places you can see in Rome. If we'll come back to Roma we'll most likely stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Always First Class”
Reviews.Author: sport53uk
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Splendide Royal,booked a deluxe room and was upgraded to Junior Suite with terrace which we have stayed in on our previous visit to Rome,I just love this hotel with its decor and friendly service, situated in a very good position with many designer shops and restuarants nearby,we went to Rome to celebrate a 60th birthday and dinned in Harry's Bar which was very good service but the bill came to 609 euro without a tip,not really worth the money would have prefered the Mirabelle restaurant within the hotel at that cost,

Reviews.Title: “dream stay”
Reviews.Author: DevonRomaphile
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to its advert. The room was comfortable and spacious with little touches of luxury - especially the bathroom! It was quiet yet very close to all the sites and amenities. The reception staff were friendly and helpful although there could have been a little more info on some of the tourist sites, especially which ones needed to be booked in advance e.g. Villa Borghese museum. Breakfast was pricey, especially with the weak pound, so we skipped that but I would recommend the restaurant. The views alone are worth going for and the food was excellent. We could only afford a one course lunch + coffee but we were treated well by the staff, as if we were having a full meal. perhaps next time we will save up for a proper meal there. For a touch of luxury this hotel is well worth the price we paid. I would fully recommend it and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jonbert007
Reviews.Content: We returned last week from this wonderful hotel and just can not wait to return. I may be a creature of habit but when I find a place that has it all, why go anywhere else? The hotel itself was simple beautiful. The view from our room was wonderful both day and night. From the moment we got there the staff went out of thier way to make our stay enjoyable. Being a first time visitor to Rome they offered suggestions as to where to dine, visit and and also helped us make arrangements for our daughter who was staying at a nearby college. We have stayed at many 5 star hotels around the world and rate this one right at the top. To me, a hotel can be stunning but if the people who work there dont put thier heart and souls into thier jobs than I can always tell and I always feel like something is missing. That was not the case here, from the friendly doormen right up to the hotel manager and the staff at the fantastic restaurants, they were all fantastic. Thanks for a wonderful time, see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: PeteTurner
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Splendide a few times, and generally quite liked it. The rooms are very nice, particularly the junior suites with terraces overlooking the Borghese Gardens. However like some of the previous reviewers I found some of the staff on reception rude and unhelpful (although some, to be fair, are brilliant). For our last stay I emailed the hotel to book a specific room that we like, and got confirmation in writing that it would be reserved for us ( I did this as the hotel managed to muck up our room request the previous year). I then emailed again a week before our stay just to reconfirm, and when we arrived .... you guessed it. !. After much arguing we did eventually get our room. Our in-room Internet connection failed, and the hotel didn't seem capable of getting it fixed - at one point the miserable git on reception put me through to their service provider !. I requested use of the PC in the lobby and was told that I would be charged for this - I did point out that I had already paid for the in-room internet access which wasn't working !. Again after much arguing they agreed to waive the charge, but it still appeared on our final bill - and I didn't have the time or enthusiasm to argue again. Don't order the breakfast in the room - 25 Euros for a cup of cold (instant !!) coffee and some (not so fresh) rolls and cakes ! Hotel is in a lovely position, the rooms are great and some of the staff are lovely - if they could just replace a couple of the "old school" staff on reception, and be a bit more diligent answering and acting on emails - it would be worth the (not inconsiderable) price they charge. Personally I am going to try somewhere else this year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: magvictoria
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our final night of 10days NewYear trip and we were just delighted with the property! Had prepaid a superior room and on the arrival the friendly staff - Ivan and Anastasia -offered us 3 rooms to choose, including also a deluxe room and a gorgeous inner suite. The interior of rooms as well as common areas is made with a great taste. Our suite was very spacious, with a badroom, a living-room + a corridor with lots of space for luggage and a marvellous big bathroom. I cannot say enough of the staff. They provide the service of very high standart and the atmosphere in the hotel is really cosy. The breakfast is very good, with excellent choice of cold and hot food, juices. The view from the breakfast room is just stunning as well as the view from the terrasse bar and the restaurant on the higher floor. Have stayed previously in many other hotels in Rome (incl. Hassler), for our future trips Splendide Royal will be our first choice! PS Don't miss a lovely restaurant just near on Via Aurora - Vladimiro. The food is great, the price is reasonable. And I am a foodie.

Reviews.Title: “A few details missing”
Reviews.Author: ppap
Reviews.Content: Nice 5-star hotel, some luxury hints, but also some neglected spots. The hotel is facing the Villa Borghese with a perfect view and is only 2 blocks away from Via Veneto. This is not a big luxury hotel. It is a small hotel with a small entrance. The reception desk (also the concierge desk) is also small. The first impression is not very good, because of the small entrance and reception, and also some worn out details at the main entrance and the reception desk (some painting there would make a lot of difference). The room was very nice, with beautiful marble floors, perfect and spacious veranda (will be perfect in the summer). The service was excellent. The hotel is lacking in small details. For The breakfast buffet was not up to a luxury level. It had all the usual staff, but cannot be considered a 5-star breakfast. I was also suprised to learn that boiled eggs and fried eggs are charged as extras. There were only scrambled eggs in the buffet. When paying over 600 Euros a room you would expect that you wouldn't be charged for boiled eggs. It is not the amount that is important, but you get the bad feeling that you are not considered as an welcome guest. They could charge the room 10 Euros more and include all these, not peculiar, things like boiled and fried eggs. The breakfast in general could be improved a lot, the buffet and the environment. There is a gourmet restaurant on the top floor, classic and expensive, requiring a jacket for men and awarded with a Michelin star. The service is excellent in the restaurant. The decoration was a little heavy for my taste, and the food was generally good but not very impressive, at least up to its price. This is a general problem with michelin restaurants. The best food I have had in many cities and countries is usually not at michelin restaurants. The reception and concierge service was good, but could be much better. They looked always busy and I preferred not to bother them with my questions. One question of mine regarding a famous restaurant in Rome (Tote a la Carroze) was in vain. They had not heard of it, and even a search in the internet did not give them results! Anyway Toto a la Carroze (Carroze street near Piazza di Spagna) is a very good restaurant (even if not "michelined"), and a strong recommendation. The cleaning service was perfect, the turn-down service also, although I was somehow sorry for only bringing one small bottle of water and not two, or a large bottle. Again, it is not the amount, but the way you are treated. The location is perfect. Close to via Veneto (5min walk) and Piazza di Spagna (10min walk). There is a gym, but it is very small. One treadmil, one bicycle, one multi-organ and a few barbells. 2 persons are a crowd. In general, the Splendide was a positive experience, the first impression was a little negative, there are a few details that can be improved and my recomendation to the hotel would be to be more generous in treating their guests like boiled eggs with no charge or a second bottle of water every night. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't come close to its gem of a neighbour Sofitel Rome Villa Borghese”
Reviews.Author: Car0lineB
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for four nights as it was given similar reviews (and is currently similar in price) to that of its neighbour, Sofitel Rome Villa Borghese (per the expedia.co.uk website). We stayed at the Sofitel in the summer, and it couldn't be faulted, but this cannot be said of the Splendide Royal. At the Splendide Royal the service was very poor - there was no real feeling that you were welcome, or that the staff were going to go out of their way to help you (it felt like an imposition to the staff when we asked for something, or made a complaint about something). The rooms are very tired, the televisions are the size of a computer screen and the room service is terrible. Particular disappointments we had are as follows: We booked a superior room, yet when we arrived in the room, there was constant noise of water running down the back of the wall (it sounded like water ran down everytime someone from upstairs had a bath or shower). It wasn't a peaceful trickling of water, it was a loud gush which happened frequently. When I called reception to let them know, they acted very surprised.
