I asked to see another superior room (it was not offered), and when I was taken to see one, it was clearly just a standard room which they tried to convince me was a superior one (I confirmed with the person on duty the following day that the room they had shown me as an alternative was a standard room). When I spoke to a different member of staff to the person on the front desk, he advised me that they were fully aware of this noise, which made me quite angry, as the person on the front desk feigned ignorance to me. This person was also very rude when I asked what other rooms they could offer us as a replacement, he merely replied that I should wait until tomorrow and ask them then. I would have thought the hotel would have made the effort to tell me the other superior rooms available for the next few days and offer to put us in there (this was not offered), surely it wasn't up to me to chase them?! The night we checked in we ordered room service, and whilst I understand you pay a premium, the amount we paid vs the quality of the food was just laughable. My husband and I had one main (a pasta and a club sandwich) and a side each (sauteed potatoes). The sides were not listed on the menu so we weren't aware of the price until we got the bill. Whilst I could have asked the price when I ordered, not for one second did I think that a plate of sauteed potatoes would be in excess of 20 euros each! We went to several well regarded restaurants and ate lovely Italian food, but not one meal we had came to over 100 euros (which was the price of our room service), and the food was of a significantly higher standard to the food provided by room service. We were travelling with a 12 month old and as it was evening when we checked in, I asked if they could send up a couple of bananas that I could give him with his dinner. When room service arrived they had supplied six bananas and we were charged 25 euros! I was astounded at the cheek of them first sending up six when I had only asked for two, and then charging us more than 4 euros per banana! Needless to say, I sent them back. The next day we left our room around 10am to do some sightseeing, and arrived back at our room around 3.30pm. Although we had left the 'please clean the room' sign on the door, the room had not been touched. Surely this is the one thing that hotels should not fail on. When I called down to reception to advise them of this, they were not apologetic, the attitude was almost "oh well". They did arrange for the room to be done, but the last thing we wanted to do was sit in our room watching two staff members do a very average tidy up, which is what we ended up doing. It did not feel like we were staying at a 5 star hotel, it was almost like we were staying at Faulty Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night with my partner for a romantic break and lets just say that the Hotel was the icing on the cake!! Situated about ten minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain and about the same to the Spanish Steps and also to the nearest metro- Bamberini. The hotel itself is tucked away on a side street so is not in the hustle and bustle of it all. Not recommended if you want to be somewhere lively. The room was luxurious and the bathroom also. The view from the window was not good but then we were hardly at the hotel to notice. One thing I would definitely recommend is to book a package which includes breakfast. The sole reason for this is the setting- on the sixth floor with amazing views of Rome. the food was good also but the views won hands down. I believe it is rather expensive if paid for seperately so its best to get it included in your hotel price. We were very happy with our stay- comfortable, clean and that little bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay ,fantastic Terrace overlooking Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: CuzArabia
Reviews.Content: I Booked a 4 night stay for our 5th wedding anniversary! Check in was easy and swift! Room was lovely and a good size, it overlooked gardens to the front of the property ,also 15 minutes after ariving in our room , a bottle of Champagne was brought to our room , which i was not expecting, so nice touch. The Mirabelle restaurant and terrace are very classy ,and very relaxing to have drink and watch the sun set overlooking this wonderful city!! The location is excellent, and just a leisurely stroll down to the Spanish steps. The Staff were very helpful ,and nothing was to much trouble! All in all, a relaxing stay ,and would return!! The Cuz

Reviews.Title: “5 Star ? At least it tries to be.”
Reviews.Author: rc3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Italy and a stay at The Hotel Splendide Royal. This hotel definitely has its good and bad points. The Splendide bills itself as a 5 Star and in some respects it is. At least it tries to be. It certainly is 5 Star when it comes to rates so if you’re looking for a bargain this is not the hotel for you. We knew that going in, of course, and on this trip price was not an issue. The hotel is nicely decorated, clean and reflects an upscale atmosphere in all areas. Our room, a Deluxe Double with a view, ($440 EU plus 10% service) was large by European standards and had a small but, luxurious bath. The room overlooked the Borghese Gardens (tree tops actually) and the street (noise level was tolerable). The room had 1 large and 1 smaller chair which meant there really wasn’t a comfortable place to lounge for the 2 of us. We spent most of our time away form the hotel sightseeing so this was no a huge issue but, a small sofa would have a big improvement. The room also had a safe and windows that opened. The bed was the typical European king that consists of 2 extra long twins joined together. If you like extra hard beds (billed as orthopedic) this place is for you. We found as in other upscale hotels in Italy, Splendide offered linen sheets with an option to have your bed made with cotton sheets. It must have been the laundry process as the linen here was so rough after the second night we ended up requesting the cotton sheets (big improvement). The bath, as I mentioned, was small (narrow actually) but, had nice features such as a soaking tub, dual sinks, bidet, towel warming rack, converter plug, big fluffy towels and separate shower. The shower was so tiny you could hardly move in it but, the water pressure was gloriously strong and the head delivered the stream in a soft soothing rain. The hotel has 2 restaurants. Mirabelle on the 7th floor offers a very formal atmosphere but, had a casual outdoor terrace overlooking the Vatican. We enjoyed dinner our first night on the Terrace despite the fact it was mainly for cocktails and light fair. The Management and staff were quick to please and accommodated our request before I had finished uttering the words. The restaurant boasts a Michelin 1 Star Chef and lived up to the rating. Dinner was not inexpensive but, the combination of view, service, food and alfresco dining made it simply magical. Worth going out of your way for. I have to give full credit here in regards to the service. I have been in the hotel and restaurant business for 35 years and it was as good as I have seen. Anticipatory to the point of simply turning your head towards the service staff and they were already in motion to take car of your needs. Yet, unobtrusive. Never interrupting, never hovering. Just perfect! I can’t give them enough praise. I can only assume that Mirabelle was not operated by the hotel as the difference was like night and day in regards to the rest of the service we encountered. Terrace La Limonaia is located on the 6th floor is open for breakfast. We ate here twice and then found a number of wonderful small restaurants neighboring the hotel to have breakfast in. At 35 EU each for an American breakfast we found the food here to be among the poorest quality we encounter in Italy. In this case it’s worth the trip to go somewhere else! Starting before our arrival and continuing through our stay we were disappointed and frustrated with the service we received at the front desk. All except, Enrico were worthless. I had utilized the hotel provided email addresses to email the Concierge ahead of time in an effort to organize some restaurant reservations. I never got a response. I then emailed the Assistant to the GM. No response. I even emailed the GM. No response. So when we arrived I asked 1 of the young ladies at the desk to assist with reservations. She said she would take care of and it. When I returned sometime latter I was told by a gentlemen nothing had been done. The young lady I spoke with happen to be sitting at desk behind the counter. When I suggested he speak with her, he acted like she wasn’t there and began asking me what kind of restaurant I was looking for. On another occasion, we approached the desk to ask for a restaurant recommendation. While no guests were present, the 2 gentlemen ignored us for some time. Finally ,1 of them asked if we were checking in. I said “no, we’ve been here for 3 days. I need a restaurant reservation”. I was then quickly given the name of a restaurant around the corner and dismissed. I decided to look it up on Trip Advisor first and found it to be poorly rated as very touristy. Needless to say we went elsewhere (Pierluigi) which was great. Each time we went to the desk they acted as if we were invisible and they were to busy to help. When they did engage us they were acted haughty. The place was like Faulty Towers when it came to service. A real joke! We saw a portly, balding gentleman in a suit on 3 or 4 occasions who was either the GM or some kind of manager. He went out of his way to avoid speaking to the guests. I guess he has trained the staff well! They all need a lesson from the staff at Mirabelle.

Reviews.Title: “It was unbelievable!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RiaRome
Reviews.Content: It's a very comfortable and charming place. The service is excellent. People are very friendly and attentive. Rooms were great. It was the best hotel in my life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful large room, gracious staff, beautiful view from terrace restaurant”
Reviews.Author: AmoresDiRoma
Reviews.Content: We spent the beginning of our honeymoon there. We arrived early and the staff was gracious and got us into a wonderfully large well appointed room early at 11:00AM. After flying overnight from Phoenix it was much appreciated. We loved the location. Quiet, yet easily walkable to the Via Veneto, the Spanish Steps and Metro. The meal and view from the Mirabelle Terrace restaurant was delicious and breathtaking (if quite pricey) We highly recommend this property and will be sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet dreams”
Reviews.Author: Homeboy86
Reviews.Content: It was our first time when we visited Italy. We spent a week end in Rome staying in Splendide Royal. A few words about this wonderful hotel. The hotel provides excellent staff, very clean and spacious rooms and have a great location with a perfect view. Special thanks to the staff, which are friendly and very helpful everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet haven”
Reviews.Author: playforfoodz
Reviews.Content: If you've got a thick wallet, then Splendide Royal is definitely one of the places to stay in Rome - situated near the Villa Borghese, it's a really quiet tourist-free place with dazzling views (we had a Deluxe room overlooking the villa's gardens) and friendly service, not to mention its chic rooms. Most notable shopping, dining and cultural venues are within hand's reach, but it's worth saying that you probably won't want to have dinner outside of the hotel, as it houses a decent restaurant on the top and a breakfast room that will make you forgo those lazy breakfasts-in-bed and come back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view of Vatican and Borghese Garden with great service.”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysBicycling
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 6th floor in a spacious room (by Euro standards) with a balcony, ask for the balcony, as it affords wonderful views, a great spot for early coffee or a late glass of wine. The staff were always very helpful with excellent "local" restaurant suggestions and often asking how our day went. We were here for 4 nights and would certainly return. - L& S

Reviews.Title: “Bring all your money . . .”
Reviews.Author: james09173
Reviews.Content: because you're going to need it! To start with the positive things, airport transfers were efficient, the location was pretty good for shopping/restaurants, the internet was fast, the room quiet and the view from the Mirabelle restaurant balcony was pretty good. As for the negatives, considering how expensive the rooms are I was disappointed that nothing was inclusive. We had to pay separately for our airport transfers, breakfast (which arrived late) and internet. The pillows in our room were the hardest I have ever "slept" on--they were like slabs of concrete. Although the room was nicely decorated, the "view" was nothing worth taking a picture of as it just looked out at the windows of the other rooms. Overall not a terrible hotel, but not great, either. I've been in hotels that were a fraction of the price, with better views and location and had more things included.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven in eternal Rome.”
Reviews.Author: rob007fen
Reviews.Content: A day before our stay at the beautiful Splendide Royal, I emailed the room manager to let them know when we would be arriving and that we were on our honeymoon. When we arrived at the hotel the Italian charm and welcoming staff, who are yes Italian!, and also speak very good English, ensured our stay got off to a great start. We stayed in room 308 and awaiting us was a complimentary bottle of champagne and nibbles along with a welcoming note from the management, making both my new wife and I feel very special indeed. The room which, although not having a view, was perfect in every way: opulent, clean, and a pleasent place to relax when not out exploring Rome. The hotel is in my opinion expensive but the service you receive is worth every penny. I believe you get what you pay for and the Splendide Royal is a five star hotel with a Michelin star restaurant in a quiet, beautiful area of Rome near the Villa Borghese. This was my third time in Rome but my wife's first - we stayed for six days and had a wondeful time, with the climax being dinner at the hotel's Mirabelle restaurant. The food was heavenly and the service impeccable, and we were made to feel like we were the most important guests in the whole of Rome. My wife and I would like to express our gratitude and thanks to all the wonderful staff at the hotel, and we will be returning next year. A note for those worried about the price as commented on other recent reviews - there are cheaper hotels closer to all the attractions who cater for the tourist, and having stayed in these myself previously, know they come with many problems such as noise, small tired rooms and a lack of that special something. The Splendide Royal is for those that want something more and are not afraid to pay more, and as a result they achieve excellence across the board. Once again, many thanks and see you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid on all accounts; Location, Accomodations, and Staff.”
Reviews.Author: TravelMs1950
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days at Hotel Splendide Royal and have the fondest memories to show for it. We loved the location as it was an easy walk to Via Venneto. The hotel restaurant (although pricey) was a fabulous lookout point for all of Rome. Three out of the four nights we enjoyed walking to Harry's Bar to enjoy the entertainment (a husband and wife duo). The room was beautifully appointed, roomy, and although we did not have a view, the window treatments were lovely. The Staff was also attentive and when we had the need of a physician they promptly took care of that too. My husband and myself would gladly stay here again and would also recommend Hotel Splenide Royal to anyone who appreciates a beautiful small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: Get_Out_and_Go1
Reviews.Content: By all accounts the hotel was clean and orderly, however, the rating and price do not match the experience. An entire side of the hotel lacked a view other than an alley or building despite advertising breathtaking vantages. Unfortunately, only the front desk staff could speak languages other than Italian, and when they did, it was somewhat challenging to communicate clearly. Virtually all other staff were incapable of communicating with guests becaouse they only spoke Italian, and that made for some very uncomfortable moments. They were constantly understaffed at the front desk and concierge stations, and that caused long waits for standard requests on many occassions.

Reviews.Title: “Major Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: RSElliott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our recent visit to Italy. While the hotel and rooms are very nice, we found the service to be very stuffy, and we had a very bad experience at breakfast. We thought the breakfast was included with the room, but to our chagrin we found that our coffee & pastry cost 33 Euros (about $50). We also felt that the staff was looking down their nose at us at every interaction. I would not recommend for young people, non-Italians, or anyone that cares about getting a decent value. The location was Ok, but not all that convenient to the major sites or train station. We will not be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, decent service”
Reviews.Author: beachbeast
Reviews.Content: The nice sized room was ready early when we arrived from the airport. The room was nicely furnished, quiet, and the maid service was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is very well located. They arranged for a tour for 6 of us with Roberto and it was great. The conceirge was just ok. We would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: murasaki32
Reviews.Content: Our family (husband and I, 19yr. old daughter) stayed in the suite overlooking the gardens. The room was spacious (considering European standards), very quiet and tastefully decorated and the house-keeping was impeccable. We were a little disappointed when the gentlemen at the concierage told us to take a cab in response to our inquiry about buses going to the Catacombs; otherwise everyone was incredibly helpful, especially, when directing us to a number of fine restaurants, despite it being mid-August when the majority of the good restaurants were closed. Within walking distance to major attractions and the Metro but not too noisy. Definitely not an inexpensive hotel, but we did get reasonable rates by booking the room directly with the hotel on-line, which was followed by helpful e-mails by the concierage to enhance our stay. A wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: SignorPicky
Reviews.Content: Being our first trip to Rome we weren't really sure what we were getting, but after doing a ton of research of reviews we changed our reservation from another Rome 4-star hotel to the Splendide Royal. Traveling the end of July in Rome is not the ideal time of year--real hot; coming from Florida, that wasn't a concern. But, the AC/temp control, a good shower , and location were, a priority, among other things. We enjoyed a pleasant, comfortable stay for 6 nights. The room was a large King, very good-sized bathroom, and as Europe goes, a good shower. Even though it was low 90's (32-33C), the room temp was fine and we never had an issue. It was clean, housekeeping was accommodating of our schedule and met our needs. Their desk personnel and concierge did a great job monitoring and pestering our airline carrier who failed to get our bags to arrive the same time we did. They were great, pursuing them regularly. We finally got 3 of 4 bags two days late and the 4th three days late--they were great with recommendations on local, not touristy, places to eat, how to get around easily, efficiently, and when we needed to find a fresh set of clothes after two days of no bags they pointed us to a couple of very reasonable department stores rather than the high end fashion places. There are only 57 rooms or so and I think they do a good job trying to be personal with their "Buon Giorno or Bona Sera Mr and Mrs Name". The Borghese Gardens and Gallery, just two blocks up Via Pinciana are a must. Via Veneto is fine, but there are less expensive restaurants and better food to be found off the tourist main drag. We did not go for the meal or drink on the top floor of the hotel (7th FL?). We did go up to check it out, but found it very formal and after speaking to a couple of guest who just left there, they said great view and all of that, but average food and very over-priced. We found some great views on a hill over in Trestevere and other places, so a high-priced meal or drink in a hotel wasn't a must. Subway can be caught in two different places, either south down Via Veneto or right at the Spanish Steps. So many great things to do, just ask for help. Still need another week to take in more and even more time to digest all of the information and knowledge. Two thumbs up to people there for our recent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: ParentsWithoutKids
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome, Italy and found the Splendide Royal hotel online. It is a gorgeous boutique hotel in a great neighbourhood with shopping and restaurants. Within walking distance to some of the tourist sights and short cab ride to Vatican and Collesium. The front desk staff are all friendly and always available to help with making a restaurant reservation or booking a tour. They were awesome and extremely attentive! Our room was standard and very well appointed and very clean. Nice furniture and great bathroom with robes, shampoo, etc. blowdryer. The best part is the breakfast on the top floor of hotel that are included with room. It was the best quality breakfast we've ever had from the juices, cheeses, assortment of breads to the hot buffet and fruits and cereals This hotel is a gem and we would definitely stay here again. There was absolutely nothing wrong with our three-day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent staff, restaurant upstairs is terrible”
Reviews.Author: AliPalmBeach
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice, beautiful rooms and the staff is very helpful. We tried the restaurant on the top floor which should be one of the best in town, but we had very bad service there and the food was not very good. Too complicate menu, too expensive and not very tasty. The view from the restaurant is amazing....but that is it !!! Maybe it was because we ate on a Monday night there ????

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Impeccable Service, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnGalt330
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Splendide Royal was quite simply flawless. The hotel is stunningly beautiful; the decor is a little more lavishly Italian than my own personal taste tends to be, but everything is absolutely gorgeous. For being in a reasonably old building, I was amazed at how new everything was, from the sumptuous carpets, wall paper, and drapes to the elegant light fixtures and ornate furniture. The bathroom was particularly exceptional, featuring ample marble counter space with twin sinks, as well as separate rooms for the whirlpool bathtub and glass-enclosed shower, all gleaming with black and white marble; it was the nicest, most luxurious bathroom I have ever experienced in a standard room. And while there are many nice hotels in Rome with beautiful interiors, the Splendide stands out by virtue of its wonderful location and service. Its situation near the Villa Borghese is absolutely ideal. The surrounding area is mostly quiet and not a mecca for tourists--a godsend in a city as frenetic as Rome--and it features some of the most beautiful views in the city, looking out towards the gardens of the Borghese on the one side and the Vatican on the other. The charming breakfast room near the top of the hotel showcased these magnificent views, and the Michelin starred restaurant at the top with its wonderful balcony sported the most breathtaking tableau of the city I have yet enjoyed. Surveying the lush, endless trees on one side and the grand dome of St. Peter's on the other, one could not help feeling like one had surely landed in paradise. To top it all off, the staff were friendly and impeccably helpful; they made us feel as though we were the only guests in the hotel. For that matter, I constantly marveled out how quiet the hotel was--save for meals in the restaurants, we were hardly ever aware of other guests. The hotel was a supremely civilized refuge in the heart of Rome, and for a city that can be positively overwhelming with its unending tourists and manic pace, it was a godsend, exactly what you would want from an upscale hotel in the heart of Rome. I cannot imagine a place more ideally suited to the needs of the discerning traveler in the eternal city, and I hope very much to return.

Reviews.Title: “For sure we'll stay again at the Spledide Royal Rome”
Reviews.Author: telhado1951
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Rome. We dreamt about going to Rome and I must say that the Splendide Royal is heaven. We had a great stay in a lovely room with terrace and we could see the Vatican Cupola. Staff is very professional. Breakfast room is amazing overlooking the Borghese Park. Hotel Splendide Royal is impressive and a must for your next holiday in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: bruce_amy
Reviews.Content: What can we say? They were perfect:friendly and helpful staff,an amazing view of the city,we also had dinner in the restaurant inside the hotel. We had booked,through Expedia,finding a very good rate and we are only waiting to come back again.

Reviews.Title: ““Nearly Splendid””
Reviews.Author: ChillieEngland
Reviews.Content: + points:- The Splendide Royal is well placed in a good area, ideal to explore the centre of Rome on foot & it is a lovely oasis away from the heat & hustle of the tourist spots. First impressions are very good; although rather ostentatious the décor & furnishing are top quality, very opulent & well maintained throughout the hotel. The rooms aren’t particularly large but ours was beautifully presented & room cleaning was top notch, overall I would give the hotel a positive review, it adds real “feel good factor” to your Rome visit! There are also great views from the 7th floor bar & restaurant & also from the 6th floor breakfast rooms. Some of the staff are very good (e.g. one of the reception managers, Franchesco I believe, was excellent) friendly & helpful others unfortunately were not rather souring the overall experience. - points:- The negatives started before we arrived with emails repeatedly ignored & it took much effort to get the information we required. On arrival the receptionist (or concierge, an older middle eastern gentleman called Maleck I think?) had a rather obnoxious, arrogant attitude that made you feel he wasn’t interested in his clients, in fact he was bordering on rude throughout our stay! This patchy variance in staff attitude has been mentioned in earlier reports & it is something the hotel needs to sort! The way a hotel treats its guests is part of the experience & the overall service & attitude didn’t live up to 5 star rating, the prices however do with a small beer costing 10E and evening meal around 150E a head without drinks! We were expecting a comprehensive high quality breakfast in view of the 35E a head cost & the hotels Michelin star rating, but although perfectly adequate it certainly fell short of other hotels (particularly with regards to the very poor English Breakfast selection!) although the fruits were good & the Espresso excellent. Also be aware that most Superior rooms have a poor view of the inner courtyard & you will likely have to pay extra for a view (best on the 6th floor!), having said this it wasn’t a major problem as we spent most of our time out & about. In contrast to our luxury room the balcony featured rusty railings with a view of a huge air-con unit & pipes, this could easily have been screened/presented in a positive way & is an illustration of the patchy attention to detail offered by the hotel, with excellence in some areas meeting negatives in others. Summary- Despite the few downsides the Splendide still offers very good value for money via Expedia, it may be a little more expensive but overall it justifies its price with a good location & luxury surroundings, they even helped us with a late check out which was much appreciated. The hotel simply need to re-train the few uncaring members of staff that can spoil the experience & it would be spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Duckanddickie
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, impressive surroundings. Central location 5 min walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps. Top of a hill but keeps you fit so you can eat more ice cream!! Room was fantastic, the jacuzzi bath was great for the end of a day. Staff were very efficient

Reviews.Title: “One word to describe it: PERFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Floriana59
Reviews.Content: I stayed for almost one month in this incredible hotel, and I recomend it for sure. Everything is conceived for helping their guest in the best way possible, to make their journey an unforgetable experience. I would not change this hotel in Rome for nothing in the world!!! Florencia Savino

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service,OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: nfard11
Reviews.Content: It is amazing how having nice/caring staff will make such a big difference in our stays. The airline lost my baggage and without help of the front desk staff I would have never seen my baggage again. They made several phone calls day and night until they finally located my bag. About the Hotel: This hotel is not a true 5 star, not even a 4 star. It is more like 3.5 star hotel in American standards. The hotel is old but fairly clean with a great location. The staff is very helpful and speaks English fluently and is very attentive without being pretentious. The restaurant had great food( tried their clams/lobster and veal). The room was on the small side. I didn't pay extra $$ for the view so I can't complain about my blocked view. Good A/C. The bed was very hard but I guess you get this with every European hotel. Quiet hotel within walking distance from attractions. If I ever stay there again is b/c of their excellent customer service. Your choice!!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel, full of character and history.”
Reviews.Author: EdKent
Reviews.Content: It's such a beautiful hotel, full of character and history. It's very close to Via Veneto so it's perfectly located. The hotel itself is just gorgeous - very high ceilings, warm colours and old paintings everywhere - it's decorated in an 'antique-y' style but it very warm and welcoming. Our room was gorgeous - , decorative wooden ceilings, and a compact yet stylish bathroom. Everything was spotlessly clean. The staff here, as everyone was very polite, friendly and helpful. And of course - the breakfast - I cant imagine a more beautiful setting for breakfast than overlooking the rooftops of Rome. Well worth paying a little extra to have breakfast at the hotel. It was the usual buffet style - eggs, bacon, rolls, pastries, cold meats, cheese, fruits, yoghurts etc - everything you could want. It was a lovely experience staying here, and I hope one day we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cyons57
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading all the glowing reviews. Maybe I was expecting too much, but my husband & I were somewhat disappointed. Our deluxe room was attractive - although the mattress & the pillows were hard as rocks. Breakfast was good - but very pricey at 30 euros. I asked the concierge to book our appointment time at the Villa Borghese and listened as he picked up the phone & booked it. When we showed up at our appointed time, they had no record of our name or our confirmation number. In fact, we were told that the confirmation number was from May, 2009 (we were there in June). They took pity on us & let us in but obviously something strange had happened! We'll stay somewhere else on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld5555
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just off the very trendy Via Veneto and about 5/10 minutes walk in the other direction from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. There was no noticeable noise up in our street facing first floor bedroom. It was also close to the Villa Borghese park. Our room was enormous, with cupboards in the lobby linking the bedroom to the spacious bathroom with separate bath and shower. There wasn't a great range of TV channels but then Rome is not a city that makes you want to stay in your hotel room watching TV so it didn't matter much! There were only a couple of mildly annoying things about the room. First, the location of the protruding door stops! There was one behind the main door which was close to the suitcase stand and on which I stubbed my toe a couple of times. (Funnier when it happens to someone else!) The other was in the bathroom right by the toilet which caught out my partner. There also didn't appear to be a master switch for turning on / off the lights, so it required a trip around the room visiting the various fittings in turn. Maybe it was just me but at the very least it wasn't obvious. We didn't eat in the swanky Mirabelle restaurant but breakfast was fine and we would definitely come back to the same hotel. Top tip - hang onto your bottle of water when you are finished with it because there are water fountains all over Rome which enable you to top up and keep cool and hydrated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: CharandMatt
Reviews.Content: A lovely luxury hotel in a great location. Our stay was wonderful - staff very helpful, everything clean and all in all a perfect long weekend. Although pricey, would definitely reccomend a meal in the restaurant - a table outside on the terrace overlooking the city was lovely. A great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, impressive public rooms, great location, rather expensive!”
Reviews.Author: SeptimusSuffolkus
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a fantastic trip to Rome I felt that I should write a review on this hotel in the hope that it may help future travellers. The hotel itself was lovely, the breakfast was great and was served in beautiful surroundings but we felt a little disappointed with the room which we were allocated. I had booked a superior double, which is actually just a standard room. Whilst the room itself was very clean, tidy and nicely appointed the bathroom was a little 'tired looking'. Also felt that 25 euros extra for t.v. was insulting given the price of the room in the first place. Mini bar prices were very steep as were the prices in the hotel bar. Also a little disappointed that the hotel didn't even give us a complimentary bottle of wine or something similar, given that it was my husband's 50th birthday and our 10th wedding anninversary (a fact that they were aware of). All in all a good hotel but not quite as good as I had expected. The little restaurant immediately next to the hotel (come out of doors and turn right) was excellent. Food very acceptable, service with a smile and complimentary drinks at a reasonable price (by Rome standards).

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return soon”
Reviews.Author: notthatdeadyet
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome and recommend this hotel. We were a little worried about the Splendide given some of the prior reviews, but found a very plush, smallish hotel which we would certainly return to again. The hotel is situated very near others, such as the Sofitel and the Marriott, just outside of the Borghese. The Spanish Steps and Via Veneto are 10 minute and 5 minute walks away, respectfully. The metro stops are probably more like a 15 minute walk in either direction. Our room was large, plush, and very clean. We were on a lower floor, and did not have a view of any sort, but as we were on our feet most of the day walking around the city, this did not matter to us. Likewise, the smallish fitness room (essentially a treadmill and a bike) had no demerits from us. We did not utilize the high end restaurant, but did have breakfast daily as part of our rate. The breakfast area, on floor 6 at the top of the hotel provided a great view over the Borghese, with glimpses of St. Peter's and the surrounding hills. Breakfast was good, and had a variety of mainly cold items. The wait staff was prompt and courteous and left nothing undesired. Overall, all the staffers we encountered were very professional and top notch.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL ROOM - GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: hepacer
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful; they upgraded us. Great location, minutes from everything. Restaurant on top floor, very good but expensive. Staff was efficient, friendly and very accommodating. Street cafes - as soon as you sit, check doubles. Stand at bar for breakfast and lunch. Costs a lot less. Nino's was our favorite place toeat. American Express booked the best tours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but beware of the Concierge”
Reviews.Author: jdk1411
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through our travel agent so we did not have any advance knowledge of this establishment. As most hotels the concierge hit us up as soon as we hit the counter for tours. I don't mind that because its usually a win win, they get a piece of the business and you get a tour from a reputable provider. However, in this instance we were sold a private Vatican tour where everything was supposedly included but as we soon found out it was not. When the dispute came between me and the tour operator the concierge stood in front of me and did not own up to what he had stated the tour would be. Secondly, having an inclination as to what type of guy this was I paid my tour bill in cash t the concierge, I included an extra 20 Euro on purpose and re-asked if this amount was correct after he counted it. He smiled and said this was correct change. I kindly told him the extra was his tip. Small price to pay to know the character of the people you are dealing with. In short, the hotel is very nice with a great location. However, I just cant give a good review when you can't trust the staff a what they tell you. As out of towners, we rely on them for good information, at least I think its their job to do so

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful venue for a very special birthday”
Reviews.Author: Linda075
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent - very friendly and nothing too much trouble. Although our room overlooked the street, the double glazing ensured a quiet room which was very roomy and comfortable and made our stay even more enjoyable. The hotel was located about 5 minutes walk from the Borghese Gardens and Via Veneto and there were plenty of restaurants to chose from within the vicinity. We used the hotel restaurant , which had wonderful views of St Peters,for a special birthday and couldn't find fault with it and the hotel even arranged for complimentary champagne to be served in our room which was a lovely gesture. A good selection for breakfast was served in the dining room again with wonderful views. Notwithstanding all of the above, one good feature was the fact that the hotel was so centrally placed and within easy reach of all the main sightseeing attractions and by chance we chose a week where almost all museums were free. The one big downfall, and not the fault of the hotel, was how expensive Rome is even taking into account the poor exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Trevicouple
Reviews.Content: My Partner booked a surprise trip to Rome (to propose!) over the Easter break and we stayed at the fantastic Splendide Royal. We arranged an airport collection via conceirge and the driver was waiting in arrivals as promised - recommend this service for sheer ease! We had a spacious room with a separate walk in wardrobe, large marble bathroom and huge bed. We stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and found it faultless. The staff (particularly the front desk) were really helpful and friendly, greeting us with a wave every time we left or arrived back at the hotel. Breakfast was simple but plenty of choice and the staff were helpful and kept the buffet tables constantly topped up. Hotel is a great location for the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain (5 minute walk) and the Via Veneto for the restaurants (recommend Harry's for the best steak in red wine sauce, pricey but worth the money). We spent a lovely afternoon lounging and strolling in Borghese Park. Would recommend the use of the 48 hour guided bus tour route, on the first day we completed the whole circuit on the bus using the headphones just to get our bearings. We then used the bus like a taxi and hopped on and off at each attraction. The nearest stop, Barberini Plaza is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Another thing we would recommend is the guide at the Collesseum, for an extra 10 euros we got to skip the huge queue and found the guide really informative. We didn't use this service at The Vatican as it was a 2 hour tour and we felt that we would rather explore the musuems at our pace. We dined at the Mirabelle restaurant on one night and although extremely expensive it was worth every penny as the food and service were excellent. Only disappointment was that we dressed up for this Michelin starred restaurant (as you would!) yet there were people who felt it necessary to wear tracksuits and trainers which I felt was a bit disrespectful as the restaurant clearly had a dress code and other guests had made the effort. All in all we would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody wanting to visit Rome, yes it is pricey but worth the money in this fantastic city. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “truly special”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel0
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through lastminute.com and was not disappointed. I had checked some tripadvisor reviews and was a lttle worried by some of the negative comments but I didn't have to be. The hotel was gorgeous with a good sized room. The location was fabulous and the staff were incredibly friendly. We arrived early and had no problems checking in at all. I had emailed before to let them know it was my husband's birthday so they left a birthday card and box of chocolates in our room. I had breakfast included but I double checked this after reading a previous review. The breakfast buffet was exceptional - especially by european standards. There was a wonderful range of good quality food from bacon and eggs through to crossiants. A couple of reviews mentioned that the rooms were a little shabby but I did not think this was the case at all. The hotel is furnished with antiques and in a baroque style which I loved. I didn't eat at the restaurant as it was expensive but the terrace there is stunning and its well worth getting drink at sunset where you can watch the sunset over the whole of Rome - the view is truly amazing. Overall I loved this hotel and if I go back to Rome would definitely return. Its not cheap but worth splashing out on if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful & thoroughly relaxing”
Reviews.Author: FredandOllie
Reviews.Content: I took my wife on our wedding anniversary, in February, to this wonderful hotel, we had a fabulous time, everything: the staff, the facilities, the ambience, the restaurant and the location were all well above the norm. I do find it very difficult to understand some of the reviews in regard to hotels of this type, especially from our cousins from across the pond, why go to a hotel that is quite obviously offering a high-end experience and expect a something-for-nothing motel? This hotel is about complete satisfaction, whatever whenever, not at all about how little can I get away with. The comments about the restaurant are correct, it is expensive (and one of the best) but why go there are then complain? It is perfectly easy to assess how much a meal might cost prior to eating, unless you are unable to read. Really the bottom line is that this is quite simply the best hotel in Rome that is not a mega-structure, or a large souless chain or a cold boutique, I would happily recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This is a hotel we would return to without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: MiramarSanJuan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a visit to Rome and a stay at the Hotel Splendide Royal. Our experience was very pleasant, the room was spacious, well appointed, immaculately clean and quiet, and the beds were very comfortable. The included breakfast was among the best we have experienced with a great selection, a stunning view of the Villa Borghese gardens and St. Peter's dome, and very pleasant and cheerful personnel. The location of the hotel is quite convenient to exploring the eternal city. Located just off the Villa Borghese, on the Porta Pinciana, it is but a ten-minute walk from the Scala di Spagna and the Metro and five minutes from the Via Veneto. Yet the most delightful part of the hotel was its personnel, particularly its concierge service. They were very helpful in assisting us in planning our day, as well as in making reservations to restaurants and museums, as well as in helping to set up the internet. Among the personnel we must point out Ivan Crisanti, who really made our stay the more memorable by his enthusiasm for the city and its treasures, and his love for Caravaggio in particular. We stayed at the hotel for nine days and began to feel really at home. It was difficult to leave. We would not hesitate to return to the Splendide Royal for our next visit. We must recommend to all visitors to get the three-day Roma Pass at any official tourist information site, as it offers unlimited access to the metro and the bus system, plus free access to the first two historic sites/museums you visit. And it gave us priority access to the Colosseum, for example.

Reviews.Title: “We were unfairly charged for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: annmarieBoston
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into the hotel, we were assured breakfast was included. However, when we checked out, we were told we would be charged $35 euros for each breakfast we ate (5 total, twice I only l had toast)! We spoke with the concierge AND the hotel manager who told us the deal they have with expedia is that breakfast was NOT included (although they most certainly told us it WAS again upon checking in). Therefore, if they tell you breakfast is included, PLEASE make sure you have it in writing first, so you are not unfairly charged (now greater than $200 american dollars) the way we were!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: mikeybr6
Reviews.Content: i treated my partner to a holiday at the hotel slendide royal after seeing the photos and reading the reviews of the hotel.when entering i found the lobby to be on the small side but i did find the checkin staff to be very helpful.i was immediately disappointed in the room as the only view from the window was that of the fire escape on the next hotel.as i had upgraded to a superior i had expected a view of villa bourgese park.we also found the bed to be large but the most uncomfortable that we had ever slept in.also for a 5 star hotel we believe the cleanliness in the bathroom not to be up to scratch as there was alot of lime scale around the bath area and a few of the fixings were hanging off the wall.we found the breakfast to be bland and the same thing everyday.also when i first checked in a counterfoil of my credit card was immediately taken which left me wondering all week how much extra i would get charged that i hadn't budgeted for.lastly although the hotel is ideal for short breaks and business stop overs i don't believe it is ideal for a weeks holiday as there are no real facilities and the bar area is just 2 chairs pushed into the corner of the restaurant

Reviews.Title: “MOST RELAXING QUIET HOTEL most important -extremely clean”
Reviews.Author: MarieellenIreland
Reviews.Content: Beautiful quaint hotel in nice location short stroll to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain and the lovely Borghese gardens.Plenty of nice restaurants close by.Bedroom was a little on the small size but this was more than made up for with the decor,cleanliness and tranquility ,lovely fluffy dressing gowns and slippers supplied.Sweets were a nice touch also.Mini bar expensive though.Beautiful restaurant in hotel with spectacular views . Bar rather small.Porters at entrance were extremely friendly and helpful at all times, with directions and organizing taxis etc.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: faarias
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but very charming and beautifully decorated. We ahd booked for rooms for family at the beginign fo cruise and all of us thorroghly enjoyed it. View fro the rbekafast terrace at top of hotel is spectacular. Was an exceletn value for the price in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning hotel!”
Reviews.Author: William95
Reviews.Content: This hotel reflects european accommodation as it is meant to be experienced - civilized, easy, elegant, and quietly charming. Although not inexpensive, location, room size, furnishings, ambiance and service justify the cost. Overall, when weighing all factors, this hotel is superior value and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Small but good service”
Reviews.Author: spindoctor_UK
Reviews.Content: After seeing all the photos of the lobby, the tales of good service and the good location I decided to book a room at this hotel. Upon arrival I was greeted very well by the doorman and the checkin was very friendly and was a breeze. However you realise that this is a small hotel and some of the decor is dated. The photos of the lobby do look impressive on the website and you wonder what the rest of the hotel is like, but the lobby is what you see and is very small. Location is good in terms of the area, but it is on a back street in the Via Veneto area. Cabs aren't to be found outside the hotel and there is the odd seedy bar around. While everything is easy to get to, when you are paying that much money, you expect to be in the middle of the action in Rome and this isn't quite the case. There are around 40 rooms in total and the room sizes are very good. We took a triple room and this was organised very well. The decor is a little dated, but I would still say that the room was very comfortable. There is a standard 17-19 inch LCD screen and 2 telephones in the room. There is a walk-in closet and a safe. The bathroom is as you would expect in a 5 star hotel with 2 sinks and with nice toileteries. The room did lack tea/coffee facilities and the minibar is extortionate. The wifi internet is also very expensive. We had an english breakfast included in our room rate and took this at the rooftop Mirabelle Restarant. The view from here over the Vatican is superb on a sunny day. However the prices at this restaurant is also very expensive and worth avoiding if it isn't included in your package. Service was also a little muddled. The staff are very friendly and quite accomodating and told us where to pick up tour buses and organised cabs. They also provided complimentary umbrellas for hire when needed. However the conceirge service doesn't seem to know much and this resulted in our wasted trip to a restaurant that the conceirge told us we should be able to walk into with a reservation. While the hotel was nice and the stay was comfortable, I was expecting it to be better located and wow me more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “caution”
Reviews.Author: jetkitty
Reviews.Content: Within an hour of arriving at Hotel Splendide, we had a tour scheduled. When the taxi arrivied the driver quoted us a price of 50Euro. I asked the hotel bellman if this could be correct, it was so high. He concurred, that was the fixed price, so I bit the bullet and paid. The return trip, same route, was 7 Euro. Clearly, the bellman and taxi driver were working together to rip off the tourist. At a hotel rate of 630Euro a night, I would have expected the staff to be the advocate of the guest, not an ally of the taxi driver.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated place. Quite pricey”
Reviews.Author: Mirkotravel
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms and decor of the Hotel quite outdated and not up to a 4-5 star standard. They do have a nice roof terrace though from where you can view some of the many sights of Roma and it's nice to start the day with a decent breakfast overlooking beautiful Rome. Beware when booking through the concierge. The taxi he had ordered for me wanted to rip me off and then didnt want to provide me with a proper receipt (BTW: this is a general problem in Rome).

Reviews.Title: “Quite expensive!”
Reviews.Author: CarysWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in September 2008 so this is rather a retrospective review so I'll keep it short! The hotel is beautifully furnished and the staff were extremely polite and attentive. We stayed in a standard room which did not have any view as it looked onto the central area of the hotel which was a bit disappointing, however it was quite big with a large, marble bathroom and very clean. We ate at the Mirabelle restaurant in the hotel - it is VERY expensive e.g. 56 euros for a main course - a bottle of Laurent Perrier champagne was 120 euros (and that was the cheapest!) but we ate out on the terrace, the weather was warm and watching the sunset over the dome of St. Peter's was wonderful. If you want to spoil yourself then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find! Quiet elegance in a busy city.”
Reviews.Author: Sanfrancisco820
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Rome from this past October. Before each trip, I always consult Tripadvisor to read the comments on hotels we are considering. We were originally booked at a hotel by the Spanish Steps, but changed our minds a few weeks before our trip due to current very negative remarks on TripAdvisor. I cannot tell you how much we value everyone's comments on this site. After reading about several other hotels, we changed to the Splendide Royal and am very thankful that we did. I don't know why we did not choose this hotel to begin with. We have traveled extensively and cannot give this hotel high enough marks. From the gracious welcome, to the beautiful room with a balcony overlooking Rome, to the welcome chocolates and note, to the superb service, this hotel is a real treat. The staff are warm, generous with their time and a wealth of knowledge. The location is easy walking distance to almost everything, as mentioned by previous contributors. We discovered that the city tour bus stops just around the corner and is an easy get on/off bus with the ticket good for 2 days. We took this bus on a full circuit around to get our bearings. (Get the earphones for an excellent guide to each site. Keep the earphones handy for each trip on the bus.) This bus will take you to every site that you would want to see. We then took the bus down to a central point and walked to many sites. Our room was lovely with plenty of closet space and a very large bath with jacuzzi tub. I agree with a previous comment about the scratchy sheets and did not read the information about other choices. My mistake. I am sure if I would have asked, this would have been corrected. At the end of our stay in Rome, we rented a car from Hertz at the Borgese location that is walking distance from the hotel and an easy exit from the city. Bottom line - wonderful hotel; great staff; quiet convenient location; spacious room; sophisticated, understated elegance Note: Be sure to continue checking comments on your hotel choices even after you have made a reservation. Circumstances change. Something must have happened at our original hotel to cause several negative reviews in a row. (Worked out great for us!)

Reviews.Title: “Splashed out on this one - happy we did!”
Reviews.Author: MacTuras
Reviews.Content: Decided that if only having one night in Rome, might as well make it a good one. Hotel fulfilled all expectations. Didn't have much time to interact with staff but found them very professional - if a bit stiff; Sad that breakfast finished so promptly at finishing time (think it was 10.30) - not very Irish, but then we were in Rome...and when in Rome... Actually, when in Rome...would recommend you stay here! BTW Might be a little biased since it was our honeymoon, so we got upgraded to a suite...need I say more? ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MamaSusan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendide Royal for the last few days of our two week vacation in Italy. The location is very convenient, a block or so from Via Venetto. The hotel was the ultimate in luxury! The lobby and sitting room were gorgeous, with beautiful furniture and always immaculate. The front desk helped us with anything we needed - recommendations for restaurants or tourist attractions, directions, etc. Our room was very large and beautifully furnished. The first night we arrived, they left us a box of candy and a hand written welcome note! We felt like royalty! On one evening, we started out walking to a local restaurant. After a minute or two it started to rain. We ran back to the hotel and the doorman was waiting for us with open umbrellas. The hotel loaned us umbrellas on several days when rain was a possiblity. We would definately stay at the Splendide Royal again.

Reviews.Title: “Indifferent Staff”
Reviews.Author: roomservice56
Reviews.Content: This hotel had 5 star prices and is NOT a 5 star hotel! We had booked one suite and one std room. Suite was fairly spacious and had a nice terrace but the compliments end there. Staff was indifferent to us and the Concierge was not helpful with finding suitable restaurants either in the neighborhood or for a Sunday evening. They charged us for room service breakfast (even though breakfast was included) which included lukewarm coffee and no jams for the bread basket. Manager tried to apologize by sending chocolates, should have taken $$ off the bill instead. Bath amenities, linens and towels were not of superior quality either. This hotel was a lot of money for the 2 rooms and nowhere near the luxury of a Four Seasons or Park Hyatt where we also stayed on this trip. Go elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MFRConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Rome at the Hotel Splendide Royal. The Hotel is beautiful and we have rearly experienced such an incredible service in other hotels including The Mandarin Oriental, Ritz Carlton or even The Penynsula. Everybody in the staff was kind, polite and alwasy extremely helpfull. The concierge service is outstanding, the restaurant is Mitchellin awarded and the wine selection terrific. We liked it so much that we are planning to return next year!.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location for the price”
Reviews.Author: ContraCostaMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights at the end of Oct. beginining of November. Because our long flight arrived in Rome at 6:30 a.m. we arrived at the hotel at about 8:30a.m. and were promptly given a room. Apparently they upgraded us to a deluxe room. It was very large for a hotel room in a major city and very nicely decorated. There was a hallway outside of the bedroom with two huge wardrobes for our clothing, and the bathroom was also very large, consisting of two separate rooms, one with a very large tub. The staff was always very attentive and considerate, but we didn't need their help too much as we were visiting our daughter who lives in Rome. We enjoyed the breakfast and the beautiful views in the breakfast room. We also enjoyed the location of the hotel; just off the Via Venetto; near the best hotels in Rome without paying their prices. The Hotel is also on a quiet street that is almost across the street from the Borghese Gardens. We enjoyed being able to walk over to the park and relax on a bench and people watch. The only reason this hotel doesn't get an "excellent" review from me is the noisy plumbing. This may just be a quirk of European plumbing, but every time someone from above flushed the toilet, it sounded like a roaring waterfall in our room. This was quite startling the first night and I found I had to sleep with earplugs for the entire stay which was a shame in such an otherwise peaceful hotel. I also agree with other reviewers that this hotel is not a 5 star in the same way that a Four Seasons is a 5 star. But you are also not quite paying 5 star prices either.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Splendid! Pure Royal!”
Reviews.Author: KTPierchala
Reviews.Content: In the beginning of October 2008 we spent an outstanding romantic week in Rome, staying in excellent Hotel Splendide Royal. Now we are happy to recommend this marvelous place to everybody who care about elegance, comfort, beauty and glamour. This is the right place not only to "veni" and "vidi" the Rome, but to "vici" the scent and taste of the good time, specially if your are couple in love. The room is beautiful and well-equipped, the bed very comfortable, the furniture in a good style. The bathroom high above average. Reception out of words - discrete and elegant. The staff is friendly and very professional. Although the Hotel does not offer its own garage our car was gently saved not far away and was picked-up by the staff in every moment we've wished. Additional service like cleaning the car was made in a perfect way. Every morning we spent an hour having good breakfast in the breakfast-terrace on the sixth floor with the unforgettable view on whole Rome. The quality of the served meal was perfect, although - with a week-long stay - a little bit to monotony. Still, the view was a substantial re-compensation. The Hotel is genially located. Just hundred meters to via Veneto, a step from Villa Borghese and five minutes walk to Spanish Stairs. What is more to say?! Surely, our next stay in Rome we will bind with Hotel Splendide Royal! Just for pure Splendid! Just for pure Royal! And we wish you this, too! Katarzyna & Tomasz Pierchala Ustanow, Poland.

Reviews.Title: “the best combo: location and luxury”
Reviews.Author: aliasbreeze
Reviews.Content: just off the via veneto, in the heart of the city lies a jewel of a boutique hotel, the splendide royal. i was greeted warmly when i arrived, and escorted to a lovely junior suite, which was tastefully decorated from the carpeting to the artwork adorning the walls. there was a well-stocked minibar, and numerous amenities one would expect in a first class hotel. i took time to luxuriate in the large jacuzzi bath before exploring the city. the staff was gracious and informative. there are two restaurants: limonaia has a casual atmosphere and features a bountiful buffet, providing superior sustenance for whatever your appetite craves for breakfast. there's a colorful array of fresh fruit and juices, freshly baked breads, eggs, cereals, and much more. for lunch or evening dining, the stately elegant, michelin-rated mirabelle is a gourmet's delight. exceptional service and exquisite cuisine accommmodate the most discriminating palate. i have stayed at other fine hotels in rome, but this experience was special. i felt pampered and indulged throughout my stay at the splendide royal, and heartily recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated hotel not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: rustycycle
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel after booking a deluxe room via Expedia. Upon arrival booking was all OK, staff OK but room was of a poor standard, definiely not 5 star as advertised. Hotel web site says "jewel of elegance" and "recently restored". They must be joking, as an experienced traveller I am very well aware that this hotel failed to live up to its advertised claims. I don't know what was recently restored, but I did not see anything that appeared remotely like it had been recently restored, simply a false claim by the hotel. What I saw was in need of restoring, this claim must be in their dreams. Just the same as the claim of being "the jewel of elegance" whatever that means, it was far from it. Poor value for money as they charge 5 star prices yet the hotel is at best a 3.5 star. Their false claims appear to have been made to justify their high prices. There are many other very good hotels close by, my recommedation go to one of those. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not so splendide”
Reviews.Author: roamantic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 5 star deluxe which it is not. It is in need of urgent renovation in both the breakfast restaurant and the rooms. the staff where very friendly and helpful.their restaurant mirabelle is the best part of the hotel although its overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ExpatInItaly_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights. Our room was beyond quite and blackout dark at night. The concierge went out of his way to be helpful. They have a 1 Michelin star restaurant on the top level, which was great. You must go to the bar on the balcony for a drink at sunset for one of the best views in Rome. It is a few blocks from shopping on the Via Veneto and also from the Spanish Steps. However, it is on a much quieter street. The breakfast buffet included in our room rate was quite expansive and good. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a word of warning”
Reviews.Author: Beergibbon
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to write a long review here as everything about the stay was good (particularly the breakfast which was delicious and I agree with the previous reviewer that you want to avoid the middle seats) except for one thing which I will warn you about..... There are no irons and ironing boards in the hotel, which is explained in the hotel manual to be found in the room. As is typically the case, the Italian translation into English is a little wayward and it says that you can use the hotel laundering service to get your clothes pressed "against payment". I couldn't work out exactly what this meant (it could have gone either way) so I walked and asked the concierge. He told me it was a free service. When I received my clothes back I was presented with a bill for €42, which I of course queried. I was told that I must have misunderstood the other concierge (which I hadn't as I had been sure to get his response in very plain English to be safe) and was told that I HAD to pay it. Very poor service for an otherwise good hotel and something that mildly tarred the stay which my girlfriend had got me for my 30th and which had cost in excess of €2,000. But overall, I would recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Splendide for Special Occasions”
Reviews.Author: Burydrive
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Rome as part on my 40th birthday celebration. As part of this celebration, we spent two nights at the Hotel Splendide Royal (Room 201). Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The hotel is within a short taxi ride from the main train station (Roma Termini). It is located in a quiet part of town directly across from the Borghese Gardens. The hotel is also home to the Michelin starred restaurant Mirabelle (located on the rooftop with inside and outside terrace seating). We arrived at the hotel around noon. Checking in was pleasant, convenient, & our room was already prepared for us. The room was nice - very good size room, spacious & clean bathroom, courtyard view. The room was very quiet so we were able to sleep very well (during both the day - jetlag - and during the evening). Strangely, though, the bed was really uncomfortable - as if the mattress had been replaced by a box spring (not a huge issue - just strange for the quality of the hotel). Our room rate included breakfast so both mornings we made our way to the 6th floor dining room for breakfast. The dining room was very nice and bright - filled with natural light. The food was good and well presented. The restaurant serving staff were very professional as well. One tip regarding breakfast - try to avoid a table in the center of the restaurant (close to the buffet). The floor is very unstable around the buffet so every time anyone walks towards or around the buffet the people seated in the center of the room have to hold onto coffee cups and juice glasses to avoid having them spill (not a big deal as we were able to have a really good laugh over how much our table shook & how much coffee spilled during our meal). On the second morning, we sat around the outside of the room and everything was fine. We didn't eat at Mirabelle, but we did have drinks there twice. Once in the afternoon and once in the evening. The drinks were pricey (as are all drink prices in sit down restaurants in Rome), but well worth experiencing the view. On the second day of our stay the television in the room failed, but the repair staff promptly repaired it (within 45 minutes). My wife and I would definitely recommend staying at the Hotel Splendide Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and a beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: Juilletdix
Reviews.Content: I also got an upgrade to a huge deluxe room upon check in. I booked with American Express, but I am also a member of the "I Prefer" program through Preferred Hotels (which this property belongs to). Whatever it was, the room was amazing!! Huge, by any standards, but especially Rome, with a view of the Borghese Gardens. I've stayed at the Eden before and this was comparable in every way. I initally checked in with my boyfriend for 3 nights but our plans changed such that he had to go to Tuscany and I opted to stay in Rome for another 3 nights. The only thing I would comment on is that the staff was MUCH friendlier to me when my boyfriend was with me. I wasn't greeted or acknowledged when I stayed by myself. It seemed a bit odd to me. The staff was very accommodating whenever we approached them with a question. They recommended a great pizza place called San Marco, near the hotel, that we enjoyed. And they arranged a private car to take me to FCO. It's about 20 euros more than a taxi, but it's very swanky and I thought it was well worth the money. I'd recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Pure indulgence”
Reviews.Author: PeteandNic
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just spent a fabulous weekend at the Splendide Royal Hotel in Rome from 25-28 September. We opted for the limo service to collect us from the airport and arrived suitably chilled at the hotel in an E class Merc. On arrival, we were pleased to find out we had been upgraded for free to a Deluxe room. Our bags were taken to the room whilst we checked in at reception with the friendly receptionist (incidentally he remembered my name the next time we saw him - a nice touch). The room was opulently decorated in traditional style, with a couple of lovely comfy armchairs and a huge bed. The bathroom had his and hers basins and a superb over bath shower. This place oozes quality (it's not cheap but you get what you pay for!), and the attention to detail and service from the friendly staff is second to none. It is a 5 star hotel, but not pretentious or overly formal in any way. Breakfast was included in the room price, and this was also excellent, being taken in the terrace restaurant on the 6th floor. Since we were celebrating our engagement, my fiance and I went to the Girrarosto Fiorentino restaurant nearby (as recommended by the hotel), and this is also highly recommended. Wow!! I would recommend this place to anyone seeking a quality, indulgent weekend in Rome with the one you love. Priceless!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty everytime”
Reviews.Author: calisunkid
Reviews.Content: From Check-in to Checkout this place is always amazing. If you have the money you should really stay here. Everyone is always cordial and professional. You never see anyone not smiling at you or forgetting to greet you. I would suggest a suite with a terrace if you are there while the weather is pleasant. The views are breathtaking. The rooms are beautifully decorated, spotless , spacious and comfortable. I never wanted to leave.

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gerryoN_ireland
Reviews.Content: just a wonderful place which should not disapoint anyone. beautiful extravagant decor which you would expect in rome. staff friendly and helpful. well maintained and exceptionally clean. perfect location and an easy walk to the spanish steps. many restaurants around to choose from, did not chance the hotel one as it is expensive. breakfast was perfect, wonderful variety and presentation. one tip is to check the price of taxi to and from airport before starting journey as there is a set price of €40 which was never adhered to.

Reviews.Title: “Splendide Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: Supermom721
Reviews.Content: What happens when a family of five arrives in a foreign land, exhausted from a long flight, and walks through the doors of a warm and wonderful hotel? From the moment we arrived at the Splendide, we were made to feel truly "special". The Splendide's location was truly ideal. As directed by concierge Ivan and Frabricio, we were easily in walking distance of most of the important and fun sites that we had wanted to experience---the Spanish Steps, the shopping district, the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and the Piazza Navona, not to mention the Via Veneto. What we really liked about the Splendide was it's location across the street from the Borghese Gardens and Museums. Although we were in the heart of Rome, there was the beauty and peace of overlooking the Gardens, making this a better retreat than the Hassler or others that were in the crowded business district. Only a few blocks to where all of the action was! The hotel itself was lovely and clean. We stayed here twice during our trip, each time having beautiful rooms overlooking the Gardens. The rooms were traditionally decorated with fine bathrooms, all immaculately maintained. Becuase we had children with us, they accomodated our request for adjoining/adjacent rooms, even upgrading us to a suite when we first arrived! What a treat!!! We did use the internet service, which was easy to use We ate breakfast in the hotel, which was a perfect way to start the day. We did not eat in their acclaimed restaurant, Mirabelle, because of our children and the cost. Men are not allowed to wear dress shorts there, even for a cocktail. Everyone who we spoke to that ate there said it was a wonderful experience. The only downfall was the weight room, which needs updating, and the lack of a pool, not uncommon in Rome hotels. That was easily remedied by the Splendide as they offered the use of the pool at their affiliated hotel, the Parco de Principe, which was located nearby. Most of all, we LOVED the staff! From the welcoming doormen to the waitstaff in the breakfast room to the conciege staff, they all made you feel like royalty. I must mention the concierge Ivan, as he truly went out of his way to make this a special event for our family's celebration. He was always there, doing his best to make everyone's stay that much more Splendide!!! We will most definitely be back to the Splendide----though not soon enough!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome, loved the Splendide!”
Reviews.Author: TheDavester
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a four day stay at the Splendide Royal. We booked after reading the many positive reviews on TA and I'm pleased to be able to add another. The hotel was fantastic in every way, from the choice in the buffet breakfast to the fabulous views from the restaurant balcony. The hotel is situated near one of the entrances to Villa Borghese park and right at the top end of Via Veneto, one of the smartest streets in Rome with a good selection of restaurants and shops nearby. It's within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps and only a little bit further from the Tivoli Fountain. Ivan the concierge recommended that we take a taxi to some of the other sites as they were too far to walk in his opinion, however we were able to walk to all the other major sites quite easily - the Vatican, Romum Forum, Colliseum, Piazza Navonna ete etc. If you're not used to walking distances, there's lots of options other than taxi - city tours buses, Metro or you could even hire bicycles which are available for hire and return in and around some of the bigger attractions. All in all, we found Rome to be a great city, the people were all friendly and helpful without exception, the weather was glorious and the stay at the Splendide Royal was superb.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lornai
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. It was quite near to a metro so the sights of the city were very accessible. The rooms were large and clean and the bathrooms were huge. All the facilities were in good order and very clean. The views from the breakfast room, the bar and restaurant were absolutely break taking. We travelled throughout Italy for two weeks and I can honestly say this was the best hotel we stayed in, Be aware however that to drink at the bar and eat in the restaurant is very costly, so if you are on budget, I would advise you to avoid them as we paid £50 for a bottle of Prosecco on arrival which was a little bit indulgent, but those views……………

Reviews.Title: “The Splendide.. truly lived up to its name!”
Reviews.Author: 28A
Reviews.Content: My daughter, her 12 year old and I recently spent two nights in room 304 at the Splendide.. We found it comfortable, spacious, scrupulously clean. The welcome was friendly and sincere - everyone from the receptionist to the woman who tidied our room (brilliantly!!) made us feel as if they were delighted to have us staying with them. The legendary concierge, Ivan Cristante, stepped forward when a sudden emergency meant we needed to reschedule flights and cancel business appointments. His kindness, patience and support in a difficult time were unforgettable. Despite what could have been a disastrous holiday, we came away looking forward to returning to Rome. To us that will alway mean a return to the Hotel Splendide Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Doormen Rock”
Reviews.Author: Chaski
Reviews.Content: Glad to see the hotel is still going strong. I stayed here for my 5th wedding anniversary. My wife and I loved the place. The terrace breakfast overlooking the Gardens. Great mix of breakfast fare. Fresh blood oranges were the best. Coffee service and a few odd looks from the other guests. I guess we were a bit underdressed but zero attitude from the staff. The room was awesome, high ceilings, spotless, warm decor. Comfortable furnishings and plenty of storage space. The front desk was extremely courteous and helpful. Plenty of information, no problem changing money or suggestions for dining. The best were the doormen for the hotel. These guys recognized the rock band from a small album art patch on a backpack. Secret heavy metal lords!!! They went out of their way to make us feel like superstars. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our magical stay at Hotel Splendide 5* Deluxe”
