Reviews.Author: MEGGYMEG
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Hotel Splendide for our 25th Wedding anniversary, and pushed the boat out and booked the Villa Borghese Suite. The hotel and suite were magnificent and actually exceeded expectations. The staff were all attentive and very helpful as it was also our first time to Rome, and they made it very easy. I would like to start by making a special mention however about Ivan the concierge. I had been in touch by e-mail on a regular basis leading up to our holiday, regarding arrangements to pick up from the airport ,to booking restuarants. All which he did and his attention to detail was second to none. Ivan also arranged for us to renew our wedding vows at a very special chapel adjacent to the hotel which was just magical and highly recommend Ivan! The suite itself was just beautiful, the rooms were highly decorated, had a jacuzzi bath which we all made great use of after walking round Rome!. Luxury was a given here, and to compliment the rooms was a magnificent terrace over looking the Villa Borghese Park. It was outstanding and was certainly the highlight of our suite, every room including the bathroom had a door leading onto the terrace. It was quite private, had luxury rattan loungers, settee and table, as well as our own parasol table and chairs. The terrace was covered in Jasmine and wonderful plants which made it wonderful to sit out on an evening and watch the sun go down over the spanish steps! We stopped on a bed and breakfast basis, and the breakfast was ample enough to suit everyones taste and choices, I even heard a guest being asked how many minutes she would like her egg boiled for! Again the staff and service was deserving of the hotels status and excellence. We did dine at the hotel Mirabelle restuarant on the 7th floor for our 25th anniversary meal, which was really spectacular. We had an excellent table on the balcony over looking St Peters and its something we shall remember for a long time. The food was well deserving of its michelin star and was a truly memorable experience. The hotel is only five minutes away from the spanish steps and is quite central, with some great bars and restuarants around it. Although if in doubt, just ask Ivan, and he will point you in the direction of some excellent restaurants as he did for us. It was our first trip to Rome and hopefully the first of many to come. If you want a truly special experience, build your relationship with the hotel via Ivan, ask for all those details you want confirming so that when you finally get there is just pure pleasure. Just before I forget, when we got to our room, the hotel delievered to us complimentary champagne, cake and nibbles with their compliments for 2 nights leading up to our anniversary which also gave it that extra special touch. I would highly recommend this hotel to stop at for a special occassion or to just have that pure bit of indulgence we all deserve sometimes!

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nancor
Reviews.Content: We had four of the best days in Rome at The Splendide Royal. Our room was very comfortable and very very clean. From the doorman to the housekeeping staff, everyone was so friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a variety of hot and cold food, fruit and pastries. All delicious and filling. We had lunch at the hotel resturant called Mirabella. A wonderful selection of food. We had the best minnestrone soup and bread! We ate outside on the terrace and the view was magnificent! The service was quick and friendly. The hotel is in walking distance to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain. The recommendations for resturants and shopping were great. The staff couldn't do enough for us. The hotel is beautiful inside and quiet. It's located on a busy street, but we didn't here any traffic noise. We mentioned we would be celebrating our anniversary while in Rome. After a day of sightseeing, we were surprised by a bottle of champagne and a lovely note congratulating us on our special day! It is truly one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the spendid Splendide”
Reviews.Author: lyric52
Reviews.Content: On a side street just down the street from Harry's bar in Rome is the beautiful Hotel Spendide Royal. We were treated like queens by the fabulous staff The decor is museum like and elegance is everywhere one looks. The breakfast room offers up an incredible view of the city and the breakfasts are tasty and well thought out. Fresh fruits, meats, cheeses, breads and yogurts were there in abundance. I would and will return to the Hotel Splendide Royal on my next trip to Rome and recomend it the highest rating possible. Thanks for the memories.

Reviews.Title: “such a beautiful balcony..”
Reviews.Author: cunim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Junior Suite with a terrace for 4 nights in June 2008. Our room was about 10m x 3.5m (with a separate bathroom) and the balcony was of similar size. It was the end room nearest the lift and seemed to be slightly larger than the other junior suites, so the length measurement may vary, but the width does not. Overlooking the Villa Borghese gardens, these rooms are a superb find in busy Rome. They get afternoon sun, which makes them perfect for sunbaking on a rest day, for drinks before and after dinner, and for breakfast and dinner themselves! The moment of delight as you walk outdoors onto the terrace for the first time after a trip through the busy center of Rome was simply exquisite. The service at the hotel was extremely good, the rooms were clean and beautifully fitted out. The location is only a little out of the way from the Spanish steps, but not something a moderately fit person would regard as an issue. In any event it is convenient to the Via Veneto, still a fun place for a nice lunch and a spot of people watching. The restaurant Mirabelle is a really nice evening, with good food and wine and a simply stunning view over the Rome skyline at sunset. If you can, sit outside on the terrace. This is only a short review, but this hotel was one of the highlights of our recent trip to Italy. So much so, that every subsequent nice experience on the trip was referred to as a “splendide royal”!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Staff !!”
Reviews.Author: Divemaster57
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Splendide prior to our departure for a 10 day cruise. We arrived at the airport around 6:30 pm after an 30 hour trip over. We made pickup arrangements through the hotel and found our driver right outside the baggage claim as agreed. The traffic was horrible as usual and we had dinner reservations at Mirabella for 9pm. We arrived at the hotel around 8:30 and they were ready for our check in with paperwork and they had already notified the restaurant that we would not be there till at least 9:30 and told us to take our time and get freshened up and be at the restaurant when we were ready. Dinner was memorable overlooking the city. During our stay we could not have asked for anything more. Our Jr suite had a large porch over looking the Borgese park and museum. Just PERFECT! The breakfast was more than adequate to set you up for a day of sightseeing. Last time in Rome we stayed at the Hotel de Russie. Although it is very nice I prefer Splendide. It is a bit of an uphill walk coming back to the hotel, but nothing a healthy person cannot do. We walked back up the Via Veneto and watched the people go by. I do recommend this hotel and the Jr suites. It and the staff is a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Six Excellent Nights at a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffinbloomington
Reviews.Content: I took my two college-aged daughters and high school senior to Rome with my 85-year old parents and younger brother for six nights beginning May 28. We reserved four double superior rooms. The rooms were excellently decorated and spacious. The bathrooms were fine...tiled floors and walls, nice bath and separate room for the shower and toilet/bidet. Everyone slept well. The breakfast on the 6th floor overlooks Rome and was the perfect gathering spot for our group. The buffet was the same all mornings...scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage on one table with a variety of cheeses; on another table were croissants, rolls and yougurts. There were four juices and several cereals to choose from. Bottled still and sparkling water and champagne were also plentiful. The service was attentive. The best aspect of the hotel is the service. Fabiola and Ivan were teriffic as conceirges. They recommended a number of excellent restaurants, which we loved. After consulting them via e-mail before arrival, we landed on these for dinner: Colline Emililane; Pierluigi; Agata e Romeo; Da Pietro; Girarrosto Fiorentino; and Mirabelle on top of the hotel. All the staff treated us warmly (six nights x four rooms at 400 Euros =9600 Euros or about $16,000). The exception was the bar upstairs, when one night, my wife, one daughter and i appeared for a nightcap dressed casually...i had to complain to get service (see below) The American Bar on the same floor as the restaurant, a Michelin-starred restaurant, has a nice terrace overlooking Rome with views of the Vatican, which is lovely at night. Drinks aren't cheap, however, so you may opt to have a late-night appertif near the Spanish Steps. But save a night for Mirabelle (and save your money to pay for it!). The food was excellent and worthy of the rating. Message to Americans: This hotel is not cheap; with the dollar at a low, it will cost you a pretty penny to stay here. Its worth the money. My only nit is the one evening at the American Bar. I was not dressed with a sport coat and I give the place a black mark for not asking if we were guests as we appeared. I believe they judged us by the way we were dressed and didn't realize i was spending a lot of money with the hotel. But, the other nights we were there, we had no issues(we had sport coats). The location is great. I must say, my parents needed taxis due to their age, but it is not as tough getting around as some reviews note. The restaurant next door salts their food to oblivion, so be careful there. Bottom line....Service, solitude, high-quality acommodation, relaxing atmosphere and great place to relax means I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service- perfect location”
Reviews.Author: greencrt
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time, the hotel was clean, good services and a useful , knowledgable concierge. We made all our plans far in advance for every day with the concierge.our best experiencewas with the concierge's recommendations for a a guide tour, we could not enjoyed ROME or its surroundings without that. The hotel had an excellent location, close to the Spanish steps and all shopings. We originaly heard about the hotel from friends who had dinner at its fabulous Terrace restaurant which we also enjoyed it , it was an unforgetable diner..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imagistlg
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. My only minor complaint was that the scrambled eggs were terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarleySanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Splendid Royal and was very impressed with staff, as well as the gorgeous accomodations. We were treated royally from the beginning to the end of our stay. The young lady who first greeted us as we checked in was always at the front desk whenever we needed any help (she always remembered my name & room number). We booked a room with 2 beds and were surprised at hou w large the room was - and the bathroom was very large and absolutely beautiful. The location was perfect (not far from the Spanish Steps). I cannot find one thing to complain about - I would definintely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: AnsiSweden
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel with the fantastic restaurant Mirabell.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful expensive hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: dgibb
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel on Skyauction.com for $200.00 US per night. The room we stayed in, according to the sign in the closet, was 780 euro/nt!!!! So we got a great deal, but I basing this on the amount we should have paid, as $200 is a great rate for nearly any class hotel in Rome. Room include breakfast, and was by far the BEST breakfast I had my entire trip. The view from the breakfast room was wonderful. The staff was extremely helpful and the hotel was very quite. The hotel was absolute steal at our auction price, but I would have been disappointed to have a small room, for the price they sell at. Location was near the top of the Spanish Steps and therefore close to the main shipping area of Rome. ROME: alway very busy, we were told that August is the quietest time of the year. Just some info we came across.

Reviews.Title: “comfy, pleasant, and well-located”
Reviews.Author: kaytchinha
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip to Rome in April 2008. I was in residence for a week and a half, and I found the hotel to be a lovely, homey place to live for that amount of time. The room was small by American standards, but very opulently fitted, with fine details in gold and velvet and marble. I especially appreciated the compact but well constructed solid wood wardrobe, which had ample room for my clothes and kept me well-organized. The bathroom was spacious for a European bathroom, with marble throughout. The linen sheets were lovely to sleep on. Basically, this hotel does a good job with little touches, like the fine Italian jelly candies in the turndown service and the very decent Italian wine in the fridge. Given their attention to detail, I was somewhat disappointed that they did not recognize my birthday, especially since they asked for my birthdate at check-in and it occurred during my stay, and that seems like the kind of detail they would be all over. Not a huge deal, though. Other things I enjoyed were the delicious room service meals from the restaurant-- order the simple capellini with tomatoes and basil and you will not be disappointed (do prepared to pay a pretty penny for room service). Breakfast was always very pleasant with the view of Rome and the delicious and plentiful spiced prunes and blood oranges. I would recommend this hotel for business or pleasure, and would say that it is a solid 4.5 star-- luxurious and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid indeed !!”
Reviews.Author: jaybe24
Reviews.Content: I travelled to rome with my daughter and stayed at the Splendide Royal about a ten minute walk from the Spanish Steps. It is quiet relaxed and the staff utterly charming and although they must give endless numbers of guests the same old info on their maps - it is all delivered with a great deal of gusto! Our room was great and beautifully serviced and 'refreshed' the breakfast view as good as promised. I would certainly stay there again - hopefully the three coins in the fountain will ensure I do !

Reviews.Title: “A Very Special Hotel Splendide Royale Rome”
Reviews.Author: LOlaMJohannesburgSA
Reviews.Content: Hotel Splendide Royale Rome March 2008 We did not know what to expect, had read the reviews, but thought Rome was a bit tourist weary, and that service in general would not be up to scratch. The staff at the Splendide were outstanding. They were friendly, helpful, and always went the extra mile to be of assistance. The Concierge team get top marks, whatever they recommended, from restaurants to advice was always just right. Check in was friendly and welcoming. Breakfasts are excellent, in a beautiful venue. One always had the feeling that one was staying in a private villa, not a hotel. Our junior suite overlooked the Borghese Gardens, and the accommodation was extremely comfortable and furnished in superb taste. The only negative was that the clothes cupboard was a bit on the small side. We would have no hesitation in returning to the Splendide, so excellent was our personal experience of our stay. Brian & Lola Marcus Johannesburg South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: CyPete
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four-day weekend trip to Rome where we stayed at the Hotel Splendide Royal. The location is excellent with wonderful vistas of the city and the Vatican from the rooftop restaurant and bar. The hotel is well located and definitely within walking distance of most evrything you would want to see in the city. The rooms were very clean and housekeeping did an excellent job. The room was a little smaller than I expected but it was well put together. The best thing about staying at the hotel was the service. When we arrived, we were greeted by very pleasant hotel staff. Once we checked in, we were given recommendations on what to see on what days and routes to take to ensure we were able to see everything we wanted to see in the four days. Ivan was the person we spoke to and he was fabulous. He also recommended a few things we didn't know about that were on our way and really worth seeing. He also let us in on the secrets to avoiding the long lines at St. Peter's, the Forum and the Colisseum. Ivan made wonderful recommendations each night for dinner. We throughly enjoyed the restaurants he recommended. Most were casual, local places with excellent food and atmosphere that really gave you a more local Roman experience. We loved the rooftop bar and usually spent some time there before dinner each night. It is a little pricey but the views are worth the expense. It is located at the restaurant so if you aren't dressed for dinner, you will probably be seated in a corner out of the sight of other patrons. We were casually dressed as you would be on a realxing holiday so we were always seated out of sight. Other than that, service at the bar was excellent as well. We have travelled extensively in Europe and this is probably the best place we have stayed. We will definitely be returning. We really hope Ivan is still there too!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AKPT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days and 4 nights at the Hotel Splendide Royal. We found the entire staff, especially the housekeeping staff, to be extremely helpful and willing to assist with our requests. Our room was a Superior room, and it had plenty of room and was impeccable. We both really liked the breakfast. One review said the breakfast was repetitive, but we didn't find it a problem. Yes, it was the same food each day, but there were so many choices that included savory foods, fresh baked cakes and pastries, plenty of fresh fruits, and cereal. There was a great deal of variety of wonderful foods, so I think that complaint shouldn't be misconstrued. The hotel is very near the Villa Borghese and it only took us 10 minutes to walk to the Spanish Steps or to the Barberini Metro Stop. We did take the number 116 bus on occasion as well. We didn't find the location on the hill a problem, but if it was our parents or someone with some mobility problem, then we would recommend taxis. We highly recommend Hotel Splendide Royal and will stay here again if we're back in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “location, location , location....”
Reviews.Author: curmudgeons
Reviews.Content: If this hotel is one of the highest rated in Rome by trip advisor members, then we have bridge for sale. Nevertheless the Splendide Royal is a good hotel with a friendly,helpful staff and with a decent ( if repetitive ) breakfast. The room we had was confortable, the bathroom was large but there was abolutley no view. The airconditioning is not up to American standards and housekeeping services were inconsistent. Despite claims to the contrary, we found the hotels location troublesome. First of all it is located on top of a hill, which from the Spanish Steps takes a good 20 minutes to reach. There is no public transportation in the vicinity with the exception of a small mini bus, #116. The closest metro stop is around 20 minutes away and that can be a long walk after touring the forum,palentine hill or the vatican all day, particuarly if you are middle age or older. If the dollar weren't so devalued ( no fault of the hotel) quick cab rides would not seem so expensive. In addition the better restaurants in the immediate vicinity of the hotel are neither good nor inexpensive. If you use a tour service stay away from Vastours they always seem to have problems and poor tour guide operators . Despite these few negatives, the hotel does have a certain European charm and while we recommend it, we feel that tourist can better benefit from other more centrally located hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Splendinde Royal Rome is Splendid”
Reviews.Author: hsbarton
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at the Splendide Royal over Easter break and loved it. The front desk/concierge could not have been more helpful or friendly. The rooms were lovely with very nice sized marble bath rooms. The breakfast buffet was included with room. It had a wonderful selection of hot and cold foods, not to mention a beautiful location on the 6th floor terrace of the hotel. Location was an easy walk to the Spanish Steps and Villa Borghese. Can't wait for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Splendide Indeed”
Reviews.Author: WestchesterTrails
Reviews.Content: Hotel Splendide Royal is an absolute gem. My wife and I were visiting Italy on a belated honeymoon, and the hotel assisted in making this a truly wonderful trip to remember. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous from checking in, to helping us plan our daily excursions (avoiding the Roman marathon where possible), to making reservations at wonderful restaurants, etc. There was even a young desk attendant who called and asked a local store in front of the Spanish Steps to stay open a couple of minutes past closing time as we were rushing over. My wife is now the proud owner of a couple pairs of lovely Italian leather gloves. Grazie. I don't even know what to say about the rooftop restaruant, Mirabelle. Wow. That was truly an incredible Italian meal. My wife and I ate so much, and we were so amazed at the flavors and presentation. I have to confess that the Italian restaurants here in NY seem to be a step behind. We also loaded up w/ the breakfast each day which was also fantastic. If you can't tell, we had a wonderful trip to Italy and the Hotel Splendide Royal really made the experience memorable. The only thing missing in the this hotel is that last star. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great small boutique hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: sushi33
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel !! Front desk very friendly and very efficient. Hotel is located in quiet street off via Veneto. 10 minutes walk from Piazza di Spagna and Trinita dei Monti. Good size rooms, but small bathrooms. Internet Wifi is available but extracharge (1hour or 1day access) The main attraction is the breakfast on the terrace on the topfloor, not to be miss, under no circumstances. Superbe view !! and great breakfast. Best value restaurant in Roma ?? Restaurant GALEASSO in Piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere. Great italian food, Excellent service, and romantic place (go there at evening, and you will lucky to meet the singer playing Guitar, and ask him your favourites italian songs. Most special place for "brunch on Sunday ?? Restaurant of HASSLER Hotel, on the 6 floor !! 5 minutes walk from Splendide Royal hotel Magnificent view, and exquisite buffet. Fixed price 70 EURO (excluding wine) Advance reservations required, because restaurant is not too big. One "special" way to see Roma, is to rent a scooter, really easy and the romans are more careful of the scoooters than pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic HOtel”
Reviews.Author: homerwilboy
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel after reading all the other reviews. It certainly lived up to its expectations. Upon our arrival the staff were very friendly and pleasantly surprised to hear they upgraded our room from a Deluxe to a Junior Suite, free of charge. The room was beautiful and the Mirabelle Restaurant, although expensive, was fabulous, with great views The location is excellent, about 10 minute walk from the Spanish steps, trevi fountain and about 15 mins from Pantheon and Piazza Navone. Some reviews said the staff were unfriendly, but they were excellent, nothing was too much trouble and gave us lots of advice on where to go, what to see, the best places to eat etc. We would definitely stay here again, a wonderful place, highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The hartbeat of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Puma66
Reviews.Content: Hi! This was our first time in Rome and my wife's birthday.., so it was important for us to find the perfect place for our stay. We was looking for a good location, "Rome" romantic atmosphere, good Italian restaurant, high standard, a place with robe and slippers ;-).. So we booked a room at the Hotel Splendide Royal.. and we got it all!!! +++ The service excellent, the people supernice..the good restaurant was much more than good..it was kiss kiss BIG time nice.. Romantic.. food mmm... perfect! After a long walk in the beautiful city of Rome with a lot of impressions. It made the impressions even stronger when we got back to the hotel room.. sink in to a hot Jacuzzi with a Champagne.. THANK'S to all the people at the Splendide Royal for making our stay to a beautiful memories of Rome… We'll be back!! Tone & John form Norway

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: SumWine
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews, the hotel has lost none of its charms. Nothing was too much trouble and there was always a friendly good morning or evening, often with our name, whenever we passed by reception. As previously mentioned this is a luxury hotel and is priced as such. e.g. 6 Euros for a can of coke in the mini bar. We had dinner in the fabulous restaurant to celebrate our honeymoon and it was fabulous food, fabulously expensive and witha terrific atmosphere and impeccable, friendly service. The staff (of which there were plenty) were attentive and not at all condescending; it seemed like they really wanted to serve in whatever way you wanted and this went for the hotel as a whole. The location is great for the designer boutiques at the bottom of the Spanish Steps (you do need to go down them though, so not suitable for the disabled) and we were able to walk to the majority of the main attractions. Waking to The Vatican would take a while though. If you want to feel pampered and don't mind the cost you won't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at the Splendide”
Reviews.Author: BearLady1
Reviews.Content: We have jsut returned from a long weekend at the Splendide in Rome, it lived up to expectations. The service was excellent and our large room quite lovely, with a huge bathroom and walk in wardrobe. I'm not a fan the linen sheets - I appreciate the luxury but find them a bit hard. My husband raved about them though, so that is a matter of taste. I was lucky enough to celebrate a birthday there, we had an meal at the Mirabelle, however, as previous reviews have stated is really is very expensive. The cooking was good - although I would be interested to see if they hold onto their Michelin star, I didn't think it quite made it. What did make the evening for me was the sheer big time, rather old fashioned 'Swishness' - you simply don't get restaurants like this in London anymore. Lots of waiters in tail coats, candles and roses on the table - a crooner with a piano and a repetroire of Andy Williams classics added to the romantic nostalgia. Then there was the view of Rome by night. Magical. However, if the above itsn't your bag you may resent the price tag. All in all a memorable weekend at a top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AndyP007
Reviews.Content: Having read several reviews on this hotel I decided to book myself and my girlfriend in for 2 nights for a nice weekend break. I can say that the hotel lived up to all expectations! The hotel lobby is finished in fine marble and you 'feel' like you are staying in a 5* hotel. We arrived about 12:30pm and were told that our room was already ready and we could check in straight away. As we checked in the Receptionist gave us a map and pointed out where we were and how to get to the main places of interest. The room was spacious and grand, with a huge bathroom and walk in wardrobe. Breakfast was included and served on the 6th floor terrace. There was a large selcetion; we did review the menu for the evening- one word of warning- the food is pricey £20 for Onion soup! Given the abundance of good, reasonably priced restaurants in Rome, you dont need to eat at the hotel. Location is excellent. 5 mins walk from the Spanish steps/ shopping district. If you want a nice bar for a late drink, Harry's Bar just up from the hotel is excellent

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liburdke
Reviews.Content: Hotel Splendide Royale is a great find. The rooms are large and comfortably, with lots of luxury touches. The staff was all extremely friendly and eager to help us see the city. The breakfast is extensive by European standards. The location is terrific: on a small side street, but just across from the Villa Borghese and convenient to all the sites. One caveat: I stayed here on business travel and the hotel is really not geared toward that market. Internet connection was spotty at best.

Reviews.Title: “the people and place were wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: feeble8
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the earlier reviewer we found the staff at the front desk to be very helpful, and friendly. There was always a smile waiting for us to return and never hesitated to help. Happily they made a reservation in Trastevere (our request) on Christmas, suggestions on touring, and always dealing with our questions with grace. The bedrooms and bathrooms were large, I only wish that I awoke this morning to the same breakfast (eggs, breads, fresh fruit, yoghurt, a variety of juices, meats, cheeses ...... and others that I am probably forgetting ) at the Splendide. The view from the terrace was amazing, never needed to ask for coffee, always available and friendly staff. We had a couple rooms on the first floor (2nd flr in the US) and everyone commented that the 2 things that we would miss were the large bathrooms and especially the people. The location is above the Spanish Steps, many of our journeys started with a short walk to the Borghese entrance to the Spagna Metro station, it's actually an underground walkway, we found it to be very clean. Our trip was during Christmas week and it seemed like Rome was not very crowded. When we ran out of steam we'd take a taxi back to the hotel. It was very convenient. Do make a reservation for the Gallery at the Villa Borghese and if the weather is nice take advantage of walks in the park for a break.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed hotel sullied by questionable day staff”
Reviews.Author: atlantic_transplant
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on previous reviews, and regret ignoring the reviews about the front desk staff. Hotel rooms were large by European standards, coming with an entry way joining the bathroom, bedroom and closet. The bedroom was very clean and nicely furnished with a large armchair, desk, flat screen cable, etc. The deluxe room also had a walk-in closet/changing area. The sheets were linen, not cotton, so were very crisp (and not very soft). Fortunately, I am a fan of crisp sheets, although others may not be. Also, the staff did an excellent job of cleaning and arranging each day, making the room a nice sanctuary to return to at the end of each day. The bathroom was also nicely appointed with marble everywhere, fresh robes, towel warmer, a good share of toiletries (including bath salts), etc. Bathroom also included a tub, rather than shower stall. The cloth curtain, held to the rod by plastic loops, didn't quite wrap enough around the tub to avoid the spillage noted in earlier reviews. The bottom of the tub barely fit two feet together while facing the showerhead. The bathtub seems more suitable for soaking, as it is definitely deep enough (and much more comfortable to sit in). The 3rd floor room we got overlooked the street that separates the hotel from Borghese, and also Borghese if you looked beyond the street. Our room was at tree line so much of the park was obscured. However, if you craned your head out the window to the left, it made for a nice view of the city at sunset. Breakfasts were very plentiful as indicated by other reviewers, and very tasty. Also, the view from the breakfast room is absolutely lovely in the morning. For all of this it seemed like a great place to stay and recommend to friends, provided you have zero interaction with the front desk day staff. Ivan was incredibly helpful in booking us reservations (at a cost of 3 euro extra per ticket) during the incredibly “busy” season, while using words like “idiota” while smiling cheerfully at us. (November and December, as we confirmed at the attraction, are low seasons when reservations are not at all necessary). When asked if it was very busy at the attraction, Ivan confirmed that it was indeed very busy, and would likely be difficult to change the reservation. Umberto, was helpful in booking us the private hotel limo (cost of 60 euro), since it was “much better” than the taxis. The hotel limo was a flat rate as opposed to the varying rate that taxis could charge. When asked, he told us the taxi rate could be anywhere between 45, 50 or 55 euro (turns out, the taxi rate to/from FCO is actually fixed at 40 euro). He assured us this was a good deal, as we would get a different better experience. Different, yes. The driver dropped us at the wrong terminal. The driver also assured us it was definitely the correct one, even after we told him our flight destination. Needless to say, this “idiota” of a turista will be researching future stays elsewhere. The location, rooms, and housekeeping staff are great. But for a “5-star” hotel, with the corresponding price tag, I would have appreciated a touch of honesty to go with those smiling faces. If you do decide to stay here, make sure to do your research elsewhere, rather than using the front desk/concierge as a resource lest you be another idiota taken for a ride.

Reviews.Title: “Rome's hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: jimshagwell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon this November and loved it. The location, service, level of comfort and maintenance of this property and the staff are second to none. We booded the hotel's "orange blossom package" which is basically their honeymoon package, it includes 1-way private car from airport-hotel, complimentary breakfast buffet every day, 1 complimentary dinner at their acclaimed restaurant, 10% discount for lunch, and a severely upgraded room. Our room was on the top floor with a huge balcony overlooking the Borgese Gardens. We had a Jacuzzi with heated towel rack and great linens. The concierge service was professional and friendly, the front desk staff made us feel like family, and the food was delicious. As this hotel is about 1 block from the Via Veneto on a quiet street, its in the heart of it all but still kind of out of the way, for privacy. The only downside was the fact that the US dollar continues to be devalued and our money was worth less and less each day. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who likes good hotels :)

Reviews.Title: “YES!! Would do this again!”
Reviews.Author: smartiq
Reviews.Content: Near the Via Veneto, this hotel overlooked a green park (Villa Borghese) so the view from the window was nice. It was a block away from VIa Veneto for strolling, shopping and coffee. It was also very near the Spanish steps (3-4 blocks). HOwever, you had to go down the Spanish steps to get to the Via COndotti shopping area -- so don;t wear heels and if you are older, take a cab. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel lobby as well as the rooms were beautiful and large to our delight with all the comfort itels such as robes and slippers and mini bar and desk with stationery, also a window with a beautiful view. THis is a 5* hotel at a reasonable price and I would stay again. DO not however use the the internet in the lobby. For 10 minutes, I was billed 50 EUROS on my credit card -- not a nice welcome home from such an otherwise excellent hotel. THey should remove the computer from the lobby or let guests use their own.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Armonk
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 4 night stay and we felt the hotel lived up to its reviews. The rooms are elegant. The bathrooms are large and have all that you could need and it all works well. It took a while to figure out the unusual lighting system which involves inserting a room card in a slot when you enter to turn the lights on. There was free American style buffet breakfast on the 6th floor and that was a highlight of the stay. The staff was always very helpful and courteous to us and I cannot imagine how some earlier reviewers had different experiences. We were using miles to stay there and were herding 4 very casually dressed youths and the staff knew all this so that if they were inclined to be snobby we were easy targets for that yet I saw none of that. They arranged all our airport transportation and restaurant reservations and they all went well. This hotel is located near the Spanish steps but it is not hard to get over to the Forum/Coloseum area or to many other areas. The Vatican is definitely a cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “The Splendide Royal a Splendid Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: splendide
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel, The Splendide Royal - Rome My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon this November, a long weekend. We opted for the Orange Blossom Package for honeymooners, it was fabulous, we had a junior corner suite, with a great jacuzzi and lights bath! great views. The staff were extreemly helpfull especially Ivan the concierge. The package also included transporttion from the airport ( it would have been nice to throw in the return journey as well, but nevermind), a 4 course meal in the Mirabelle restaruant which was divine. and a bottle of champagne and some beautiful roses. Very close to all ameinaties including prada, gucci etc etc as well as Spanish Steps, Trevvi Fountain . We will definately be going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Superior hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: willgord
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked at another hotel in Rome, which then withdrew our reservation and would only make a new reservation at a far higher price. Based on reviews in Trip Advisor, we then contacted the toll-free number of the hotel group that owns or makes reservations for the Splendide Royal. Despite the generally favorable reviews on Trip Advistor, we weren't sure what to expect. In fact, we were delighted with the Splendide Royal. Visited the hotel we had orignally reserved at and were pleased we had switched to the Splendide Royal. A top hotel in every way. The room was huge, with super high ceilings, windows overlooking the Borghese Gardens and lots of lavish, beautiful trim. There was also a dressing area as big as many hotel rooms I have stayed in and a huge, all-marble bath. Bed, with 100 percent linen sheets, was a delight. Front desk/concierge service was top notch. We had the hotel arrange a car to meet our cruise ship and another car to take us to the airport. Both drivers were excellent. Breakfasts on the 6th floor were wonderful and the views added to our dining pleasure. Had one meal at the 7th floor Mirabella restuarant and loved it. It has one star and deserves it. Good food, superb service and presentation that added to the experience. The hotel isn't cheap. Cost us around $600 a night--but $200 of that was due to the depressed state of the dollar. But the other hotel we had originally booked at would have cost even more and it was far less attractive, with a poorer location, than the Splendide Royal. We would return to the hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: axelbart
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Splendide Royal in Rome, Italy. We travel quite a bit and found the hotel to be welcoming after long days of sightseeing. The location was fine. The rooms were well-decorated and maintained; bathrooms had many appointments. The staff was courteous and helpful, and the public places beautiful. Although we didn't have dinner at the restaurant, we had a drink on the rooftop and had an amazing view of Rome at night. Breakfast was delicious and gave us still another opportunity to see the city from an elevated position.

Reviews.Title: “a magnificent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunnyladyflorida
Reviews.Content: We, along with another couple,stayed at the Hotel Splendide Royal for three nights in October 2007. The hotel is gorgeous and appears exactly as it is advertised on its website. It is in an ideal location. Our individual rooms were beautiful and spotlessly clean. The staff was attentive, gracious and always interested in our welfare. I became ill while in Rome and a physician visit was arranged for me by the hotel with the physician coming to our hotel room. It was to my satisfaction and comfort and a staff member kindly went to the pharmacy and brought my prescription to me. The hotel restaurant is gorgeous and the balcony which overlooks the Borghese Gardens is breathtaking, especially at sunset or in the evening. If staying there, avail yourself of this area as it is too lovely to miss. The hotel breakfast was delicious with an array of selections overseen by a very attentive staff. The hotel was quiet and our every need was met to our utmost satisfaction. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: rossvance20
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very central although I would not recommended it for the elderly or those with very young children as there is quite a steep incline to the hotel and the Spanish steps (which are very close and a short cut to other areas of interest) can be too much for those not able to climb. The hotel did tell us about a lift at the steps which is not clearly marked but saved legs. However, the lift stops working early evening. The hotel rooms were very clean and well furnished. The bathrooms had all the little extras which make the difference. Breakfasts were plentiful and the staff very accommodating. The staff on the desk were great, nothing was too much trouble and they gave plenty of useful advice for seeing the city in a short space of time. Although we did not spend a great deal of time at the hotel, it was nice to come back to a room which was very relaxing and sound proof!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal at the Splendide Royal”
Reviews.Author: luxuriousbargains
Reviews.Content: I watched this hotel like a hawk for weeks before I booked. I eventually found a room at this beautiful hotel for $170 USD. My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights of our 15 night honeymoon. We stayed at all 4 and 5 star hotels, and this was definitely one of our favorites. The breakfast was delicious and abundant, and even better than the food was the view from the restaurant. One night we had drinks on the terrace at the top of the hotel, and they provided us with complimentary chocolates and tiny desserts (I don't remember what they were but I remember they were good). We walked everywhere in Rome from our hotel, and found fantastic restaurants nearby. We found the bed to be comfortable and the bathroom was clean and pretty luxurious. I took home a lot of the soaps and shampoos we had left over because they were so nice. The staff at this hotel were extremely friendly and accomodating. I would recommend this hotel, and urge you to look for deals online.

Reviews.Title: “Splendide Manager/ Splendide Concierge/ Splendide Service At The Splendid Royal”
Reviews.Author: age
Reviews.Content: We loved the Splendide Royal - we had a Deluxe Room which was a wonderful value. But what sets this hotel apart is the excellence of the management and all the personal care from the Concierge Staff. We have been to Rome many times but this is where we will now stay - you feel as if you are in a wonderful boutique hotel. Our room was lovely and we walked everywhere - could not have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy”
Reviews.Author: KEW15
Reviews.Content: My wife and I began a two-week celebration of our 30th anniversary with two nights at the Spendide Royal in Rome. We splurged on a superior double at a very pricey 680 euros/night, by far our most expensive hotel while in Italy. For those who can afford this price range, this hotel lives up to its name (splendid). The facilities are gorgeous and the staff incredibly pleasant and attentive. The location is terrific - we walked all over central Rome, yet our hotel's location bordering the Borghese Gardens made it a pleasant respite from the busy city. (The walks were lengthy, but if you like hiking in cities, this is a great point of departure.) Our room was well-appointed and decent sized, if somewhat smaller than we expected, given the price and description. We loved our small, private balcony overlooking the gardens. (Being on the top floor helped.) The bathroom was huge, with a large two-person jacuzzi, great bath salts, two sinks, etc. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: SFO_94109
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay at the Splendide Royal in Rome. This hotel should be renamed to "Splen-dud". I'm shocked at how this hotel could have received an overall rating of 5 - it just confounds me. This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. I'd give it zero stars if I could. First, when you check-in, not only do you give them your passport so they can photocopy it (this is standard practice at all hotels), but you are forced to fill out a long form with the same exact information that is contained on your passport (which they just photocopied). What's the point of that! Then, instead of photocopying your credit card (like most hotels do, which is common practice), they take your card, run it through the old contraption (that retailers in the 1980's used to have) that makes an impression or carbon copy of your credit card...and then they make you sign it - so folks, this is basically a blank receipt that you're authorizing. This makes it difficult to contest unwarranted charges with your credit card company if the hotel decides to randomly charge you for something you did not authorize nor use. In the eyes of your credit card company, if there's a receipt with an authenticated signature on it...you're out of luck. We arrived at the hotel a full 2 hours past check-in time...the room wasn't ready. We specifically requested a quiet room, and to them that means a room by the heavily trafficked stairwell. When we asked to be moved...we got blank stares and were barely acknowledged. They finally said they'd look into it and get back to us. We never heard anything from them regarding the change in the entire time we were there. Btw, there's no real concierge. We inquired about tours and such. We were handed a brochure and left to our own devices. They weren't interested in assisting us in any way, so we walked over to the Sofitel Roma (which is just around the corner) and got the information we needed. Back to the room - in order to get into the room, they give you an actual key....and only 1. You also get a card to turn on the lights. Don't understand why you need two methods for the room. Upon entering the room, we could immediately detect a musty odor and had to open the window. The smell came from the bathroom - see the pictures I uploaded of the horrid bathroom. The bathroom was so nasty. Mold, mildew, fungus, water stains everywhere. Broken equipment and things falling apart. The shower curtain had mildew on it. Great hotels don't use shower curtains anymore. The shower did have good water pressure, but since there was a curtain, the floor got completely soaked...flooded even. And the hair dryer was a piece of machinery out of the cold war era. I couldn't use it very long as it would get so hot I couldn't hold it. The bed was very hard and the beddings were rough like sand paper. The rug was dark, smelly, and very worn. The furniture is worn out too, the walls had damage and were filthy....and there was a faint smell in the room of cigars or cigarettes. There's inadequate ventilation in the bathroom, so you had to open the window in the bedroom to air it out. That's lame...especially if you were to stay there in the midst of winter. There's a speaker in the bathroom that's connected to the TV. But there's no volume control - only on the TV set. So if you have the TV on in the room, you have to turn the volume down to a point where you can barely hear it because the volume in the bathroom was too loud. Also lame. I also found the room to be too dark despite the large window. Sort of depressing, really. There were no extra electrical outlets and the outlets they did have were not at a decent height - all located near the floor. So if you had to charge a battery pack...you had to unplug a lamp. and when you unplugged a lamp...the room got even darker so more depressing. The only good thing about this hotel is that we were only booked into it for 3 days. Trust me on this folks, stay away from this hotel...it's a complete waste of your hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jodilew
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Splendide Royal is Rome was superb. Aside from being a beautiful hotel and centrally located, the staff was exceptional. I immediately felt comfortable there, and everyone was warm and friendly. They went out of their way to make us comfortable. I have some food allergies, and they went above and beyond to find safe restaurants for me, in addition to giving us plenty of information about Rome. They arranged tours for us, and directed us on the map for great walks. When you go, ask for Ivan... he's the best!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: WicklowSophia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last three nights of our honeymoon and were HUGELY disappointed. The staff were nice enough on arrival but it took a long time for our room to be ready and even longer for the porter to bring our bags. The room itself overlooked a bin area and we were not given a bottle of prosecco or anything special on account of this being our honeymoon despite the fact other travellers seem to have been. The room itself was nice and clean but we found the staff a little smug and self-important. We ate at the Mirabelle on the last night which was also a real let down, one staff member in particular was rude and patronizing and made us feel a little uncomfortable on account of my being vegetarian and asking if I could order a soup and then a bowl of pasta instead of secondi, this apparently is NOT the Italian way! He also got our order wrong, not the service one expects from a michelin star restaurant. We stayed at much nicer hotels and I am surprised at the rating given by Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pimpkin
Reviews.Content: What in the world are people on this site talking about??????? We were originally booked at the Excelsior on the Via Veneto but after reading the reviews on this site we changed our reservation to the Spendide. This turned out the be the biggest (and luckily the only) mistake on our recent 2 week vacation. I just looked at receent reviews and the one person who dogged this hotel got it right. We had almost the same experience. The day manager (or whatever he is) is a mess and shouldn't be at the desk of a supposed 5 star hotel. We booked a suite via the website. The option told us we may or may not have a balcony. We wrote and asked specifically for the balcony as it was our 20th anniversary. When we arrived, we were told our suite didn't have a balcony, that we specifically selected a suite without a balcony and if we wanted one it would cost extra (the room was already $1,000 a night!!). They were willing to give us a regular deluxe double with a balcony but for the same price. WHen we got to the room, it was three small connected rooms in the center of the building overlooking an alley. No one seemed to care we didn't like our room. The day manager was rude and challenged us on the reservation we made on their website!! In the room, the front door didn't shut. The manager told us to just leave and go out -- no one would take our stuff. When we wouldn't go out, we waited an hour for someone to fix it (they told us it would take 5 minutes). Finally, 2 1/2 hours later after serveral calls to the desk and serveral lies from them, we moved to a new suite with a balcony that was attached to the roof thus other could come down onto our balcony. In this room, with a tiny bathroom for a suite, one of the toilets continually ran. The manager then had the nerve to ask my husband to write a letter to the general manager, who threatened to fire him for not helping us properly. We were supposed to tell the general manager that we didn't mind what happened!!! Everything else was a distaster -- the restaurant on the roof (La Mirabelle) messed up our reservation. By the way, this restaurant is way overpriced for what it is -- a Michelin 1 star with a great view. If you want a better dining experience in Rome, go to Agata y Romeo, a family run 1 star or the 3 star restaurant at the Hilton. Transportation to the airport was a problem, reservations we asked for ahead of time were messed up. The day manager consistently blamed a concierge who "happens to be out today." We travel alot in Europe, we always stay in great hotels and I can say with confidence, this was one of the worst experiences we have ever had. Stay at the Excelsior or the Russie!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Splendide indeed!”
Reviews.Author: ArgusEnzo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I do alot of travelling and this hotel is worthy of a top rating. It was beautiful, the rooms very clean and well appointed. Everyone at the hotel (especially Luca at the front desk) was very helpful and full of information. We would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: JohnandClaire007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 26th August to 2nd September 07. We loved every minute of the holiday. The room was cleaned twice a day at least!! The location was good for shopping and seeing the sites (if you are prepared to walk). Food was good at breakfast and the service was super, really set you up for the day while enjoying the spectacular view of St. Peters. We ate at the 7th floor resturant on the last night which was amazing, the best meal I've ever had and the most romantic setting you could imagine. The staff were very polite and helpful particularly Luca who remembered our names from the moment we arrived and was very helpful in giving us advice on what to see and where to eat etc. We also had a nice picnic in the Borgese Park which is just over the road! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful week at the Hotel Splendide Royal”
Reviews.Author: wighttraveller
Reviews.Content: The rooms and private terrace balcony were beautiful, clean and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The views from the breakfast restaurant were wonderful, and the breakfasts provided were delicious. The location of the hotel meant that we were just a short walk away from all the main tourist attractions apart from the Vatican. The hotel is expensive, but is worth it if you really want to treat yourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week in the Hotel Splendide Royal”
Reviews.Author: TheRoverMan
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel to spend time in. The accommodation is first class, the staff very attentive and the service excellent. Overall, a first class hotel. The food and service in the Hotel's Michelin Star Restaurant is, again, first class but not for the feint hearted when it comes to cost! A three course meal for two with wine, coffee and liqueurs set us back €400 (£285), but my word, was it worth it! Console oneself with the fact that there are much less expensive eating places in the near vicinity of the hotel, including the much vaunted via venito. A highly recommended holiday hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid indeed”
Reviews.Author: KirstiAthens
Reviews.Content: Wanting to spoil ourselves a little on our trip ti Rome recently , we booked the Splendide much based on the reviews on this site, and were not disappointed! We found the reception and concierge staff very welcoming and very helpful in all respects, from the moment we booked in till the moment we left. Not least were we charmed by the young Lucas, who to all our requests responded with a confident "Yes, I think I can arrange that", and always did! As it was my first trip to Rome (my husband has been there before), and we had to do all the mandatory sightseeings, the receptionist firstly marked all major sights on our map, later when requested to, made all arrangements for the organized tours we went on, booked tickets for Villa Borghese, Colosseum and also an opera event we wanted to attend. They also took the effort to address us by name. We couldn't possibly ask for more! The view not only from the lovely restaurant on the 7th floor, but even from the breakfast room on the 6th, is absolutely fabulous! And here is my only slightly negative experience: The staff in the breakfast room didn't seem to take a liking to me for reasons I can't imagine, and I was more or less treated like air all three mornings, which made me serve my own coffee in the end, not being able to attract their attention... Not all guests had the same fate as me, but I wasn't the only one. We also used the limo service to and from the airport, and though we had a special treat by the driver taking us to the airport when leaving, he then dropped us off at the wrong terminal. It should be possible to teach the drivers where travelers inside the Schengen area leave from (terminal A, not C).

Reviews.Title: “Splendide "Indide"”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirebloke
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short stay at the Splendide Royal. Upon arrival the front desk was very helpful, realising we were only staying a few days, the young chap checking us in (who's name escapes me), made us aware of all the main landmarks to visit and best times visit them, he also had a good sense of humor, and after a stressful flight check-in, managed to set our break off on a good note. The lobby area looked fantastic, very elaborately furnished ancient Rome style, all marble. Elevators were a bit of a tight squeeze, six people absolute maximum. The hotel was spotlessly clean, but considering the price, i would have expected nothing less. Rooms were large by European standards, the extra large bed, was actually two queen beds pushed together. We found the mattresses to be very firm, a lot harder than we are used to, that coupled with the hollow fibre pillows, and the sunken glowing ceiling light, that i didn't know how to turn off, didn't allow us a good nights sleep. I found out with one night left, that there was an alternative feather pillow available, so it was my own fault for not asking. Turndown service, un-necessary if you ask me, there are better ways to show you care about your customers. For business clients, the room had high speed internet access, with wireless capabilities, and also web access through T.V. or via P.C. in the lobby. One of the soap dishes had a huge chip out of it, and the slope of the bath allowed water from the shower to run round the outside and all over the floor, this must have happen numerous times before, because there were faint white calcium stain's on the floor, not what you would expect from a 4/5 star hotel. The location was spot on, right on the south perimiter of Villa Borghese, two minutes from Via Veneto restaurants and only five minutes from the Spanish Steps. Fantasic views from the restaurant, over looking Villa Borghese and right across to the Vatican, wouldn't recommend eating there if the cost of drinks is anything to go by, 2 Sprite and 2 Heineken 36Euros. Breakfast was very nice, a good selection to suit most tastes, cereals, fruits, hot and cold meats, cheeses, pastries, scrambled eggs. We were asked to stay here for a friends birthday getaway, but when i go back to Rome, i will be booking into a different hotel. Although we had a great stay, considering the expensive price, i feel i could get the same quality for less.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: RASMAN
Reviews.Content: Great property with fantastic customer service. All staff were very attentive to any requests. The Front Desk Manager actually knew our name. Very good value for $'s charged. Excellent cleanliness and I will return when I make it back to Italy from Canada!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: quitwhenurahead
Reviews.Content: booked hotel based on reviews here. i am very happy to say that the hotel lived up to expectations. staff helpful at all times, good buffet breakfast, rooms very clean and comfortable, although views not great, and a little on the small side. however all in all a fine hotel in a great location. walking distance to all main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, Rude Front Desk Manager”
Reviews.Author: tsc16
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a wonderful location. Nice, large room, comfortable bed, fantastic breakfast. We had a bad experience at is what usually appears to be a great hotel. We received a very good rate through American Express Travel. Upon arrival at the hotel and after a 15 hour flight, the front desk manager decided that we needed to pay 100 euros more per night for our room - no negotiation. We objected to the rate increase but were told that if we elected to leave and go elsewhere, they would still charge us for the first night of our stay. So, we reluctantly checked in with the intentions of staying one night and moving to another hotel. The next day, we tried to check out and the front desk manager told us that we couldn't check out without incurring the FULL rate for a second night. We argued with him and told him that this was ridiculous and finally got him to agree not to charge us for a second night, We checked into the Albergo Del Senato and were treated very well. Upon arriving home from vacation - our credit card was billed for the second night at the Spendide Royal. So, nice hotel, most of the staff was extrenely helpful, but if you have any issues, the front desk manager is not going to help you resolve them and in fact, may tell you that they are resolved and than bill you anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Impresive”
Reviews.Author: SarahandSuch
Reviews.Content: Splendide Royal was a pretty good hotel. We stayed in a junior suite, and the room was a generous size, but lacked furniture. It also had a disappointing view of the Borghese Gardens. But on the other hand, the hotel had an amazing breakfast buffet with beautiful views of the city. Also, the concierge service varied, and wasn't that impressive. The location of this hotel was good, and within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and the Via Veneto. Overall, the hotel only gets four stars because of the overpriced rooms and the concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: cathjace
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights (early July). The hotel itself is very nice. It's clean and the room (basic) was a good size for a European hotel. We never had a problem with room service, breakfast, concierge, maid service, house keeping, or wake up calls. The only thing that was annoying was the built in hairdryer. The top fell off and I kept burning my hand on the plastic hose/tube. I would bring one from home next time. The hotel itself is located on the edge of the Borghese Gardens, which happen to be really beautiful to stroll through...however, the hotel was a far, uphill walk every day after sightseeing...and then to do it all again after dinner was really difficult. We easily could have taken a taxi, but it was so nice out in the evening that we couldnt help but want to "stroll" through Rome....so we ended up walking up the Spanish Steps and then up the eastern side of Borghese gardens every evening. It was exhausting!!! If we were to return, I would want to stay somewhere in between the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain/Pantheon area. I liked this hotel but the location was not perfect for us...other wise, the hotel was lovely and the staff was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel with 6 star service”
Reviews.Author: AllieLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for part of our recent honeymoon, based on reviews read on this site, and were definitely not disappointed - my travel agent had made them aware of the occasion and we were given full VIP treatment (room upgraded to junior suites, chilled prosecco delivered to our room upon arrival). What made it particularly admirable is that we stayed for 3 nights at the beginning of our honeymoon and 1 night at the end - I thought they would probably only give us the special treatment for the first part of our stay but I was wrong, in fact the 6th floor room they gave us for our last night in Rome had a huge balcony with gorgeous views across the city, with french windows from both the bedroom and the bathroom leading to this - watching the sun set from there (with our chilled wine!) on the last night really set the seal on our whole stay. In addition to this the reception staff and door staff were without exception extremely helpful and friendly, with none of the stuffy attitude I've experienced in some stays at 5 star hotels. The location is wonderful and the rooms beautiful - I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: keswickian
Reviews.Content: Arriving late evening the receptionist was extremly helpful for sorting out our next days entertainment. The room was compact, very quiet and had a good sized and well appointed bathroom. Breakfast was average with a lovely view over Rome. The only negative was having a pre-dinner drink in the bar. Although serving us straight away we sat there for quite a while with empty glasses being ignored by no less than three waiters. Rather overpriced for what you get and very much aimed at american tourists. The hotel is situated no more than 5 minutes from the spanish steps. That is central when you walk DOWN to the attractions and restaurants. Unfortunately after a night out one has to climb the steps and afterwards another uphill to the hotel. Get a taxi or choose a different hotel. We would not stay there again, which is no reflection on the hotel but rather it's situation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Splendide Royal”
Reviews.Author: ZoeCostaMesa
Reviews.Content: What a magical time we had at this charming hotel. From our arrival to departure, everything was impeccable. The friendly and courteous staff made us feel welcome at all times. Our rooms were beautiful, and we spent a glittering evening at Mirabelle. Our dinner was delicious and we enjoyed a glorious view of Rome. We enjoyed the bar there as well, spending late nights over cocktails. It just could not have been better. Molto bene. Tedi Godard

Reviews.Title: “A hotel worth the cost for that special trip.”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkMobo
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was expensive but excellent quality. We booked late and we were only able to book a superior room which is the standard room. We need not have worried as the room was furnished and equipped to the same level as the other rooms. The only difference is the size of the room (which was about the size of standard London hotel rooms)and the lack of view. By the time we got back into the room at the end of a tiring day we did not need the view and appreciated the quiet location at the back of the hotel. The standards of service were excellent. The bathroom was big and very comfortable with everything you could possibly need. We could not afford to eat in the hotel restaurant although we might return for a special occasion such as an anniversary because it is a very romantic setting. We did however go onto the terrace each evening after returning from dinner for a coffee or a nightcap. The cost has to be put aside (dont even think about it) because the memories will be priceless and stay with you forever. The candle lit terrace overlooking Rome on a warm evening is one of the memories I will treasure most from our visit. Breakfast was very good, nothing was too much trouble for the staff, and the views were a joy. I am pleased we chose this hotel because it felt very Italian and was top quality.It was better than staying in a corporate hotel which could be in any city in the world. The location is quiet and safe but if you want the buzz of nightlife you would be better choosing one at the bottom of the Spanish Steps instead of the top. I would also recommend the car to meet you if you arrive late at night ,but if you arrive during the day the shuttle service train from the airport is a good service and there are plenty of taxis outside the station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: RAP123
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend our 10 year wedding anniversary at the Splendide Hotel in Rome after reading many of the reviews on this site. I have to say that everything I had read about the Hotel was accurate, the service was superb, very helpful and a real feel for the personal touch (sadly lacking at most large 5 star hotels). We stayed in a junior suite that was both spacious and luxurious and as we had gone for the "Orange Blossoms" package we were met with red roses, chocolates and Champagne. The limo service that collected us from the hotel was as good as a guided tour around the city, including stopping off at some of the sights so we could take photos. There is a slight hill that you have to walk up from the spanish steps but if taken at a leisurely pace it shouldn't put anyone off staying here. The restraurant on the 7th floor was exceptional (although quite expensive - easily 350 euros for two people) The only slight dissapointment was the breakfast, a bit too limited a choice compared with other hotels we have stayed in but overall it wouldn't stop us coming back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever-Hotel Splendide Royal in Rome”
Reviews.Author: GRKChicago
Reviews.Content: The Splendide's staff was extremle gracious and helpful. RIght in the heart of Rome , this facilty is superb with great views from the rooftop complete with a 5 star restaurant. They attend to every detail and I would go back every year if I could.

Reviews.Title: “The Splendide was splendid!”
Reviews.Author: windmill144
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the great pleasure of staying at the Splendide Royal in Rome for 3 wonderful nights in April. We had a junior suite which was beautifully appointed, clean and comfortable. In addition to a wonderful room, the bonus for us was the staff. We were always welcomed warmly not only upon our arrival but each time we passed through the hotel lobby. The staff was also very helpful in answering questions and sharing their knowledge of Rome. The Splendide exceeded our expectations on all levels.

Reviews.Title: “Splendide was as it's title, Wonderfully spendid!”
Reviews.Author: lillylee
Reviews.Content: We arrived after spending a delightful week in Tuscany and surrounding cities2-3 hours from Rome. Our last few nights were spent at the Splendide. We were delighted to find it was on a quiet corner, intimate, and felt luxurious. Yet, it was walking distance to many places for eating shopping. Not that far from the Piazza de Spagna. The details, handwritten letter(s), a box of candy upon arrival, tickets to an exhibition-complimentary, were special touches seemingly lost in this modern day world, or maybe amercian traveling world. It was a perfect way to end our trip. And we also organzied a walk tour which Luca Bolzetta set up for us. He was enthusiastic and very helpful to our stay. We would go back again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Splendide- Royal, Rome”
Reviews.Author: ah1332
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights April 12-13, 2007. The hotel has a marvelous location and it has beautitully appointed room.The staff is very helpful. We had room 407 which faced the Borghese gardens. The only problem, which is a major one for most people, is the shower which is located in the bathtub. The bathtub is about one and a half feet wide, it is rounded and very slippery. There are no handles to hold on to and no bathmat. There are other rooms with a regular shower. Insist on a room with a separate shower.

Reviews.Title: “5 day break in Rome”
Reviews.Author: UK_member92
Reviews.Content: We (couple, early fifties) chose this hotel using Tripadvisor for our return visit to Rome - we wanted a comfortable, quiet hotel, fairly central with breakfast included in the rate. We chose an inward facing room to ensure quiet, although we later discovered all rooms were soundproofed. Sizes of rooms are provided on the hotel website. Ours was baroque red/gold, very comfortable and very quiet, although only one armchair! Linen sheets changed regularly. It took us a couple of nights to sort out an agreeable balance of warmth & air conditioning draughts. Location near Villa Borghese, at the top of a hill, 10 minutes walk from Spanish Steps metro. Restaurant in hotel was too expensive for us, but there are several reasonable, good restaurants within 5 minutes walk. Staff were extremely helpful and knowledgable. Buffet breakfast extensive and good, except for the instant coffee, with cooked food, cold cuts, cakes, bread, cereal, fruit, English Twinings tea and English preserves. Public rooms attractive, comfortable and spacious - little used. Internet access in all rooms, and also 2 public computers with fast access available for a small fee. Clientele mainly US and Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: LifeisGOOD58
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Splendide Royal. The location is perfect - quiet, but close to the Via Veneto and the Plaza Espagna. It is an elegant, small hotel. The best thing about the hotel is the service. The staff at the reception desk were incredibly helpful and friendly. The breakfast is served in a lovely terrace room with beautiful views. The room we had was spacious and the bathroom was totally renovated - we had both a tub and separate shower. We also had dinner at a terrific restaurant that I highly recommend - L'Angoletto. It is in a small, quiet piazza. Lovely outdoor dining - have the hotel make a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert017
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Splendide for our silver wedding anniversary, having last visited Rome 25 years earlier on honeymoon. From the moment we arrived we were made completely welcome and really looked after. The hotel is luxurious and classy without ever feeling stuffy. The guidance we were given on how to get around Rome by foot, and see the sites on arrival was excellent. Nothing seemed a trouble Watching the sunset over Rome from the terrace was unforgettable. The hotel wasn't cheap, but we didnt expect it to be. We had read complaints on breaksfast from one previous traveller, I have to say we were impressed, I can cope with only one choice of champagne at that time of day and the strawberries were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExDirectory
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (44 & 50) stayed here for 4 nights from the 31st March until the 4th April 2007. We could not fault the welcome and the service that we recieved. We stayed in a deluxe room with views over the Villa Borghese. The room (406) was quiet and away from the lifts. The room was spotlessly clean and the pure linen sheets were a real luxury. The room was spacious,beautifully and traditionally decorated and exactly what we had hoped for. The bathroom was spacious with twin sinks, bath and large power shower walk in cubicle. Plenty of toiletries, fluffy towels, bathrobes and slippers. Plenty of hanging space in the built in wardrobes and personal safe. Breakfast overlooking Rome was a treat. Ample fresh fruit, juices, pastries, cereal, cheeses, meats. Also on offer scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages. Excellent tea too! The Hotel is about 10 minutes from the top of the Spanish steps and we found everything was within walking distance for the fit and able! We would definetely reccommend this lovely Hotel and hope to return to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: souterCroydon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but my husband booked a surprise for my 40th birthday and paid a lot of money but the room was small and everything was mega expensive.The staff in the restaurants were very rude and put us out into the balcony when it was cold and late at night even though we were dressed smartly and the restaurant wasn't full.When we complained we were told it was because they thought we might want to smoke even though we have never smoked in our life.On the second night my husband went to the restaurant for a drink because this is the only bar in the hotel and was again being ushered outside until my husband stood his groung and demanded to go to the bar. The breakfast restaurant has wonderful views of the whole city but there is not much in the way of an english breakfast, just bacon and what they call scrambled egg but doesn't taste much like it.The hotel does have a very good location but I wouldn't rush back.A couple that came with us had been 2 years ago to a 3 star hotel and received a lot better service.The room was like a 3/4 star hotel but with little extras put in the room like slippers and dressing gowns which i think we can all live without!.

Reviews.Title: “Stress free luxury”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireYorkies
Reviews.Content: Delays in travelling from England to Rome meant we were shattered by the time we arrived at the hotel, but the staff took over, and before we knew it we were effortlessly esconsed in a compact but sumptuous room with absolutely everything we needed. Big bed - we are both 6ft plus and it is often a problem, but not here. A FREE safe, luxury fitted bathroom, all the furniture you could require. The bathrobes are luxurious and the slippers cute. However, 2 things to be aware of: 1) the TV sound is carried through to a speaker in the bathroom; better the old man knows BEFORE you turn it on while he is shaving, and 2) working out how to turn the numerous lights on and off was very amusing. As with a previous reviewer, we had a view out over the inner courtyard - but we were never in during the day so it did not matter one jot, and it also meant it was extremely quiet. Every day we were there, the room was serviced to a consistently high standard. Breakfast in the terrace restaurant - enclosed while we were there, but must be great in the summer when it is open. Wonderful views over the city, with the early morning sun bathing the dome of St Peter's in a gently sheen. Whoever could complain about the choice of food?
