It had something for everyone - fruits, yoghurts, cereals, hot and cold meats, eggs, cheeses, breads, juices, croissants, ......etc - and the quality was excellent. Suffice to say we did not feel the need to eat again until evening; even after walking round Rome all day. The location of the hotel is good. It is in a nice area which felt very safe, and just across the road from the Borghese gardens. It is well situated for the city centre, but just far enough away. The road to the hotel is on a not-too-taxing uphill slope from the city direction, and helpfully downhill when you go out in the morning which loosens the legs up nicely for another few miles! The hotel staff were all polite, helpful, and efficient. The public areas of the hotel were clean and uncluttered, and the presentation was of the highest standard and extremely impressive. A hotel that did what it says on the box! Definitely one to be recommended for a stress free and luxurious experience.

Reviews.Title: “I have not stayed there but...”
Reviews.Author: LéaParis
Reviews.Content: I have tried to book 2 rooms in this hotel, and received 3 different rates from their reservation desk, which were not the same as their internet rates, that makes it 4. Anyway, I accepted one of these rates and before sending my credit card n° I only asked to have confirmed the 2 rooms on the same floor because we didn't want our daughter to be too far, and the view they said was offered with the deluxe room. I never received the confirmation, but only repeated requests for my credit card number. I asked twice "please confirm my request" and only received the answer " your booking will be effective when you send your credit card n°"! They seem to be thinking that accepting our reservation is a great honor they are doing to us, and that they don't have to inform us about what we shall be buying or garantee anything more than the simplest booking. We travel a lot all over the world and we have never met this kind of behaviour from a 5 star hotel. Maybe too much success? We shall definitely .not stay there

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: heike28106
Reviews.Content: Really nice old-fashioned hotel! The room was large and well equipped and the bathroom large as well and modern! Very nice staff! Breakfast on the rooftop great! Although the choice at the buffet was usual Italian! Nothing special! But all in all recommended if you get a reasonable rate! Location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect birthday experience”
Reviews.Author: CBR11
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights at at The Splendide Royal. I was there for my 40th birthday as a little treat from my wife. Had a fantastic stay and the service standards were excellent. It is a bit of a walk up the hill after a days sightseeing but we tended to take a little diversion by via Veneto most days and call in for a wee glass of vino just to ease the journey. We had a room on the 5th floor and found it to be of a great standard and the bathroom had a double sink and great water pressure . Breakfast was on the 6th floor and the view over Rome was an excellent way to start the day, the buffet was good but go early as the hot options tended to suffer by 9am. We ate at The Mirabelle restaurant which was lovely and yes, I know you are paying for the view but with a couple of glasses of champagne each to start and one of the cheaper bottles of wine the bill was approaching 400 euro. Overall, we had a fantastic time and The Splendide certainly contributed to that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Horel Splendide Royal is Hotel Perfict”
Reviews.Author: traveller013
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left after three nights, the standard and service at the Splendide was perfect. The staff were extremely friendly and the room was excellent. The breakfast buffet amazing and with such wonderfullsviews. Did not eat in the 5 starrestaurant as we wanted to explore Rome in the evening but have a nightcap in the bar next to the restaurant to witness a fantastic view over Rome. Very expensive drinks but worth every penny!! Location of the hotel was quiet and perfect for walking to Spanish Steps (5 mins) and only a few minutes to the "Hop on Hop Off" tour bus stop. Loved the experience and want to go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: obsessivehotelcritic
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews on this site, and got an excellent rate for a Rome 5 star from Otel.com. Our experience proved thoroughly satisfactory. Our room was small, on the first floor and looked into an internal courtyard, but it was beautifully appointed with a comfortable bed and armchair, and a sufficiently large bathroom with bathtub. Everything was spotless, appeared fresh and recently redone, and very professionally looked after. We arrived at about 10am, well before official check in, and were given our room within 5 minutes. The decor is a bit overstated, particularly in the sitting rooms on the ground floor, and therefore if one is a devotee of minimalist design, this place is not for you. Otherwise, it is great, and for four principal reasons. First, great location. Just off Via Veneto, across from Villa Borghese, eight minutes walk to Spanish Steps, quiet street. Second, outstanding staff. Friendly, helpful, polite. Third, the best fresh fruit offerings at breakfast I have ever seen. Fourth, the unbelievable view, both from the breakfast terrace and from the restaurant and bar. I would return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Something Special in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kel⦤
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Spledide Royal for 3 nights 8th-11th February 2007 to celebrate my wfie's Birthday. The hotel was selected based on reviews in Tripadvisor and I cannot disagree with any of the excellent comments made there. We booked a deluxe room overlooking the Borghese Gardens, beautifully decorated with a large bathroom. Superb. Prior to our departure we contacted the hotel by e-mail and they organised transfers to/from airport for us which was very helpful. We also prebooked a table at The Mirabelle restaurant for my Wife's birthday, which turned out to be something very special. Overall, we highly recommend this hotel- helpful friendly staff, excellent location close to the Spanish Steps and we plan to return in the future. If you want a special place to stay in Rome, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMSNAR
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, great location and service. A buffet breakfast was included in the price we paid and was delicious. There were some great little extras such as robes and slippers. The bed being turned-down at night along with sweets being left in the room and a little card detailing the next day’s weather. Before we went we read a lot about how small rooms were in Rome but our room was perfectly adequate, a nice big bathroom a separate cupboard for hanging clothes, as well as a king-sized bed there was also a desk with seat and a comfy chair. All very nice exactly what you would expect from a 5-star hotel. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonParisRomeLover
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is quiet polite elegance. The lobby and adjacent sitting rooms are regal. The staff all treated me with the utmost respect and care. The room was beautifully European. I felt like a king, and not like I was being milked for money, as is sometimes the case in fancy hotels. The breakfast buffet (included in my room rate of 220 euro/day) was top quality, plentiful, fresh and delicious. I cannot understand people on this website who criticized the breakfast. It was superb. The restaurant and bar are top-rated and very very expensive, but you don't have to eat there. Plenty of places nearby to dine, whether just pizza or sandwich, or a fancy meal. Concierge arrangements were all perfect. The doormen are also an excellent source of practical info on how to get around town. It's an uphill walk from the Spanish Steps, about 10 minutes, but I didn't mind, considering the value I was getting. You can take a shortcut down to the Barberini Metro Stop and avoid the Spanish Steps-- ask the doorman about this-- it saved me a lot of walking. I would definitely stay there again. It was beautiful, safe, and just a total feeling of elegance and being treated like a valued guest.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a film star!”
Reviews.Author: tabbykins
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was simply wonderful! The entrance to the hotel is very nice but when you enter it is like a jewel box. The chandelier in the reception is fabulous & was used by Visconti in 'The Leopard'. The decor & furnishings are beautiful in typically high Italianate style with everything of the best quality. I saw no evidence of the 'fraying around the edges' mentioned by a previous review although there are some distressed paint effects on some of the modern fittings which is entirely in keeping with a building of this age & style. We were staying in a Junior Suite (with a huge terrace overlooking the Borghese Gardens) which is best described as sumptuous with lavish furnishings & drapes & I loved the silk wall panels. The ceiling was almost dome-like with fabulous mouldings. A wonderful marble bathroom, jacuzzi & a walk-in shower so large could almost be described as a wet-room in the UK (but not US). Very luxurious toiletries. Huge King bed which was actually 2 paired doubles. I though the pure linen sheets were heaven to sleep on, I would compare to the best Egyptian cotton. So the hotel itself is beautiful but the jewel in the crown are the staff & therefore the service. The concierge & reception staff are exceptional & provide such a very personal & warm service, always greeted by name. It was my birthday during my stay & a bottle of Italian 'champagne' in a silver ice bucket with a tray of nibbles was delivered to us on the evening when we were getting ready for dinner. So a glass of bubbly whilst luxuriating in the jacuzzi was lovely! On our last day we had an evening flight home & we were offered a complimantary late check out which was very helpful (of course this was out of season & the hotel fairly quiet but nevertheless a great kindness to us). We did dine once in the Mirabelle restaurant which is breathtaking with its spectacular views & impeccable service. The food was of course excellent. Yes it is high-end price wise but no more expensive than the equivelent in UK but you would not have that view. You could keep the cost down if you so chose by avoiding the champagne cocktails & maybe going for a house wine but a matter of personal taste (we didn't!) As for location & the aforementioned hill, from earlier reviews I was expecting to be scaling Everest daily but in fact no problem at all & the views from the hotel are worth it. We have visited Rome several times before but not stayed in this location & I was surprised by how convenient it was & very peaceful, even at night when, due to very mild weather we slept with the french doors to to the terrace open & had no noise disturbance whatsoever (I am a light sleeper). So don't worry about the hotel being on a road, although it may be busier in the summer. I must address a point made in an earlier review regarding breakfast. Our experience differed from this as the day of our Scavi tour we needed a very early start (the hotel did not know this) & tried our luck a little before the offical opening time when we found everything ready. I found what was on offer to be fine. I like a healthier breakfast & this offered the best range of fruits I have had in any hotel outside of the tropics. I enjoyed breakfasting on fresh strawberries whilst gazing at St Peters' & the Medici Palace (the view from the breakfast room is again, breathtaking). I could have washed this down with champagne if I had so wished (I didn't). For those who require a fry-up to start their day, my husband enjoyed the bacon, sausage & egg. There is also delicious mozzarella & salamis to remind you you are in Italy. This is a very special hotel if you enjoy beautiful surroundings & personal service. The staff are so charming, kind & very professional, I cannot praise them highly enough, they made our stay very special. Thank you to all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: ExpertTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: A real class act. Great location next to Borghese Gardens, off the Via Veneto. Service outstanding, beds comfortable. Huge dressing area and ample bath. Breakfast was a bit of a disappointment - rarely ready at opening time, with small assortment of hot & cold items. I would have expected a bit more. It took a long time to get a cup of coffee! (And I am a bear until I get it.) Room had no view to speak of, and was, itself, very small. However, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to rest tired feet”
Reviews.Author: courgettequeen
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a three night stay in the Splendide. A friendly hotel that is ideal for those that want quality and a quiet nights sleep at a good price. I would not say it was 5 star quality but it was spotlessly clean (if a little worn around the edges) and the staff were helpful and efficient. Our room looked onto a courtyard so we had very little natural light, but anybody who comes to Rome to hang around in their room is bonkers. A benefit of having a courtyard view is a decent nights sleep. Be aware that a lot of roads in Rome are cobbled so the traffic noise can be terrible. The hotel is in a great position for getting around and seeing the sights, but like many of the upmarket hotels on or near the Via Veneto, its at the top of the hill, so ladies, leave your heels at home. The top floor has a rather swish restaurant and a good bar. The breakfast room too has good views across the city. Previously we have stayed in the Marriott Grand Flora which is much grander but three times the price and also the Majestic, again more expensive but not as good as the Splendide. I would recommend this hotel as good value for money and a warm welcome to all.

Reviews.Title: “a first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: meling
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 27th - 29th December 06. This is a first rate Hotel. The position is well within walking distance of all the major sites and is within easy reach of some top class restaurants. The rooms are furnished to a very high standard. Bathrobes and slippers and a high standard of toiletries are available in the superb bathrooms. Breakfast is what you would expect for a Hotel of this standard, with a good choice of hot and cold. The view from the breakfast terrace is stunning. Our only criticism and our reason for not giving this hotel a 5 rating is the lack of a bar. The existing bar is linked to the very formal restaurant and if you are casually dressed you feel a little uncomfortable. Otherwise top marks.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Maureen11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early December 2006, as a last minute break. We had a room on the back without a view, but we had come to see Rome not stay in our room, and the room was still spacious and luxurious by any standard with a lovely bathroom, and sound-proofed, so although you are in the middle of Rome [which is really really busy], you can still get a good night's sleep after a tiring day. The hotel is in a perfect location, near the beautiful Borghese gardens. We took taxis to wherever we wanted to go, Vatican etc etc, then walked back quite easily, stopping at whatever else caught our eye - there's so much to see we'll definitely be back and would stay here again. The standard of this hotel is very high, and the staff are also extremely helpful. You get the impression that they like to help and aren't just doing it for the tips, like some hotels. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dylanmax
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Splendide Royal. We cannot praise it highly enough. The hotel is pleasantly sited near the Villa Borghese and Via Veneto. The staff are friendly and helpful and forgive our apalling Italian. The rooms are large, well decorated and very comfortable. The breakfast is well above average and is served in a friendly and unobtrusive manner. The rooftop restaurant is wonderful either for a coffee or a dinner. The public spaces are small but very comfortable. The prices are fair and room service is excellent. We've tried others, but this is the best we've found by a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: smf44
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early November for four nights and found it to be a really good hotel. It is in a good location, close to the subway and shopping and was a good place to set out on daily adventures. However it is a few blocks uphill walk which is tiring after a full day walking and touring, but then you have a great hotel to come back too. What really impressed me was after the first night we were told the maid found some problem with the air conditioning (I didn't notice any problem) and they would have to switch us which was fine and it was to an upgraded room. Both rooms were very clean and quiet. The rooms are excellent, large and very comfortable. The breakfast is just ok. I found that our two week stay, which included five hotels throughout Greece and Rome that none of the breakfasts were really great, same general fare at all. This was one of the better ones. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Good hotel, nice rooms, good area. Very glad to have made this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay At The Splendid Royal In Rome”
Reviews.Author: PuppyToes
Reviews.Content: One of the very best things about Rome was staying in this hotel. The staff, at every level, was warm and helpful. The front desk/concierge assistance was a tremendous help. The doormen knew exactly how to help two ladies make their way with taxis, etc. The room (Jr suite) was lovely and very comfortable. The continental breakfast was the highlight to the beginning of the day. If you have the chance to stay at the Splendide Royal, don't miss it...you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Silver69
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have recently returned from 3 nights at the Splendide Royal and it is a beautiful place. On arrival, the receptionist was extremely helpful - gave us a map of the city and pointed out places of interest. The hotel isn't especially eye catching from outside but there is always a doorman on duty. It's location is very good - 5/10 mins from Spanish Steps and 5/10 mins from Piazza Barberini and Via Veneto. We had booked a "superior" room which is the hotel's standard room. The room itself was very nice - well decorated but not particularly large and it didn't have a very nice view over the rear of the hotel. There was a large wardrobe but not much drawer space. It had a flat screen TV and mini bar (very expensive!) and a very nice bathroom with double sink, bath with shower over and bidet. To be honest, I've stayed in a less expensive hotel in Rome previously where the rooms were larger and as nicely decorated however I found it was the little touches that made this a nicer hotel to stay in. The bed sheets were linen, there were robes and slippers, the turndown service was good - all towels replaced and sweets left together with the following days weather forecast and the complimentary toiletries were decent quality! We did have a problem with the heating in our room and it did get sorted but only after asking a second time which was unfortunate. The reception area was very opulent although away from the main reception room there were no windows but lots of comfortable chairs and tables and two internet stations. The American bar was nice but quite small. Lots of the tables were outside and although it was November when we stayed it was nice to sit outside because there were heaters on and there is a fabulous view across the city to St Peters. Price wise it was a little expensive - the beers were 10euros, the cocktails between 14 and 20 euros and the cheapest bottle of wine I found was 40euros. When you ordered drinks however you did get savoury nibbles with them pre dinner and sweet nibbles after dinner. We didn't eat in the restaurant but it looked very nice and didn't seem as expensive as we had anticipated - starters beween 15 and 25 euros and main courses around 40 euros. I wish we had had time to have a meal there as I think it would have been a nice treat. We did eat in the restaurant next door to the hotel on our first evening when we arrived late and it was very good - good service, good food, decent wine and a very reasonable price plus, when we went back for lunch on our last day they treated us like old friends! The breakfast in the hotel was decent - good choice of fruit, cereal, meat and cheese as well as bacon, scrambled eggs and sausage. There was an 8euro supplement to have breakfast in the room and this was just for basic continental - didn't even include juice - anything over and above the basic cost extra. The breakfast is served from 7am to 10.30am so it's great if you like a lie in! There is a gym in the hotel but we didn't manage to take a look. All in all I think the hotel was very nice and I think it was worth the money. I probably wouldn't stay here again but that's because there is so much to do in Rome we spent hardly any time in the room and it seemed like a bit of a waste.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Royal, worth the money?”
Reviews.Author: scorid
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently for one night in The Splendide Royal hotel in Rome. The hotel itself was beautiful and on a reasonably quiet street for Rome. However, having travelled there from Eden Roc in Positano, I was surprised to notice that the bar prices were almost double. While the view from the bar is beautiful overlooking Rome, €10 for a glass of beer was rather exorbitant, and the mini bar prices were outrageous. We dined that evening in the Restaurant and while I expected it to be very expensive, I was somewhat disappointed with the meal we received. We had better meals in Italy at a third of the cost. The service however was excellent and the location beautiful, but somehow I felt it wasn't worth the money. If I was to stay there again, I certainly wouldn't bother with the restaurant. And, I must say, the night we dined there, it was quiet and therefore it lacked atmosphere aswell. The front desk were very helpful and kindly stored our luggage on our day of departure, as we weren't leaving until that evening. Breakfast was just okay. Didn't leave any lasting impression, and I was disappointed not to get freshly squeezed orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, quiet, perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: flycatcher06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise. It was a very nice location, quiet room which we really needed. The front desk and bell men were very helpful. We would definitely stay here again and felt we got what we paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluedukie03
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night in November, but it was well worth it. The property is located about a 5-10 minute walk away from the Spanish Steps in a quiet neighborhood-y area. The lobby and reception area is absolutely gorgeous and had a very French feel. We booked a Deluxe room and loved it. The room is large and spacious, with a flat screen tv, sitting area, work desk and large king sized bed. There is also a changing area that leads to the spacious bathroom, which has a great shower (strong water pressure!) and two his & her sinks. I loved the detailing in the room. We had a high recessed ceiling and detailing along the walls and doors. I would absolutely stay here again--it was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Stay”
Reviews.Author: flyer-fish
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant and helpful staff. Beautifully appointed rooms. Great food and view from the terrace restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A treat”
Reviews.Author: Pieta
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after a lot of thought and looking around and it was recommended to us by a friend who works in Rome (booking hotels) after listening to me saying what I was looking for - that is a luxury hotel, but cosy at the same time and not snobby (as I hate feeling I always have to be on my best behaviour or be made to feel out of place as we don't earn high enough salaries). We arrived and apart from my husbands shock at seeing the top hatted porters outside, where he nearly turned on his heels and ran in the opposite direction, we got checked in really quickly and smoothly. A porter showed us to our room and actually didn't wait for a tip at all. The room was beautiful, exactly how they look on the hotesl web site and my husband started to relax!! Simply put, it felt luxurious and was exactly what we had hoped for. The only slight let down, which did not actually matter, was that the room we got was one of the rooms facing the inner 'courtyard' (the emergency staircases). We arrived mid morning and literally dumped our bags to go sight seeing and shopping(excellent location close to the spanish Steps and via Veneto) and didn't arrive back till around 5pm when it was dusk. We snoozed for a few hours and then went out to dinner, in the rain, which made it all seem so romantic. so in the end, the rooms view was not a factor at all. The sheets and cover on the bed felt beautifully luxurious and not paper like or hard as described in some peoples reviews. We slept like babies. Breakfast was beautiful with the view over Rome and there was lots of choice from hot stuff to the truly Italian breakfast, which my husband appreciated given he is Italian. The hotel staff were all really friendly and made us feel at ease. We only stayed the one night as we live only a few hours drive from Rome, and as mentioned before, it was a treat to ourselves for a particularly busy time at work and time away for us as a couple - children were left at home for this one. We left the hotel relaxed and happy and ran out into the rain to catch our metro back to the station to head home. We have special memories of our very short break at the Splendide Royal and would recommend this hotel as a treat for normal folks wanting to get away and relax. it's really worth the expense and we will certainly be planning to go back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Schlaupe
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful one weeks' stay here during the first week of September. The room was superb and quiet. The staff was excellent and most helpful. They arranged for a car to pick us up at the airport and a private guide to the Vatican. They even prepared a breakfast bag for us on a day we had to leave on a tour before the breakfast room opened. The hotel had a good location across from the Borghese Gardens and we walked to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. We've booked again for next May!

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: SamLen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Splendide Royal in Rome was a great choice. The room was terrific. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. It is very well located - just a couple of blocks off Via Veneto. And the restaurant and lounge were excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good location, staff wasn't great”
Reviews.Author: Court_SF
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly nice hotel, but it just doesn't live up to 5 stars, mostly because of the bed and the staff. We booked a suite, the room was very big and nicely appointed. It had a jaccuzzi tub, which was awesome after tramping around Rome all day. We were right on the street, but the windows did a great job of keeping the noise out. The bed was crap, unfortunately. It was very hard, and the sheets were linen, which we were informed by the little ad by the bed were supposed to be cool and luxurious, but were actually scratchy and uncomfortable. Room service is good and prompt, but only open during certain hours. Breakfast was pretty good, and they have American coffee, which was nice. The restaurant at the top had beautiful views and good food. I heard raves about this place from everyone, but honestly it wasn't the best meal I've ever had. It was creative and solidly prepared, but it just didn't rank with other $500 meals that I've had (I'm from San Francisco, maybe I'm just a snob). I would still recommend it in Rome, however. The staff were also slightly problematic. My biggest gripe is that when we asked for a restaurant recommendation, they sent us to some terrible tourist place nearby. I expect better out of concierge at a nice hotel. We also had a dispute with a cab driver that the doorman would not help resolve, and in general, the staff just didn't seem up to the task. They DID do a good job hiring a tour guide for the Vatican--she was great. Ladies: you might want to bring your own hairdryer--this hotel has the kind that are attached to the wall and are kind of annoying to use. Also, bring conditioner, they didn't have that. The other products they had were very nice, including bath salts (nice in the jaccuzzi). I have two other restaurant recommendations in Rome--we ate at this little place called Taverna di Campo, off Campo di Fiore, that was great--pizza and pasta both were excellent. Taverna Flavia, nearby, was pretty good as well. The atmosphere is fun in there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but dont book a suite.”
Reviews.Author: Yorky2003
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location just 5-10 mins from the Spanish steps. It is a fairly steep hill so may be a problem for elderly people. We booked a suite to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. Whilst the bedroom bathroom and small sitting room were lovely, spotlessly clean and well furnished the views of the kitchen were not what we expected when paying more than 800 euros per night. I think there are much cheaper rooms with a much better view. I would support a previous comment about the bed linen. Very thick and scratchy not at all the usual fine linen you get in Italy. The room service was good and the concierge was helpful. Breakfast offered the usual cold buffet plus scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage. A good start to the day. We had booked the Mirabelle restaurant by email. We had an initial problem in that we were asked for a credit card number to make the reservation despite being guests . This was resolved although when we arrived they couldnt find our booking even though we had checked two days earlier which table they had given us and changed the time slightly a few hours earlier. The wine waiter pursuaded us to try a different wine to the one we asked for. (36 euros more than the one we asked for) When we didnt like it - as it was too oaky and we had asked for fruity he went off in a real strop and eventually brought us a bottle of cheaper fruitier sauvignon blanc. The first two courses were good but the desert - a creme brulee with melted not caremelised) sugar sitting on top was inedible. My husband was offered another pudding which he didnt want by then but they declined to remove the 22 euro charge. They also managed to drop a dirty knife on his jacket which thankfully they were able to clean. The views from the Terrace are incredible but stick to after dinner drinks (15 euros for a gin and tonic)- the food was generally good but the wine is a ridiculous price the cheapest we saw was 70 euros. This is a very good hotel - but I have only rated as above average because for 820 euros per night it should be amazing.

Reviews.Title: “splendid stay at the splendide”
Reviews.Author: marfal
Reviews.Content: we just got back from rome and a five night stay at the splendide royal on our way to tuscany. the hotel was perfect great location for buses metro or walking to spanish. the staff were very attentive. gave us great directions for getting around and restaurant tips. the restaurant at the hotel was outragous. the rooms spacious clean and quiet. the limonea roof terrace wher we ate breakfast had beautiful views and a variety of food. all in all this was a beautiful hotel, and we would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DanielDe
Reviews.Content: We are just arriving from Rome. We stayed at The Hotel Splendide Royal for four nights. The hotel was fantastic. Very well situated. The restaurant at the terrace offer the best view of Rome. The room we had was perfectly clean, spacious, very well decorated. The quality of the service we had was simply great. If you look for a 5 stars hotel in Rome, this is a great place to choose. Daniel Denis

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Splendid”
Reviews.Author: mppr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendide Royale for three nights in July 2006 and enjoyed every aspect of our stay at the hotel. The location is an easy five-minute walk to the top of the Spanish Steps, or into the heart of the Borghese Park, which the hotel overlooks, and the gallery inside the park is not to be missed if you enjoy art and sculpture. Our room was spacious and comfortable with extra touches like soft bathrobes and slippers and a powerful shower that helped ease our jet leg away. The breakfast was bountiful with both healthy and decadent options and the staff was consistently helpful, gracious and professional. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Find!”
Reviews.Author: JBG&JGG
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not have been more perfect for our trip to Rome. The hotel is very lovely with rooms that appeared recently renovated and which included all the modern amenities you could need. The location was great -- very close to the Spanish steps -- yet the price is very reasonable. Breakfast, which is included, exceeded all expectations. It was a very large buffet on the top floor with great views. I highly recommend this place and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: amaranga
Reviews.Content: Rome was our first stop in Italy. We arrived at the hotel late and our kids were hungry. It was already 10:30 p.m., so the restaurant at the hotel was not serving. They immediately went next door and said they would happily serve us dinner. The meal, by the way, was very good. After, we went to our room. Our kids rooms were each on different floors from us, but they are old enough. The room was smaller than I had thought but it was very nicely done. Very old world. The bathroom was obviously recently redone. Beautiful honed marble double sink vanity and marble floors. The bed, however, was a different story. It was an extremely hard mattress and hard pillows. The bedding was linen, I guess, but it was thick and scratchy. The next night I asked for softer pillows and they did get them for me. I found out that you can also get a softer mattress, if requested. The breakfast room was wonderful. It was on a terrace with a beautiful view of Rome. Also, have drinks at the hotel's restaurant for a fabulous view at night. I heard the restaurant is extremely overpriced, but if you want a very romantic dinner, this might be the place. We pretty much walked everywhere, and the Via Veneto is right around the corner with a lot of the larger, expensive hotels. The concierge made some very good restaurant recommendations for us. All in all, we loved Rome, the sights, the food and the hotel. Would recommend to anyone that wants a smaller, more boutique feeling hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: westchestertraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 city tour of Italy. The Splendide Royal in Rome was by far the best. It's beautiful and the people who work there are friendly and helpful. If you like to walk, and you like quiet at the end of the day, this is the hotel for you. Easy walking to Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain, but far enough away that it's away from the maddening scene. We traveled with our 2 teenage daughters. We requested adjoining rooms and got them with no problem. Lovely bathrooms, showers and plush bathrobes. We couldn't have asked for more. We booked on expedia and saved a fair amount of money. This was by far the most expensive hotel we stayed in it Italy, but it was worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Splendide Royal”
Reviews.Author: Scioli
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hotel Splendide Royal in Rome, Italy and our stay was wonderful. We just loved the hotel and the staff was courteous, informative, and knowledgable. This hotel was recommended to us by our travel agent who said she always stays at the Hotel Splendide Royal and we will always stay at this hotel if we should visit Rome again. The view from the terrace overlooking the city of Rome was breathtaking and in the evening it was magical.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend break at the Hotel Splendide Royal”
Reviews.Author: Nigel_Miller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a wonderful weekend break at the Hotel Splendide Royal in Rome. I phoned the Hotel before flying from Bristol to arrange for a driver to pick us up and to book an evening meal at the hotel. I spoke to Ivan the Concierge whose English was excellent and who was more than happy to sort out the transport and dining arrangements. We were met at the airport by a friendly driver and driven in comfort to the hotel where we greeted warmly by Ivan and the other staff. The room was excellent and luxurious as you might expect and it was without doubt the best sound-proofed room I have ever slept in. We recommend a meal at the hotel as it has a good menu, a very good wine list and superb views of Rome from the balcony. As it was my wife's birthday we were treated to a bottle of wine in our room and a delicious dessert at the end of our meal.The hotel is well-situated near the Spanish Steps and we recommend it to anyone looking for a romantic weekend in Rome

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE HOTEL AND ROME”
Reviews.Author: LizStevie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights from Thursday and left Sunday on the 13th July this year for my husbands surprise 50th. The rooms are gorgeous with loads of space. Lovely white towelling robes and slippers provided. We travelled everywhere by the Metro to the Vatican (3 stops from Spagna) the collesium is not far either and spanish steps is only 5/10 min walk. We arrived back thr first night around 6 to find a large bottle of champagne in an ice bucket with all the nibbles etc. compliments of the hotel for my husband's birthday, that was so lovely of them. Mini bar is dear get a bottle of wine outside for 8 euors and stuff it in their mini bar great.... Whiskey is very expensive everywhere... Pastas not too good outside nor are the pizzas but cheap but a bottle of wine will cost between 18 and 25 euros (dearer than meal) but we found lovely steak place at the bottom of the road that forks to the right. Turn left out of hotel and take the right fork and walk to the bottom near the main road. Its called the T-Bone wagon or T-Bone something.. and its brilliant... Food in hotel is okay for breakfast but the floor wobbles in middle. Food in restaurant is not worth £150-00 for 2 people all presentation and you would not eat half of it but view is awesome (wished they served breakfast there) would be sooo much better. We both thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and all the history of Rome and such a romantic place to visit. Spanish steps good on Sat nite with guys stringing their guitars and singing all sorts of songs brilliant and hundreds sat on the steps listening. Dont be conned by blokes who put string around your finger and say "make a wish" they will make it into a bracelent and charge you 5 to 10 euors (for a piece of coloured string) !!! my husband fell for it but only gave him pennies he was not amused.... Watch for pick pockets and a few beggars on the streets. We had a tremendous time at the hotel... and loved Rome well worth a visit.... good luck...

Reviews.Title: “Not really splendid”
Reviews.Author: anna9999
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel but not 5* quality. Good location- 5 minutes walk to Spanish steps, spacious but not soundproof room, ok bed, nice view of Rome from the breakfast room. Overvalued for the price we paid- over $400/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: MilleMiglia
Reviews.Content: Rome…. it was the first stop of our 5-week honeymoon in Italia in early May 2006 and there was no better place to start it than the Splendide Royal. All my wife knew was that we were going to Italy and I took care of the rest. Suffice to say, she was blown away when we arrived. Splendide is a beautifully decorated hotel with great views of Villa Borghese. A couple of minutes from the Spanish Steps and Via Veneto. We were cordially welcomed by the staff (especially Fabiola and Mario). The deluxe room was on the fifth floor overlooking Villa Borghese – it had a terrific little balcony and a gorgeous bathroom lined with white and black marble. We were welcomed with a bottle of Prosecco on our arrival which was very thoughtful. Breakfast was your standard Continental breakfast but I thought the selection of food was great. There’s plenty of choice to get your day started right (eggs, fruit, toast, juices, yogurt, caffe latte, nutella!). The proximity of the hotel to the major sites is a big plus although it must be noted that you should have decent walking shoes and be in good shape to take full advantage of Rome. There just too much to see and traveling by foot is the way to go. However, you can easily find cabs or ride the orange transit buses to most locations. We just loved Rome – it’s almost surreal. The beautiful piazzas (Navona, Spagna, Campo del Fiore, San Pietro), the stunning architecture of Pantheon, Coliseum and St.Peter’s, the awesome Fontana di Trevi. And then there’s the rest of the city which is just teeming with living history. We even saw the Pope who has a papal audience on the first Wednesday of every month. It was great every night walking to our “home away from home”, the Splendide. We would always pass by the Spanish Steps and hang out for a gelato or roasted chestnuts before making the last 5-minute hike home. I originally found out about the Spendide Royal on Trip Advisor and I was certainly not disappointed. You are always going to find some people that were disappointed for one reason or another. You will always have expectations, especially when you are spending a lot per night. However, Rome is generally very expensive (as is Venice) so you must compare locally and not to what you get for that money in North America. Rome is one of the most beautiful and romantic cities in the world and we truly enjoyed our stay – cinque stelle (5 stars) for the Splendide Royal!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Splendid”
Reviews.Author: EC4
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was just what we had hoped for and looked forward to. It is not too large - only 60 odd bedrooms. It was very quiet and peaceful. Our standard room was well appointed and large by European standards. Everything was clean. Only small problem was an ill fitting bathplug. Excellent buffet breakfast was included in price and served in an enclosed roof terrace with views across the Borghese ardens and Rome. On the top floor is the restaurant - which we did not use - and an outside terrace bar with wonderful views far and wide where we relaxed after sight seeing. The staff were very good and the concierge service most helpful. It all made for a relaxing stay in a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Arim56
Reviews.Content: Well, I need to thank everyone for your previous reviews on this gorgeous hotel. You have all made my experience with my family in Rome one to Remember!! The hotel is emmaculate, service is incredible and the area extremely convenient to the Spanish Steps(10 minutes), Via Veneto (two blocks), Via Condetti and all of the other wonderful experiences that Rome has to offer. I could not have planned it better. To the staff at the Splendide Royal , Grazie! Grazie!. Hope to go see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Small, quiet, convenient, elegant, responsive staff. Expensive for us, but not in relation to other places in the immediate Spanish Steps/Borghese area. Upstairs breakfast room is pleasant and airy, with views, and the full buffet breakfast was included in the rate. We visited the beautiful Mirabelle rooftop restaurant, recommended to us by locals as maybe the best dining room in Rome, and regretted not being able to confirm a last-minute dinner reservation there, after seeing the menu and the wonderful views. It will definitely be a "must' the next time we're in Rome. We'll return to the Splendide Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Splendide Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: WISHHERE
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations! Wonderful location and views! Be sure to request a room on an upper level facing the park. We stayed in room 505. The room was very spacious with an entry hall, walk-in closet, large bathroom with double sinks and spa like tub shower. The separate bedroom was well decorated and roomy. I loved that the windows opened fully to enjoy the fresh breeze and yet were sound proof when closed. The location near Via Veneto and the park was great. Many fine restaurants nearby. The area was classy. We rented bikes in the park and enjoyed many a stroll when we tired of the busier areas of town. The staff were friendly and very accomodating. No trouble with language barriers. The breakfast buffet was to die for! Everything from cheese and meats to pastries. Great fresh fruit! Even champagne! Which reminds me, we were given complimentary champagne on arrival as it was our anniversary. We would surely stay here again and again...

Reviews.Title: “3* hotel trading on a fantastic veiw”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After just returning from the Splendide Royale , it is interesting t o read other reviews.We also stayed in room 105 which i agree was very noisy from the toilets and drains flushing above ,this started at 6.30 most mornings. On the second evening we went to have a night cap in the hotel bar and was ushered out onto the very chilly balcony, as there was a private party in the bar/restaurant, we went back inside to be told that we had to leave . We immediatly complained to reception and cancelled our dinner reservation for the next evening ,she said she would tell the manager ,but we never heard from him.Our room was supposed to be a luxury room (one up from a superior, we had no bottled water, no flowers and no veiw. Last but not least the breakfast room was trashy, old tatty artifical flowers on tables, a floor that shook when anyone walked past ,my coffee spilt in the cup, . Apart from that the rest of the stay was enjoyable , we found Harrys bar just around the corner, which had a fantastic singer.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid indeed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Splendide. We had a spectacular view and the service was first-class. We stayed in a lovely room overlooking St.Peters and the Spanish Steps. It is truly a luxurious hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Splendide”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Winnetka, Illinois We visited the Splendide Royale from April 27-29, 2006. The location of the hotel is fantastic--just a 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. The front desk/concerierge service was extremely helpful--he acquired tickets to the Borghese Gallery (don't miss) which were virtually sold out for the weekend. Inside the hotel one feels as if they are in a exclusive villa with beautiful furniture and furnishings. The guest rooms were equally elegant. The view from the restaurant/bar is one of the best in Rome, and the complimetary breakfast is served one floor down, sharing the magificent view of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon 16 years later”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the most fantastic four night stay at the Speldide Royal Hotel in Rome Italy, It's our second marriage of over 16 years now, we had never taken a honeymoon when we tied the knot for one reason or another, so this break was something really special, we love all four of our kids, but now all are old enough to be left to their own thing, and this was our time. The whole experience was just total 5 star and we will be recommending the Hotel and all the staff to our freinds and family, we could not fault a thing, even down to the doormen total quality in every way, the whole experience was faultless, the rooms are as described and a little better, apart from it being our 16th wedding anniversary it was also my 49th birthday the management delivered a bottle of champagne to the room as a surprise just wonderful. Thank you from both of us. and we will be returning again really soon we will not be waiting another 16 years.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days at the splendide royal on business, it was great all round. Good service, rooms, food and a great location close to a big park and within walking distance of all the sites! I would not hesitate in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The simply splendid Splendide”
Reviews.Author: Juliacarling
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Rome before we wanted our trip to be special and it certainly was. Our room was beautiful and it was a lovely surprise to be given a separate sitting room as well as the ample bedroom and wonderful bathroom. The sheets were linen and spoilt us for ever for ordinary cotton and these were changed daily. The view from the breakfast room , terrace and dining room were fantastic and even better than the view from the famous Eden hotel nearby. The best thing about the Splendide however was the staff who were unfailingly helpful and as another reviewer has commented "treated us like friends and not just guests." My husband is extremely fussy and he could not praise this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “much more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is a small hotel with large rooms and a+ service. it has a wonderful bathroom which is so much appreciated in europe. the restaurant was cosy & warm . the view is outstanding and this describes only the ambiance. we only had one dinner there but the food was outstanding.. the price was what you would expect from a first class restaurant.. an american breakfast is included & was quite extensive . the pastry was perfect. the hotel arranged for an excellent guide to the vatican . when we arrived by taxi from the rail station the taxi tried to overcharge us but the doorman intervened and saved us 25% of the fare. The Hotel Splendide was a truly fine experience. this is where we would stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Splendide Royal....Rome at it's very best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Splendide Royal is faultless in every respect. The service, attention to detail, standard of accomodation, decor, location and above all the food are all nothing short of excellent. The rooftop restaurant provides breathtaking views accross Rome and dining at The Splendide Royal.... particularly on the outside balcony is an experience you will never forget, equally, the quality of the food and service is superb and refreshing. So much so, out of all the hotels and restaurants we have ever visited around the world, my wife recently chose the Splendide Royal as the hotel which she knew would please me most for a surprise 60th birthday celebration and during this recent visit as on previous occasions we were not disapointed. (The complimentary Champagne placed in our room was particularly nice) Breakfast too is well worth a mention, served on a covered rooftop terrace, the ambience, the choice and quality of the food are again excellent. The Concierge is always on hand and taxis appear almost from no where! but even so, the location is such that most of Rome is nothing more than a comfortable walk. The hotel is not inexspensive but given the high level of quality and service afforded to guests, The Splendide Royal is extremely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Luxury for your Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Single woman traveling alone, 1st time to Europe. This was my 1st hotel on itinerary after flying from Hawaii. Booked jr. suite at $450 euro/night, but it was way beyond expectations. High ceilings w/ indirect lighting in cathedral style soffet, luxurious draperies and wallpaper, soundproof, curved entry door, 3 phones, sofa, tasteful furniture. The staff was superb from bell boy to waiter, no glitches, superb service and establishment. A/C and heating worked, as I later realized all other hotels I stayed in had no A/C or heater...I had to open the windows if it got too hot and stuffy. While it is near the Spanish Steps, the hotel is at the top of a mild hill from the Spanish Steps and the rest of the sites. But if you do not drive, you will do a lot of walking on hills anywhere in Rome. It is hilly. Has one of best views from top floor restaurant, but I only had breakfast there. Hotel was way better than Westin Excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “Would thoroughly brecommenmd Splendide Royal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay at Splendide Royal in Rome. Its very conveniently situated a few minutes walk to the top of the Spanish steps and the lovely shops on Via Condotti. It was a lovely quiet oasis in the city. Breakfasts were good,served buffet style in the Limonaia which has beautiful views acrooss Rome. We didnt eat in the famous Mirabelle restaurant on the top floor but it has a wonderful terrace-It looked lovely if rather pricey. Our room was a mini suite with a lovely bathroom. I loved the gorgeous linen bed linens which were changed daily.Such a luxury. We will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “My first visit to Europe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrive at the Hotel Splendide Royal on February 22,2006 and stayed for 5 nights and 4 days. I told the concierge when we arrive that we had a short amount of time and wanted to see as much as we could. Eric (the concierge) was courteous,friendly and knowledgeable and understood exactly what I wanted. He recommended a tour on Thursday, on our own on Friday and a tour on Saturday,That was the best plan possible! We did a Vacatan tour on Thursday. Friday we walked and walked and walked>>it was great we saw so many things. Saturday we did another tour and Sunday we went back to the Vacatan on our own to mass and see the Pope. Eric also helped us with restaurants and transportation as needed. The room was emaculent and kept that way throughout the day. We plan on staying there when we return to Rome next spring. Lloyd and Victoria Tirey

Reviews.Title: “A Splendid Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dtheresa
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. It is luxurious, comfortable and impeccably clean. You are only a 5 minute walk from the Spanish Steps yet when you are in the hotel you feel as though you are in an oasis of calm; a terrific plus when you have been walking and touring all day. We found the hotel staff - from concierges to servers to be extremely professional, helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet is glorious - not just because the food is fresh and delicious, but the rooftop restaurant lets you see the glory of the Roman cityscape at the beginning of your day. We look forward to returning to this very splendid and special place.

Reviews.Title: “Honorable Concierge Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had written an unflattering but true review about the concierge service, feeling deceived about our ride to the airport after we had prepaid with another service. The hotel concierge read my complaint and emailed me to arrange reimbursement the extra cost for the taxi "scheme". We were also assured that steps had been taken to correct this situation with the staff (and maybe even a change in personnel). Today we received the reimbursement for the taxi. Therefore, the hotel has proven to us that they are sincere in wanting to please their clients. We are very appreciative of all their efforts to correct this situation. In view of this, we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Top Floor View!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Splendide Royal over Thanksgiving. The hotel is quite ornate on the inside and decorated beautifully with a multitude of paintings. It is extremely close to the Spanish Steps and shopping galore. Other sites such as the Vatican and the Colosseum are quite a distance away. Very easy to walk to, if you are willing and able, though! The front desk was very helpful the first evening by providing us with directions, arranging a private tour guide for the Vatican (a must- to truly appreciate the art and history and to avoid the long line!), as well suggesting restuarants. The night before we left I did find those employees less helpful with arranging a ride to airport. I was deliberating between a taxi and the bus and got the distinct impression that they had an arrangement with a car company and highly dissuaded me from taking a bus/metro service. It was much more expensive than taking a airport bus service; but at least it was safe. The hotel rooms were very clean, with nice appointments, as well as quiet. By far, the most wonderful thing about this hotel is having either breakfast or dinner on the top floor. It over looks Rome as well as Rome's equivalent to Central Park. It is gorgeous & absolutely breathtaking. The breakfast was included daily so we only ate there in the mornings; but it was so lovely! I cannot attest to dining for dinner; but for the view, I would still think it is worth it if a beautiful evening and the sun is setting. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. It is not in the middle of all the action; but that is what we prefer. The only negative point was the employees my final night not being as helpful as I would have liked when deciding what transportation would be the best value. Other than that, I would highly recommend a stay at Splendide Royal!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many 5 star hotels in the United States and the UK. We found this hotel to be one of the best. We were there for a week and were treated extremely well the entire time. We enjoyed it so much that we gave of son a trip to Rome as a Christmas present and suggested he stay at this hotel. He is going in March.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed different nights at the Hotel Splendide Royal during the Christmas time and we had such a wonderful time. The room was very nice and elegantly decorated, a very nice gentlemen greeted us upon arrival in a very polite english and after a very informative check in, even if it was quite early he gave us the chance to go right up to the room. We suddenly realized that he would have been our point of reference during the all vacations,no surprise he was wearing the Golden Keys. We stayed in touch with him for all of our needings, from the resaturant suggestions to sightseeing tours that he organized for us at a very reasonable price for the service we received. The Guide he provided took us into the Vatican and Sistine Chapel and introduced us in some places where the people usually is not allowed to enter. The Concierge also provided the tickets to meet the pope on the Wednesdey audience that are very difficult to find, so he made me and my husband very happy. All the staff was very professional and nice including the doorman at the entrance door who every day welcomed us with "Buongiorno". The breakfast in the morning was excellent and the people of the restaurant also were absolutely great. We ahve reccomend this hotel to all of our friends and we gave them the name also of the Golden Keys Concierge that made our stay very unforgettable one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Splendide Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The restaurants and the food was wonderful. Truely 5 stars. Service couldn't be better. Comfortable beds - hotel in Rome had linen sheets. Rooms luxurious, spacious and the views in both cities could not be beat! Nice central locations. Both Everything you could want in a hotel. The nicest hotels I've stayed at yet!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: JeanneAbbe
Reviews.Content: We just got back from eight days at the Splendide with our two college age sons. We all loved it. Rooms were immaculate, very well appointed, and could not have been more inviting and comfortable. The housekeeping is wonderful - beds were made twice a day, toiletries generously replenished. The concierge staff was warm and made efforts to please. Location is great - near everything, and lots of good local restaurants, including the trattoria next door, which was important because weather was not ideal. However, there is not a lot of action outside the hotel door; you have to go to it. Breakfast was very good - coffee was served but otherwise, buffet. There were scrambled eggs, good selection of bacon, sausages, hams and salami, rolls, pastries, lots of fruit, cereal - in short, everything you would want.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Stunning decor, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid Royal in early December. We arrived early in the morning and our room was aleady ready. The rooms are large and elegant. The hotel is breathtaking and is located minutes from the Spanish steps (so the view over Rome is amazing). The hotel has a fantastic restaurant with one of the best views in the city. The hotel is central and in minutes you can walk to the main shopping streets and popular restaurants. The Colusium, Vatican and many other monuments are in walking distance as well. This hotel is a 5 star plus. (The staff speak English).

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre for a 5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 9 days this past December. We originally booked a junior suite with an adjacent room, only to be told at the front desk that this was not available. The junior suite that we were had an awful stench emitting from the vents and a consistently broken toilet (broke 5 times). We asked to change to another suite, and were told that the hotel would try to take of the smell in the room and fix the toilet. After 3 days, the smell was covered up with bleach and the toilet still broke every time one flushed it. After complaining more persistently and threatening to move to a new hotel, we were finally placed in another suite. The service is not up to par with many of the other 5* hotels located in Rome. The front desk attendants were eager to help, but not very informative. One even accidentally checked out one of my relatives. Although the hotel itself is stunning, and located pretty centrally in Rome, it was not worth all the trouble we went through.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I recently stayed at the Splendide Royal and thoroughly enjoyed it. We were upgraded to a junior suite, which was quite spacious. Our room overlooked a quiet side street. The staff was very friendly and attentive. We found it to be very conveniently located. The hotel is just a block and a half from the top end of the Via Veneto, where there is an entrance to the Metro and an entrance to the Borghese Park (a great spot to run, if you are looking for one). It was also a good value compared to other prices being quoted. My wife made me promise that we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For six glorious days, the staff of the Hotel Splendide Royal in Rome spoiled me. They offered good advice, organized tours, supplied every request all with good humour. The location is excellent and the physical facilties wonderful. The food is to beyond superbe. I give it the highest marks.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel? Not a chance”
Reviews.Author: US_Army_97E
Reviews.Content: If the hotel claimed to be a 3 star hotel then I would be inclined to give it a rating of 4 or 5 trip advisor stars. However, the hotel claims to be 5 stars which it isn't even close, so therefore deserves only two. We arrived at 9am and the staff was nice enough to allow us to check into our room several hours early, a nice suprise. The room is very small and uncomftorable. We had a beautiful view of an interior wall! (Five stars? Put some flowers out there or something - a horrific view). Our two main complaints were 1. the lack of facilities to relax after a long day (both in and outside of the room); and 2. the unbelievably stiff bed with starched paper for sheets (with a rip in the comforter which conveniently was the same comforter for three nights in a row). A previous post mentioned sweets on the bed was a nice touch, don't get too excited - you get two jelly candies in a little cardboard box. The mini-bar prices are ludicrous! Eight euro (10 USD) for a 12 ounce coke. Twelve euros (15 USD) for mini cocktail bottles. We went to a local market and bought our own water and wine and saved an incredible amount. The breakfast was average. Nice view, nice spread, but if you want a cup of coffee you can get up and get it yourself. The staff is not 5 star standard. I was very frustrated with their lack of attention towards something as simple as coffee in your cup. And if you want cream in your coffee good luck. Everyone raves about the hotel restaurant. We did not eat there. Take a look at the menu and you'll understand. There is absolutely NO reason to eat there. We ate at a different restaurant every night and had an excellent meal, value, and experience at all. You cannot convince me that the hotel restauant food merits a 200 euro total price tag compared to the other places we ate at. Save your money and explore Rome by night. And definately do not listen to the doorman's recommendation for a restaurant. He put us in a taxi and sent us to the most bland, boring restaurant down an alley. We ignored his advice and found Alfredos up the street and had a great experience. The doormen try most of the time, but are often two busy to spin the door for the ladies. They were shocked to hear that we wanted directions to walk to the colliseum. I asked directions and they told me it couldn't be done. What do you mean it can't be done? We enjoy walking, and actually seeing the cities we visit. They insisted we take a taxi. Eventually he pointed us in the right direction which was a 35 minute walk - a nice 35 minute walk. All in all we had a nice trip in Rome. However, ALL of our memories our from the city, not the hotel. The Hotel Splendid Royal is not a 5 star hotel. You can find the real 5 stars up the hill and to the right.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Splendide Royal is a magnificent hotel whose foyer and lounges set the high standards that continued throughout our stay. The greeting by the concierge was warm and the staff were always willing to help. It is ideally located next to the Borghese Gardens and all the major attractions are within walking distance, which was helped by the cool November weather. After a long day in the city it was a pleasure to return to the hotel to relax. Breakfast was served buffet style and was excellent, whilst with fantastic views over Rome the Mirabelle Restaurant is a must for dinner or lunch. It is located on the roof terrace and although relatively expensive, it is without doubt one of the finest restaurants we have both eaten at. The rooms were beautifully decorated in the same vain as rest of the hotels ambience. Cleanliness was second to none and the standard of housekeeping was exceptional, with sweets and the turn down of bedding adding those little touches. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in, it isn't a big modern hotel with all the clean lines, but a traditional, equisite hotel where customer satisfacton appeared paramount.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with character, moderately well located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Firstly, beware the taxi drivers at the airport! We were taken at 160km/hour by a [...] driver who was on the phone and doing his hair simultaneously, whilst no-handed repeatedly squeezing between the car in front and the motorway barrier. No kidding. For this hellish journey the meter read 46Euros. He then pressed a button and hey presto it leaped to 76 Euros. In my best Italian I protested and his English suddenly stretched only to "it was in kilometers". My travelling companion coughed up inspite of my protests, and still the driver continued the con. He switched a 50 Euro note for a 10 and tried to tell us that we'd only given him 40 Euros. At which point we got out. We later learnt that if you openly take their cab number and their name, and say the word police, they soon behave. We stayed for 3 nights in a standard room (290 Euros per night inc breakfast). Good points: Spotlessly clean Bags of character, in a gilted kinda way Huge marble bathroom and good sized bedroom, with walk in wardrobe Extremely friendly and helpful staff (rare in Rome) Great views from the restaurant and breakfast terrace Well positioned if you like shopping and walking uphill Small bar in the restaurant. In summer there's a fabulous terrace with views. We had a room at the back of the hotel so there was no road noise (a common complaint in Rome). However we were surrounded by the backs of other hotels which had continuous loud aircon units whirring away (only noticeable with the windows open). Not a problem if you sleep with earplugs. Fantastic limo service to the airport. When you book from the UK it's quoted as 90Euros. When you return it drops to 65Euros. We booked the latter and didn't regret it. Bad points: Everyone says "ooh it's near the Spanish Steps so it's well located". What they fail to tell you is that it's at the top of the Spanish Steps and then up a loooong hill. The area is devoted to tourists and is therefore soul-less, and the restaurants reflect this. A better bet would be to stay at the bottom of the steps at least, or preferrably a bit further south still. Even better would be to be in Trastevere where at least there is a bit of local flavour. No English TV All in all we didn't regret staying there, though I would choose somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Lacked Some Obvious Faciltities”
Reviews.Author: skcollobsgod
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the splendide royal following the reviews on trip advisor. We booked with expedia and paid £186 per night. We arrived for 3 night in early november. The hotel is well situated within the city centre. We were upgraded on arrival to a large deluxe room which became clear after the first night. The quality of the room is superb and the bathroom was great but if you are offered room 105 refuse it. It is on the first floor and when anyone on the five floors above uses the bath, shower or toilet you hear the full force of the water coming down the soil pipe. It kept us awake all night as it is reallly loud. We complained to reception and they moved us to another room for the last two nights. Although it was smaller it was still as nice. There was no bar at this hotel and although there was a concierge sign one was never to be found. It lacked the bustling atmosphere of a city hotel The reception staff were always friendly and helpful but there was only ever one on duty which often meant a long queue. As with all european hotels the tv is often rubbish and the only english speaking channel was CNN. You tend to get a bit sick of the repeated news after a while. They did have pay movies but only showing three films a week, one per day and then one of them was a childs film, so pretty boring when you get back to the room. The breakfast dining area was on the roof terrace on the sixth floor with stunning views over the city. Satisfactory with the typical continental breakfast. Good four star hotel which was clean & friendly but could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: naladoodle
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The staff was very nice and helpful. Our room was very nice eventhough we did not have a great view. We were only on the 2nd floor so we faced the street and trees (if only we were up a few floors we would have been able to see St. Peter's!!). The breakfast is fabulous!! The best we had in our 2 weeks in Italy. We were only at the Splendide for 3 nights but wish we could have been there longer. We did lots of shopping at the nearby Spanish Steps and Via Veneto. We had dinner one night at the restaurant on the roof and it was wonderful but VERY pricey. You are paying more for the wonderful view of the city. The famous Harry's Bar and others on Via Veneto were very close by and had wonderful food for a much better value. Parking is very expensive here so try not to have a car. Driving is Rome is not fun anyway so if you do have one, park it and forget about it until the end of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok for a 5-star. The breakfast was not very good. Especcially the breakfast service was very unattenditive. We also stayed at the Cavalieri Hilton which was much nice. Spanish steps are in walking distance (10-15 minutes)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect , 100% satisfaction quaranteed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendide Royal in July 2005. The hotel is gorgeous and the service was outstanding. The location of this hotel was great, it was in walking distance to most of the attractions. Breakfast was included during our stay and I would like to mention that it was magnificent! The fresh fruit, assorted cheeses and different pastries were great! The room was beautiful and accomodated us perfectly. The decor of the room and the bathroom were outstanding. I would highly recommend this hotel to my family and friends. Thanks for the great memories.

Reviews.Title: “Like a palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my octogenarian father to Rome for a weeks holiday, to realise a life long ambition. We arrived at the hotel very late after a very long flight. The reception was terrific. No messing about, smooth, quick which is exactly what we needed. We had a beautiful room overlooking the gardens. Dad'd first comment was "It's like a palace". The room was spacious, comfortable lounge and beds, and despite the street below very quiet (double glazing). We found the staff extremely helpful. We almost felt adopted by Fabiola who was always on hand to meet our needs, offer suggestions and make the necessary tour bookings for us. A great location near the Spanish Steps, walking distance to great shopping whilst being just that bit removed from the hustle and bustle. An outstanding restaurant on the seventh floor and plenty nearby from which to choose. A good sized bathroom, including a spa with strong jets (hard to findsometimes), although the shower could have been bigger. Overall a beautiful smaller hotel, quiet atmosphere, friendly, helpful and efficient staff in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Marchetta01
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my tenth trip to Rome, I have finally found a hotel that is perfect. The Hotel Spendide is simply the best; elegant, great service, perfect location. I highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Frang
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from Rome. From the moment we arrived at the "Splendide" we were treated like royalty. The interior of the hotel is beautifully decorated. The staff bent over backwards to accomadate our every need. We had originally booked a Junior Suite but were upgraded to a Suite, which was gorgeous. We had a terrace overlooking the Gardens, and the terrace wrapped around the entire suite. Room was beautiful appointed with the most modern facilities. I want to give a special thanks to "Ivan Crisante" whom went above and beyond to schedule all of our tours and take care of all of our needs. As far as location goes, I thought it was perfect. It was a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, and in walking distance to the Via Vento. Of course, we took cab to the Vatican, which was about 8 Euros. Breakfast was equally as good, it was the best eggs that were served through our whole trip through Italy. This is truly a 5 star hotel and would recommend to anyone that is not on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The Splendide--Charming, Intimate, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Splendide for three nights in August 2005. We found the staff to be very professional, gracious, and helpful. Our room was beautiful. The location was ideal--on a less-crowded street but within easy walking distance of Via Veneto and almost everything we wanted to explore on foot. We recommend the Splendide wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “What a sleeper!”
Reviews.Author: Greekchick
Reviews.Content: I am shocked that this hotel does not get more attention. We stayed there for four nights. Excellent central location. Five star rooms and bath. Comfortable bed. Incredible fine dining with amazing views of Villa Borghese. We walked to everything except Vatican City, of course. Great location for shopping! The concierge was very helpful and the service was great. The breakfast was plentiful and fresh . This hotel should rate right on top with the other five stars. The only thing missing for me was a swimming pool! You will not be dissappointed if you choose this property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: Maury5454
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Splendide for 3 nights in August 2005 and had a great time. Even though we had one of the smaller rooms without a view, the decor was very luxurious, it was immaculately clean, and, unlike most European air coditioning, this worked great and kept the room as cool as we liked. The breakfast buffet was very nice, highlighted by the view over the park. The roof top restaurant was excellent (and expensive!). We chose the Splendide partly for the location, since we think that the Via Veneto area is the best in Rome for being a tourist. The only drawback is that, being on the top of the hill, its always uphill to walk back after a long day of sightseeing in the city. (We cheated a few times and took taxis back.) Service was top notch all the way round, although we did not utilize the concierge services. For the price that we paid during the "low" August season (about €230 including the breakfast buffet), we thought the Splendide was great value. It would still be a good value at higher prices.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
