Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in June. The original reservation was for 4 nights. The "lobby" was beautiful and very bright -- our room was also lovely. The hotel was beautifully decorated and the staff was extremely accommodating. The restaurant was supurb and the view unimaginable. We, unfortunately had to checkout early due to a family situation at home -- the staff was very helpful and couldn't have done more for us to expedite our trip to the airport. Had we booked our resercvation directly with the hotel, rather than thru one of the internet services, we would have received a full refund for the 2 nights we missed, Unfortunately we had to forfeit our paid in full reservation for those 2 evenings. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this is a very charming and sophisticated hotel...the building and the rooms are beautiful, with all of the amenities one would expect in a top notch hotel. The bathrooms are large and well appointed. There is a lovely rooftop breakfast served every morning, a very relaxing way to start the day. What really sets this hotel apart from the other small hotels we stayed in was the knowledgeable and helpful staff. They were efficient and charming and had great recommendations for dining and sight seing. The concierge(s) really made our stay very memorable. My criticisms of the hotel are the same as those mentioned by the other travellers...the exorbitant cost of the extras and the lack of a reasonable room service menu. Since we were travelling with pre-teens this was a real inconvenience. Overall I would highly recommend the hotel. It has the right location, great rooms, and a wonderful staff at a reasonable(for Rome) price.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel within comfortable walking distance of all the main sites and set just off the main street, Via Veneto. If you prefer waking up overlooking beautiful parkland rather than noisy streets then this is the place to stay in Rome. The hotel is spotlessly clean, all the staff are very polite and helpful in a sincere way rather than because they expect a tip. Deluxe Rooms and Suites overlook the Villa Borghese park and you should try to ensure you get a room on at least the 5th or 6th floor to take full advantage of the views. Room 507 is I think the only deluxe room in the hotel that has a small balcony and is worth getting if you don't want to pay for a suite. Dinner at the roof terrace restaurant, Mirabelle, is a must. For two people this will cost anything in the region of 200 - 300 Euros but, believe me, worth every penny. Breakfast is very good with a wide choice of fresh fruits, cheeses, meats, pastries as well as bacon, sausage and eggs. On the downside like previous reviews have mentioned, the bed linens are not the most comfortable and their poor quality does let down what is otherwise a fabulous hotel. The only other improvement would be the addition of a bar on the ground floor - a place to relax and enjoy a drink at the end of the day. The bar adjoining the roof terrace restaurant is too small and too formal to meet this requirement. Other good restaurants include: Papa Baccus, Via Toscana, 5 minutes walk from the hotel serving Tuscan dishes. Their speciality beef is excellent. Dinner will cost around 90 - 100 euros for two. If you are close to the Roman Forum do have lunch at "To Fly", Via di Sant Eufemia (Piazza Venezia). They serve a fabulous buffet lunch for just 9 euros and the staff are great. One restaurant to avoid at all costs unless you want to be ripped off is La Tavernetta Ristorante, 147 Via Sistina - just 5 minutes from the hotel. This guy cleverly seduces you into ordering dishes that are not priced on the menu then hits you with an outrageous bill. For example, lunch for two consisting of a bowl of average pasta and a side salad, 73 euros. You would be better off emptying your wallet into the street and letting the locals help themselves! Finally, if you want to pre-book a transfer from the airport to your hotel, try Romeinlimo ([--], e-mail: [--]) You won't have to give any credit card details when you book, just pay on the day. These guys are reliable and have some good quality cars. As a special treat book one of their S - Class Mercedes for around 70 euros. This is only 30 euros more than a beaten up taxi. Enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Splenide was Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: TonyaGN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a lovely trip to Rome and Florence. We originally booked with Splenide Royal for our first stay in Rome, and enjoyed the hotel so much that we decided to return there after our short visit to Florence. We definitely will return! This trip was to celebrate a few different occasions, and the staff of the Splendide Royal helped to make things perfect. The room: We reserved a standard room, which we found to be the perfect size. There was ample room to store our clothing, our (large) suitcases, and purchases. The bathroom was *huge* by European standards (my husband was thrilled with the fact that he could actually move about while he showered - :)). I'm sure the deluxe room would have been even nicer, but we were pleased with the standard room. Service: We found that everyone we dealt with provided excellent service. Arriving in August meant that few restaurants were open in Rome. Nonetheless, the concierge cheerfully went through the list of restaurants I selected to secure reservations. The rooms were cleaned both in the morning and in the evening, at which time slippers were laid out and any used towels changed. In addition to the wonderful service and comfortable room (I didn't find the linen sheets to be scratchy, and I generally prefer high thread count cotton), the hotel had a fitness room which I made regular use of. Despite the fact that it's not a large, it has the basics - treadmill, stationary bike, weights, and a weight center. Location: I disagree with the poster who said the location was not convenient - the Spanish Steps were less than a 10 minute walk, Piazza Barberini was an easy and quick (10 minutes or so) walk down Via Veneto, and Borghese with all of its museums and beautiful grounds for strolling was 5 minutes away. We tend to sightsee on foot, and had no problem walking to all the sites except the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Spendide was Splendid !”
Reviews.Author: IslandMB
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Roma where I spent 6 nights at the Splendide Royal in a Deluxe Room which was wonderfully decorated, with plenty of room in the both the main room and the marble bathroom . I had a king size bed, wooden desk, two chairs and a window that opens to the fresh air. Contrary to one of the prior reviews I saw, the location of the hotel is excellent - close to the top of Via Veneto and only 5 minutes away from the Spanish Steps. I love to walk the city, and St Peters and Ancient Rome (the forum, Collesum, etc) are a longer distance (take a taxi to St Peters if you are dressed nicely or in long pants). The service from check-in to check-out was excellent with a good English speaking staff for reception / concierge. The room was cleaned twice a day wonderfully and I never saw anyone ! Breakfast in the rooftop is a well laid out buffet with eggs, sausage, lot of fresh fruit and pastires. This was always a peaceful start to the day. I would have rated this hotel "excellent" but there are 2 issues that I have seen mentioned in previous reviews. They over-charge for supplemental items in the mini-bar (8 Euros for a coke) and for phone-calls. And, the sheets and linens are done with alot of startch; they are not soft that you would find with a top notch hotel. I most certainly would recommend this hotel and will likely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding rooftop restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel as part of our honeymoon and found it to be very nice. The room was on the smaller side, but nicely appointed. The service was good and the location was great (easy walk to the Spanish Steps, The Trevi Fountain, and the Villa Borghese). The absolute highlight was dinner at the rooftop restaurant, Mirabelle. While somewhat pricey, the food was outstanding, and the views of the city were unbelievable. Do not miss this experience if you stay in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not great location”
Reviews.Author: ELDerby
Reviews.Content: This hotel was unique. The coverted convent had great rooms - very luxurious. The restaurant was one of the best meals we had on our 2-week tour of Italy - definitely the best in Rome. The location was a bit to be desired. It was probably a 10 or so minute walk to the Spanish steps (not 2 blocks). I was 29 and my wife 25 (and both very active) when we visited. The public transit in Rome left something to be desire, so the location of this hotel wasn't particularly helpful - the nearest Metro stop is at the Spanish Steps. I would stay here again if I was prepared to be near the Pantheon at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from Italy. Our last stay was at the Splendide Royal. It was a wonderful experience. We were originally booked at the De Russie but after reading some reviews we changed to the Splendide Royal. A very good move. From check in to check out the staff was always attentive and friendly. As we were to check out very early the staff had breakfast boxed and ready for us upon our early departure. Our room was a top floor room with a large balcony and a wonderful view of the city. The decor of the room was very tasteful. The restaurant on the top floor was the finest dining experience we had in Rome, a must. The hotels location is two blocks from the top of the Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “Really Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently were in Rome and made reservations at the Hotel Splendide Royal. We were provided with a lovely room with balcony with a wonderful view of Rome and the Vatican. The desk staff and concierge were helpful and courteous beyond expectation. My wife recently broke a rib and required a really soft mattress which was immediately provided. Upon leaving Rome and the hotel for approximately two weeks, we requested the hotel to hold some of our luggage until our return to Rome. This was done, once again with graciousness and efficiency. All the E:mail tour reservations discussed with the concierge prior to our arrival were provided as represented. The Restaurant in the hotel was exceptional and is deserving of a 5 Star Rating as is the hotel itself. We travel extensively and found this small hotel to be centrally located and without doubt one of the best in its price category.

Reviews.Title: “How much we aooreciated this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days at the Hotel Splendide Royal in Rome from 9th to 18th June 2005. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The service at the hotel was first class, the attention to geusts' needs perfect, the ambience quite exceptional. The hotel also has an exceptionally fine cuisine and the atmosphere in the terrace restaurant, with a marvelous view of Rome and the Borghese Park was most rewarding. We would most certainly go there again on a future visit to Rome and would recommend the hotel and the efficient and attentive cares of the Management and the Staff. Yours truly, DA & EI GRAHAM

Reviews.Title: “Splendide okay but not really a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Spendide over the Memorial Day weekend - 3 nights. Room was lovely and spacious by Rome standards. Bath was very nice. Huge beautiful balcony with jasmine blooming on it. Separate bedroom from sitting area. Plenty of storage in the room. If you are expecting this to be a true 5 star hotel though - well - the beds are sure not the Four Seasons - they are small (the Europe std though) and hard and have pressed - maybe starched linen sheets. So if you are looking for a 5 star Four Seasons experience - change your expectation. It's nice. It's lovely - very Italian ornate decor. Service is okay but also not 5 Star. Doorman - handsome guy but despite some generous tips had a total attitude about doing anything - even hailing a cab for you. Called to front desk at 7 AM for an iron and was told - no one available for an iron until 7:30. Went to front desk at 8 AM to get Iron myself and was told no one still available to unlock cabinent. Also - if you like a casual bar to pop into at the end of the day - none is available. Only bar is in very stuffed shirt and extremely elegant restaurant at top of hotel. Tried the bar up there but it's tiny and very expensive just for an end of the day drink. So my bottom line - if you want a nice, clean place to stay with some luxuries - the Hotel Splendide is good. If you want a true 5 star experience in Rome - this isn't your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Aptly named hotel -- splendide indeed!”
Reviews.Author: DrH29
Reviews.Content: Our third time in Rome was the charm when we found this perfectly situated, luxurious, romantic hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Our room and bathroom were huge, squeaky clean, and there was no outside noise. The view from our large balcony was divine -- a view of St. Peter's Basilica -- as well as the beautiful Villa Borghese Park. Many of the famous sites in Rome (Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc.) were within easy walking distance from the hotel, a very important consideration for us when we search for a hotel in any city. The staff were so solicitous that we truly felt royal! We would definitely stay here again...and again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the Hotel Splendide Royal for a weekend in April, we have stayed in various 4 and 5 star Hotels in Europe and have always been generally pleased with the service we have received, our stay at the HSR has changed our views on what excellent service really is. From the time we arrived to the time our break had come to an end the staff at the Hotel Splendide Royal made us feel like Royalty and there was nothing they wouldn't do for us, and they never made us feel awkward or feel as if we were putting them out, even at 1am when we returned from the Vatican (which is a short taxi drive from the Hotel) they greeted us with a smile and asked if there was anything they could do for us. The suite we stayed in was very clean and comfortable the entire Hotel was always very clean and is very well presented. We will be using the Hotel Splendide Royal again and would recommend this Hotel to anyone if looking for a romantic getaway a Honeymoon or just a family break like ourselves. The Hotel is situated in a very upmarket part of the City with lots of nice Shops and restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “A joy for the mind and senses”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overlooking the Villa Borghese Park and just off the Via Veneto, the Splendide Royal is a jewel. The public areas are colorful and elegantly furnished. The breakfast room is a mini Garden of Eden;the view from it as well as main restaurant are breath-taking and the food was delicious. The staff were not only professional, but warm and helpful. The suite was lovely - so was the jacuzzi - and the box of chocolates was a very nice touch!! Truly a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “opulant 5 star in good location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a little perplexed when we found that on arrival at the Savoy we had been double booked and transferred to the Hotel Splendide Royal. Knowing nothing about the hotel we were pleasantly surprised on arrival to find 5 star attention from the moment we entered the lobby. The decor in the reception areas was grandiose and remained so throughout the hotel. We had booked a double and a twin which were honoured and both rooms were spacious and opulent. Reception staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and breakfast couldn't be faulted with a good range of fresh fruit, cereals and cooked fare. all consumed with a breathtaking view of the city. The hotel is in an excellant location being within 5 minutes walk of the Spanish steps and local restaurants offering good quality and value cuisine. This hotel boasts a small gym but no other amenities such as sauna, spa or jacuzzi which would be the only negative comment on this five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was a fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stay in rome for easter and discover a fantastic hotel: the Splendide Royal! We booked the hotel through internet however we never heard about this new property and we were surprise about the level of the service and especially by the quality of its rooms. Our room was at 6th floor facing Villa Borghese and have an extraordinary terrace with view of all the city, the bathroom with daylight was very large with plenty of attention and amenities. We also tried the rooftop restaurant Mirabelle and this was also a special experience: quite expensive but great food, fantastic atmosphere, top level service and a unique view. I certainly recommended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is ideally situated for all tourist attractions. It is located on a hill with excellent views of the city from the Restaurant/Bar and Breakfast Room. The Breakfast Room is a terrace style which is coverered during the Winter. Even though the Breakfast Room was heated, at breakfast time we found this room to be a little cold during our Winter stay. This Hotel is situated in a quite area but still within walking distance of attractions. This Hotel is of superior decor, our room was very warm and comfortable but we found it to be a little on the small side for a five star rating. Our lasting impression was that of the staff, they were outstanding. From the polite staff who cleaned our rooms, the smiling and friendly staff who served during meal times to the happy reception staff, they were all extremely professional, helful and polite and made our stay very pleasant indeed. We would recommend this Hotel for it's location, comfort and excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “do you really know this hotel”
Reviews.Author: marytravel
Reviews.Content: we stayed here before christmas 04. it was good enough, the staff were wonderfull, we had great tours which they recommended with a guide from angeltoursrome he was great, went the extra. some of the eating places they recommended were not so good. but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY AND COZY”
Reviews.Author: Bill20099
Reviews.Content: First time in ROMA, and what an experience. We arrived tired from a long 14 hour flight. Hotel Splendide Royal placed our needs as priority, and got us into our lovely room within a few minutes. The staff was friendly, attentive, and professional. The room was very nice, and quite roomy. The hotel is located in a very nice, clean, and safe neighborhood. From our hotel, we walked every day in every direction, day or night to a fun, or historical sight. Great restaurants, snack places, shopping, and people watching very close by. Remember! Before you take a trip, always read and study your destination, and all places you want to see. It was so much easier and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine, restaurant is A1”
Reviews.Author: Rajrouj
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very friendly staff (a bit too much sometimes), good location. However, breakfeast is dissappointing for a 5* (especially the coffee), pay TV doesn't function properly, no radio to be found, and shower pressure is weak. Nothing terrific about the view over the Borghese villa. One of the windows has no curtain and the morning light can therefore be a nuissance. Best part is the restaurant, with a truly A1 staff and chef. Otherwise, hotel alone is just average for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: amarone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this beautiful hotel last August. It was our first time in Rome and I very much doubt we could have found anywhere else more perfect! Our room was gorgeous and the attention to detail was thoughtful. The staff were very discreet but friendly. One of the most romantic hotels we've ever stayed in. Highlight was sipping champagne on the rooftop balcony whilst gazing out over Rome - idyllic! Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “A Must for Your Shortlist”
Reviews.Author: jasonmymail
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Splendide in a Junior Suite. We paid GBP 923 for two people with breakfast inc all taxes through a special offer with Expedia (flights not included). A standard room would have cost us about GBP 550, and a deluxe about GBP 675 in January/February. Location 4/5 The Splendide is located close to the Via Veneto, facing the Villa Borghese Park (well worth a visit). Many of Rome's top hotels are concentrated in this area - The Eden, Westin Excelsior, Palace Boscolo, Majestic. It's a good and fairly central location, slightly outside the very heart of the city and quieter for it. It's position on raised ground gives good views of the park and some (limited) views of Rome's roof tops from the 5th floor where the suites are located. The nearest attraction is the Spanish Steps, about a 10 minute walk, where you will also find the metro station. Other attractions are, Trevi Fountain (15mins), Pantheon (15/20mins), St Peters/Vatican (30/40mins) Coliseum (30/40mins), all depending on route. To be honest there's not much happening in the immediate vicinity. Things are livelier 5 minutes away at the Via Veneto which has a small selection of restaurants, but for choice and better value you're better off wandering the streets at the foot of the Spanish Steps which are a good 10 minute walk. Hotel 4/5 A medium/large hotel with smallish but very nicely finished communal areas. It's very Italian in style but not so grandiose as to make you feel uncomfortable if you're not dressed in Channel couture. That's the nice thing about the Splendide, smart but not snobby and we didn’t feel ashamed in trainers which are essential for those long sightseeing days. Guests were predominantly English with some Italian businessmen (although tourist couples made up the bulk of guests, Splendide does not have the air of a business hotel), heard a few French voices and one American, but no Japanese. Staff 5/5 Friendly and welcoming. Everyone was pleasant and discrete and my requests both pre-check-in and during the stay were all met professionally and without problem. We didn't use the concierge. The doormen were charming and organised taxis quickly and efficiently for us. Also they didn't insist on a hotel limo to the airport like many of these 5* hotels often do - they found us a 40 euro standard taxi back to Fiumicino airport. Room 5/5 On our arrival a complimentary box of beautiful Italian chocolates was waiting for us, and every evening a mini box of 2 fruit sweets was also left on turn-down. Junior suites are well appointed, if not quite as huge as promised by those 360 degree photo shots - oh and those walls, that's not wallpaper, it's stretched fabrics - classy. Our room had a large private terrace with a table/chairs and views over the park, a shame it was too cold to really appreciate this but I can imagine that during the warmer summer evenings this would be a wonderful way to spend an evening. Best room feature was a Jacuzzi bath with lots of controls to soothe those aches after a long day's sightseeing. TV with BBC World for brits, CNN/ABC for Americans and TV2/TV5 for the French. A small selection of movies at 14 euro each also available, with a massively overpriced minibar if you want to stay in and have money to burn. Climate control seemed to work well, but as it was cold during our stay can't speak for the air cooling element. The bed was absolutely huge, firm but comfortable and dressed in linen which was not just made but changed everyday - what a treat, crisp/clean linen every night! In fact the room was immaculate, exceptionally well cleaned and even the umpteen chrome fixtures and fittings in the bathroom were all spotless and sparkling, as was all the glass. As you have to place your room key card in a slot on entry the staff know whether you're in or out, so you’re guaranteed that every time you come back to the room it's been tidied/cleaned, made sure towels are renewed and bathroom stocks replenished. The bathroom was large and finished in marble, twin sinks, separate standup/sitdown shower and a bidet. Water pressure and hot water were adequate. Freebies included their own brand (but very nice) bath foam, bath salts, shampoo, body lotion, vanity set, sewing kit, shoe shine and slippers. The only minor disappointments were, no trouser press and no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We like to pop back to the hotel mid/late afternoon for a break/rest and a cuppa - if you wanted to do that you'd be forced to pay 7-9 euros for a room service coffee. Room service was available and not wildly overpriced either, considering that the hotel houses the Mirabelle, one of Rome's most highly regarded restaurants. Outside a two course meal with wine was averaging us 50/60 euros - you're probably talking 80/90 euros for the same in-room (without wine, but easily bought outside) and with a lovely terrace to eat on I can imagine this as being a very pleasant way to spend a warm romantic evening. Breakfasts 4/5 Great views from the 6th floor breakfast room where you can enjoy breakfast between 6:30AM and 10:30AM. Must be lovely in the summer when they open up the sides as in the winter it's tented. The buffet wasn't large but adequate. Hot food is limited to scrambled egg, sausage & bacon - very good too - perhaps they could do other hot foods on request but we didn't ask. A selection of cereals, fresh cut fruit, cheeses, yogurts, cold meats, breads, pastries and cakes meant that although the spread wasn't nearly as large as those offered by some hotels I've stayed in, there was actually ample choice for virtually all palates. Overall 4.5/5 Can't fault the hotel itself, and a junior suite is a real treat especially at the price we paid - bargain. Would I stay here again? Possibly. Why only possibly? For me personally I like to be right in the thick of it, there's nothing better than looking out the window and taking in the bustling city from a hotel in one of the city's central squares. The Splendide does have lovely views of the park and can't be beaten for quiet romance in a fairly central location, but for me it's a bit like staying in London's Marble Arch or on Park Lane, only 1/2 a mile away from Piccadilly Circus and Soho but just not right smack bank in the middle of it all. True it is only 10/15 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and the restaurants there but after a heavy meal it's a chore to walk uphill for 10 minutes every night to your hotel. OK, OK I'm lazy and I want it all on my doorstep - that's just me - but chances are you'll be rushing around in a short space of time to see all of Rome's sights and that extra 15/20 minutes there and 15/20 minutes back everyday has to be taken into account. Next time I stay in Rome I'll probably go for something close to the Pantheon (we seemed to cross there or near there on our way to/from most of the sights) but if you're younger and fitter than me then the Splendide doesn't lose any points for location. Would I recommend the Splendide, is the question you should be asking, and the answer to that is absolutely! It is a fabulous hotel that ticks so many boxes - it's luxurious without being snobby, it's very close to the heart of Rome but quiet too, it's romantic and has lovely views, the staff are great, it's very clean and very reasonably priced for the standard. Book it without hesitation – you won’t be disappointed – and have a great time in Rome – it’s a wonderful city with a huge amount to offer tourists of all tastes.

Reviews.Title: “It's a gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights last November (Thanksgiving week) at the Splendide Royal. It was our first time in Rome. We picked the hotel because of the great reviews, and we were happy with stay there. Our Deluxe room was very charming and comfortable with a balcony overlooking the Villa Borghese. The breakfast buffet included with our package was a great way to start the morning with beautiful views from the terrace and the food was good. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was closeby to the metro station and it is easy walking distance to Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. We enjoyed dinner at some of the fabulous restaurants in Via Veneto. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends, and would definitely want to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Splendide Royal was a great experience”
Reviews.Author: PatCT202
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights in early December at the Splendide Royal. It was our first time in Rome and we were visiting our daughter who was in Rome for a semester. We picked the hotel because of the reviews on this board and were very glad we did. Our room was very charming and comfortable with a little balcony overlooking the Villa Borghese. The service was excellent! We wanted to take our daughter and a friend to florence for the day and they got us train tickets, gave us great tips and generally took care of it for us! We also liked the location-easy to walk to the Via Veneto and dine at one of the many sidewalk cafes (we liked Cafe Alex the best) or to the spanish steps. We also had dinner at the restaurant-it was very good but very pricey! We were looking for charm, low key atmosphere and thoughtful service and got it all! Would go back again and will recommend it to friends

Reviews.Title: “First choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Splendide over Chrismas. It was her first visit in Rome and I wanted to make an impression. The hotel is located in an ideal position very close to the centre but in a quiet street near the famous via Veneto. On arrival, without asking, we were given a free upgrade to a Junior Suite, small but elegant and with all the conforts. The terrace overloocked the beautiful Villa Borghese park and there was a very welcomed bottle of champagne and a box of chocolates waiting for us. The service was prompt and efficient (the room was serviced while we were at breakfast) but the buffet breakfast was very low quality with dried up bread and cakes, watery scrambled eggs with foul tasting sausages, sour orange juice and cold cappuccino. The Christmas lunch at the roof top restaurant Mirabelle was excellent, although not worth 140 euros (ours was part of the package) and the view over the whole city was breathtaking. What really made our stay at the Splendide memorable was Ivan the concierge. There is no information, advice or booking that that Ivan cannot provide. On arrival he surprised us with two free tickets for the midnight Mass at St.Peter which are very difficult to obtain and when my wife left her jacket in the room on departure Ivan had it sent to my home in England and arrived within two days. No wonder he is considered the best concierge in Rome and teaches his profession at one of Rome's top hoteliers school. We were charged an average of 300 euros per night including Christmas lunch, wich I think is very reasonable for an hotel of this class in Rome. My wife loved her first visit to Rome in spite of the rain and we will definitely go back and stay at the Splendide Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: taches
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure I understand all the superlative ratings for this hotel on this website. It was above average, but had plenty of drawbacks. Cons: - I agree with the reviewer who found the decor a bit cheap-looking: too much marble and faux-gold. - The bedroom we stayed in was quite small. - When we asked the concierge for a dinner recommendation -- somewhere where the locals eat -- he sent us to a nasty little place which had not one single italian client but was filled with foreigners who -- like us -- seemed to have been sent by hotels where the concierge received a "kickback" for sending us. The two of us were charged 12 Euros for a small basket of bread! Ugh. I hate concierges who live for kickbacks rather than for keeping the clients happy. Pros: - Big bathroom with a bath that was actually long enough for us to stretch out (many european baths are too short for comfort) - the hotel was fairly recently renovated, so it doesn't look at all "tired" or grubby - our room looked over a non-descript courtyard but we were delighted by how quiet it was. It was silent! - Decent location; within easy walking distance of Spanish steps - I got a price that was well below any other comparative Roman hotels

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Superb”
Reviews.Author: MW
Reviews.Content: This hotel can pride itself on 4 elements: Service - is impeccable, the staff are very polite and very helpful. They will do everything to ensure your stay is of great enjoyment. Food - the food is of the highest standard and again the service is fantastic Location - the setting on the edge of the Villa Borghese is just sublime. We had a suite with a view over to Villa Medici and the Vatican in the distance. So romantic! Rooms - very Italian, luxurious and Spacious. The only bad thing is that we found it very hard to leave!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the airport until the moment we left Hotel Splendide organised everything and it was the first time I can honestly say that it was a hassle free holiday. We are pretty demanding at the best of times so it was a breath of fresh air that everything was laid on and done with a smile. Hotel Splendide organised brilliant trips and recommended the best restaurants one of which was on the 7th floor of the hotel called the Mirabelle which overlooks Rome. Make contact with Ivan, the concierge before you arrive and put the feet up for the rest of the holidayas everything is taking care of. All the best, Philip

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Splendid Royal for two nights in October, 2004. This was out first trip to Italy. This hotel was the nicest of our stay, although, we paid over twice the price for our hotel in Venice. Great location, courteous and helpful staff. GREAT BED and LINENS. The rooftop restaurant on the terrace is one of the most beautiful, romantic spots we have ever dined.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, restaurant, value”
Reviews.Author: dbesser
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights from the 3rd - 5th of November. Location is very good (10 mins to Spanish Steps, Via de Corso, etc.) and the lobby is gorgeous. Mirabelle is a great restaurant on the top floor (solid wine list -- a little pricey compared to many I've seen in Rome), and has a fantastic view, particularly at sunset. Room was large and nicely appointed, marble bathroom, all that you would expect from a 5 star hotel, pillows were a little hard, though. Street noise is not a problem like it is currently at the Regina Baglioni. Service from Ivan the concierge was fantastic, but indifferent from the other concierges. Will be staying another night on the 15th of November and would definitely recommend this hotel -- great 5 star for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been excellent, BUT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old son and I spent 6 nights at the Slendide Royale where the service was delightful and the rooms comfortable. I would have given them an excellent rating, but they calculated my hotel bill incorrectly. The good news is they admitted their errors and apologized. The bad news is I still do not have a credit after many inquiries and several months. Read your bill carefully....this is certainly NOT the service I would expect from a 4.5 star hotel. Too bad, really!
